verses.sanskrit_deva: प॒प्राथ॒ क्षां महि॒ दंसो॒ व्यु१॒॑र्वीमुप॒ द्यामृ॒ष्वो बृ॒हदि॑न्द्र स्तभायः अधा॑रयो॒ रोद॑सी दे॒वपु॑त्रे प्र॒त्ने मा॒तरा॑ य॒ह्वी ऋ॒तस्य॑
verses.transliteration: paprā́tha kṣā́m máhi dáṃso vy ùrvī́m  úpa dyā́m r̥ṣvó br̥hád indra stabhāyaḥ  ádhārayo ródasī deváputre  pratné mātárā yahvī́ r̥tásya

translation.text: Thou hast spread out wide earth, a mighty marvel, and, high thyself, propped lofty heaven, O Indra. Both worlds, whose Sons are Gods, thou hast supported, young, Mothers from old time ofholy Order.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध॑ त्वा॒ विश्वे॑ पु॒र इ॑न्द्र दे॒वा एकं॑ त॒वसं॑ दधिरे॒ भरा॑य अदे॑वो॒ यद॒भ्यौहि॑ष्ट दे॒वान्त्स्व॑र्षाता वृणत॒ इन्द्र॒मत्र॑
verses.transliteration: ádha tvā víśve purá indra devā́ḥ-  ékaṃ tavásaṃ dadhire bhárāya  ádevo yád abhy aúhiṣṭa devā́n  svàrṣātā vr̥ṇata índram átra

translation.text: Yea, Indra, all the Deities installed thee their one strong Champion in the van for battle. What time the godless was the Gods' assailant, Indra they chose to win the light of heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध॒ द्यौश्चि॑त्ते॒ अप॒ सा नु वज्रा॑द्द्वि॒तान॑मद्भि॒यसा॒ स्वस्य॑ म॒न्योः अहिं॒ यदिन्द्रो॑ अ॒भ्योह॑सानं॒ नि चि॑द्वि॒श्वायुः॑ श॒यथे॑ ज॒घान॑
verses.transliteration: ádha dyaúś cit te ápa sā́ nú vájrād  dvitā́namad bhiyásā svásya manyóḥ  áhiṃ yád índro abhyóhasānaṃ  ní cid viśvā́yuḥ śayáthe jaghā́na

translation.text: Yea, e'en that heaven itself of old bent backward before thy bolt, in terror of its anger, When Indra, life of every living creature, smote down within his lair the assailing Dragon.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध॒ त्वष्टा॑ ते म॒ह उ॑ग्र॒ वज्रं॑ स॒हस्र॑भृष्टिं ववृतच्छ॒ताश्रि॑म् निका॑मम॒रम॑णसं॒ येन॒ नव॑न्त॒महिं॒ सं पि॑णगृजीषिन्
verses.transliteration: ádha tváṣṭā te mahá ugra vájraṃ  sahásrabhr̥ṣṭiṃ vavr̥tac chatā́śrim  níkāmam arámaṇasaṃ yéna  návantam áhiṃ sám piṇag r̥jīṣin

translation.text: Yea, Strong One! Tvashṭar turned for thee, the Mighty, the bolt with thousand spikes and hundred edges, Eager and prompt at will, wherewith thou crushedst the boasting Dragon, O impetuous Hero.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वर्धा॒न्यं विश्वे॑ म॒रुतः॑ स॒जोषाः॒ पच॑च्छ॒तं म॑हि॒षाँ इ॑न्द्र॒ तुभ्य॑म् पू॒षा विष्णु॒स्त्रीणि॒ सरां॑सि धावन्वृत्र॒हणं॑ मदि॒रमं॒शुम॑स्मै
verses.transliteration: várdhān yáṃ víśve marútaḥ sajóṣāḥ  pácac chatám mahiṣā́m̐ indra túbhyam  pūṣā́ víṣṇus trī́ṇi sárāṃsi dhāvan  vr̥traháṇam madirám aṃśúm asmai

translation.text: He dressed a hundred buffaloes, O Indra, for thee whom all accordant Maruts strengthen. He, Pûshan Vishṇu, poured forth three great vessels to him, the juice that cheers, that slaughters Vr̥itra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ क्षोदो॒ महि॑ वृ॒तं न॒दीनां॒ परि॑ष्ठितमसृज ऊ॒र्मिम॒पाम् तासा॒मनु॑ प्र॒वत॑ इन्द्र॒ पन्थां॒ प्रार्द॑यो॒ नीची॑र॒पसः॑ समु॒द्रम्
verses.transliteration: ā́ kṣódo máhi vr̥táṃ nadī́nām  páriṣṭhitam asr̥ja ūrmím apā́m  tā́sām ánu praváta indra pánthām  prā́rdayo nī́cīr apásaḥ samudrám

translation.text: Thou settest free the rushing wave of waters, the floods' great swell encompassed and obstructed. Along steep slopes their course thou tumedst, Indra, directed downward, speeding to the ocean.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा ता विश्वा॑ चकृ॒वांस॒मिन्द्रं॑ म॒हामु॒ग्रम॑जु॒र्यं स॑हो॒दाम् सु॒वीरं॑ त्वा स्वायु॒धं सु॒वज्र॒मा ब्रह्म॒ नव्य॒मव॑से ववृत्यात्
verses.transliteration: evā́ tā́ víśvā cakr̥vā́ṃsam índram  mahā́m ugrám ajuryáṃ sahodā́m  suvī́raṃ tvā svāyudháṃ suvájram  ā́ bráhma návyam ávase vavr̥tyāt

translation.text: So may our new prayer bring thee to protect us, thee well-armed Hero with thy bolt of thunder, Indra, who made these worlds, the Strong, the ty, who never groweth old, the victory-giver.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स नो॒ वाजा॑य॒ श्रव॑स इ॒षे च॑ रा॒ये धे॑हि द्यु॒मत॑ इन्द्र॒ विप्रा॑न् भ॒रद्वा॑जे नृ॒वत॑ इन्द्र सू॒रीन्दि॒वि च॑ स्मैधि॒ पार्ये॑ न इन्द्र
verses.transliteration: sá no vā́jāya śrávasa iṣé ca  rāyé dhehi dyumáta indra víprān  bharádvāje nr̥váta indra sūrī́n  diví ca smaidhi pā́rye na indra

translation.text: So, Indra, form us brilliant holy singers for strength, for glory, and for food and riches. Give Bharadvâja hero patrons, Indra Indra, be ours upon the day of trial.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒या वाजं॑ दे॒वहि॑तं सनेम॒ मदे॑म श॒तहि॑माः सु॒वीराः॑
verses.transliteration: ayā́ vā́jaṃ deváhitaṃ sanema  mádema śatáhimāḥ suvī́rāḥ

translation.text: With this may we obtain strength God-appointed, and brave sons gladden us through a hundred winters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमु॑ ष्टुहि॒ यो अ॒भिभू॑त्योजा व॒न्वन्नवा॑तः पुरुहू॒त इन्द्रः॑ अषा॑ळ्हमु॒ग्रं सह॑मानमा॒भिर्गी॒र्भिर्व॑र्ध वृष॒भं च॑र्षणी॒नाम्
verses.transliteration: tám u ṣṭuhi yó abhíbhūtyojāḥ-  vanvánn ávātaḥ puruhūtá índraḥ  áṣāḷham ugráṃ sáhamānam ābhír  gīrbhír vardha vr̥ṣabháṃ carṣaṇīnā́m

translation.text: GLORIFY him whose might is all-surpassing, Indra the much-invoked who fights uninjured. Magnify with these songs the never-vanquished, the Strong, the Bull of men, the Mighty Victor.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स यु॒ध्मः सत्वा॑ खज॒कृत्स॒मद्वा॑ तुविम्र॒क्षो न॑दनु॒माँ ऋ॑जी॒षी बृ॒हद्रे॑णु॒श्च्यव॑नो॒ मानु॑षीणा॒मेकः॑ कृष्टी॒नाम॑भवत्स॒हावा॑
verses.transliteration: sá yudhmáḥ sátvā khajakŕ̥t samádvā  tuvimrakṣó nadanumā́m̐ r̥jīṣī́  br̥hádreṇuś cyávano mā́nuṣīṇām  ékaḥ kr̥ṣṭīnā́m abhavat sahā́vā

translation.text: He, Champion, Hero, Warrior, Lord of battles, impetuous, loudly roaring, great destroyer, Who whirls the dust on high, alone, oerthrower, hath made all races of mankind his subjects.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं ह॒ नु त्यद॑दमायो॒ दस्यूँ॒रेकः॑ कृ॒ष्टीर॑वनो॒रार्या॑य अस्ति॑ स्वि॒न्नु वी॒र्यं१॒॑ तत्त॑ इन्द्र॒ न स्वि॑दस्ति॒ तदृ॑तु॒था वि वो॑चः
verses.transliteration: tváṃ ha nú tyád adamāyo dásyūm̐r  ékaḥ kr̥ṣṭī́r avanor ā́ryāya  ásti svin nú vīryàṃ tát ta indra  ná svid asti tád r̥tuthā́ ví vocaḥ

translation.text: Thou, thou alone, hast tamed the Dasyus; singly thou hast subdued the people for the Ârya. In this, or is it not, thine hero exploit, Indra? Declare it at the proper season.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सदिद्धि ते॑ तुविजा॒तस्य॒ मन्ये॒ सहः॑ सहिष्ठ तुर॒तस्तु॒रस्य॑ उ॒ग्रमु॒ग्रस्य॑ त॒वस॒स्तवी॒योऽर॑ध्रस्य रध्र॒तुरो॑ बभूव
verses.transliteration: sád íd dhí te tuvijātásya mánye  sáhaḥ sahiṣṭha turatás turásya  ugrám ugrásya tavásas távīyaḥ-  -áradhrasya radhratúro babhūva

translation.text: For true, I deem, thy strength is, thine the Mighty, thine, O Most Potent, thine the Conquering Victor; Strong, of the strong, Most Mighty, of the mighty, thine, driver of the churl to acts of bounty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तन्नः॑ प्र॒त्नं स॒ख्यम॑स्तु यु॒ष्मे इ॒त्था वद॑द्भिर्व॒लमङ्गि॑रोभिः हन्न॑च्युतच्युद्दस्मे॒षय॑न्तमृ॒णोः पुरो॒ वि दुरो॑ अस्य॒ विश्वाः॑
verses.transliteration: tán naḥ pratnáṃ sakhyám astu yuṣmé  itthā́ vádadbhir valám áṅgirobhiḥ  hánn acyutacyud dasmeṣáyantam  r̥ṇóḥ púro ví dúro asya víśvāḥ

translation.text: Be this our ancient bond of friendship with you and with Angirases here who speak of Vala. Thou, Wondrous, Shaker of things firm, didst smite him in his fresh strength, and force his doors and castles.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स हि धी॒भिर्हव्यो॒ अस्त्यु॒ग्र ई॑शान॒कृन्म॑ह॒ति वृ॑त्र॒तूर्ये॑ स तो॒कसा॑ता॒ तन॑ये॒ स व॒ज्री वि॑तन्त॒साय्यो॑ अभवत्स॒मत्सु॑
verses.transliteration: sá hí dhībhír hávyo ásty ugráḥ-  īśānakŕ̥n mahatí vr̥tratū́rye  sá tokásātā tánaye sá vajrī́  vitantasā́yyo abhavat samátsu

translation.text: With holy thoughts must he be called, the Mighty, showing his power in the great fight with Vr̥itra. He must be called to give us seed and offspring, the Thunderer must he moved and sped to battle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स म॒ज्मना॒ जनि॑म॒ मानु॑षाणा॒मम॑र्त्येन॒ नाम्नाति॒ प्र स॑र्स्रे स द्यु॒म्नेन॒ स शव॑सो॒त रा॒या स वी॒र्ये॑ण॒ नृत॑मः॒ समो॑काः
verses.transliteration: sá majmánā jánima mā́nuṣāṇām  ámartyena nā́mnā́ti prá sarsre  sá dyumnéna sá śávasotá rāyā́  sá vīryèṇa nŕ̥tamaḥ sámokāḥ

translation.text: He in his might, with name that lives for ever, hath far surpassed all human generations. He, most heroic, hath his home with splendour, with glory and with riches and with valour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स यो न मु॒हे न मिथू॒ जनो॒ भूत्सु॒मन्तु॑नामा॒ चुमु॑रिं॒ धुनिं॑ च वृ॒णक्पिप्रुं॒ शम्ब॑रं॒ शुष्ण॒मिन्द्रः॑ पु॒रां च्यौ॒त्नाय॑ श॒यथा॑य॒ नू चि॑त्
verses.transliteration: sá yó ná muhé ná míthū jáno bhū́t  sumántunāmā cúmuriṃ dhúniṃ ca  vr̥ṇák pípruṃ śámbaraṃ śúṣṇam índraḥ  purā́ṃ cyautnā́ya śayáthāya nū́ cit

translation.text: Stranger to guile, who ne'er was false or faithless, bearing a name that may be well remembered, Indra crushed Chumuri, Dhuni, Ṣambara, Pipru, and Ṣushṇa, that their castles fell in ruin.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒दाव॑ता॒ त्वक्ष॑सा॒ पन्य॑सा च वृत्र॒हत्या॑य॒ रथ॑मिन्द्र तिष्ठ धि॒ष्व वज्रं॒ हस्त॒ आ द॑क्षिण॒त्राभि प्र म॑न्द पुरुदत्र मा॒याः
verses.transliteration: udā́vatā tvákṣasā pányasā ca  vr̥trahátyāya rátham indra tiṣṭha  dhiṣvá vájraṃ hásta ā́ dakṣiṇatrā́-  -abhí prá manda purudatra māyā́ḥ

translation.text: With saving might that must be praised and lauded, Indra, ascend thy car to smite down Vr̥itra. In thy right hand hold fast thy bolt of thunder, and weaken, Bounteous Lord, his art and magic.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निर्न शुष्कं॒ वन॑मिन्द्र हे॒ती रक्षो॒ नि ध॑क्ष्य॒शनि॒र्न भी॒मा ग॒म्भी॒रय॑ ऋ॒ष्वया॒ यो रु॒रोजाध्वा॑नयद्दुरि॒ता द॒म्भय॑च्च
verses.transliteration: agnír ná śúṣkaṃ vánam indra hetī́  rákṣo ní dhakṣy aśánir ná bhīmā́  gambhīráya r̥ṣváyā yó rurója-  -ádhvānayad duritā́ dambháyac ca

translation.text: As Agni, as the dart burns the dry forest, like the dread shaft burn down the fiends, O Indra; Thou who with high deep-reaching spear hast broken, hast covered over mischief and destroyed it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ स॒हस्रं॑ प॒थिभि॑रिन्द्र रा॒या तुवि॑द्युम्न तुवि॒वाजे॑भिर॒र्वाक् या॒हि सू॑नो सहसो॒ यस्य॒ नू चि॒ददे॑व॒ ईशे॑ पुरुहूत॒ योतोः॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ sahásram pathíbhir indra rāyā́  túvidyumna tuvivā́jebhir arvā́k  yāhí sūno sahaso yásya nū́ cid  ádeva ī́śe puruhūta yótoḥ

translation.text: With wealth, by thousand paths come hither, Agni, paths that bring ample strength, O thou Most Splendid. Come, Son of Strength, o'er whom, Invoked of many! the godless hath no power to keep thee distant.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र तु॑विद्यु॒म्नस्य॒ स्थवि॑रस्य॒ घृष्वे॑र्दि॒वो र॑रप्शे महि॒मा पृ॑थि॒व्याः नास्य॒ शत्रु॒र्न प्र॑ति॒मान॑मस्ति॒ न प्र॑ति॒ष्ठिः पु॑रुमा॒यस्य॒ सह्योः॑
verses.transliteration: prá tuvidyumnásya sthávirasya ghŕ̥ṣver  divó rarapśe mahimā́ pr̥thivyā́ḥ  nā́sya śátrur ná pratimā́nam asti  ná pratiṣṭhíḥ purumāyásya sáhyoḥ

translation.text: From heaven, from earth is bruited forth the greatness of him the firm, the fiery, the resplendent. No foe hath he, no counterpart, no refuge is there from him the Conqueror full of wisdom

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र तत्ते॑ अ॒द्या कर॑णं कृ॒तं भू॒त्कुत्सं॒ यदा॒युम॑तिथि॒ग्वम॑स्मै पु॒रू स॒हस्रा॒ नि शि॑शा अ॒भि क्षामुत्तूर्व॑याणं धृष॒ता नि॑नेथ
verses.transliteration: prá tát te adyā́ káraṇaṃ kr̥tám bhūt  kútsaṃ yád āyúm atithigvám asmai  purū́ sahásrā ní śiśā abhí kṣā́m  út tū́rvayāṇaṃ dhr̥ṣatā́ ninetha

translation.text: This day the deed that thou hast done is famous, when thou, for him, with many thousand others Laidest low Kutsa, Âyu, Âtithigva, and boldly didst deliver Tûrvayâṇa.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अनु॒ त्वाहि॑घ्ने॒ अध॑ देव दे॒वा मद॒न्विश्वे॑ क॒वित॑मं कवी॒नाम् करो॒ यत्र॒ वरि॑वो बाधि॒ताय॑ दि॒वे जना॑य त॒न्वे॑ गृणा॒नः
verses.transliteration: ánu tvā́highne ádha deva devā́ḥ-  mádan víśve kavítamaṃ kavīnā́m  káro yátra várivo bādhitā́ya  divé jánāya tanvè gr̥ṇānáḥ

translation.text: In thee, O God, the wisest of the Sages, all Gods were joyful when thou slewest Ahi. When lauded for thyself, thou gavest freedom to sore-afflicted Heaven and to the people.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अनु॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी तत्त॒ ओजोऽम॑र्त्या जिहत इन्द्र दे॒वाः कृ॒ष्वा कृ॑त्नो॒ अकृ॑तं॒ यत्ते॒ अस्त्यु॒क्थं नवी॑यो जनयस्व य॒ज्ञैः
verses.transliteration: ánu dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ tát ta ójaḥ-  -ámartyā jihata indra devā́ḥ  kr̥ṣvā́ kr̥tno ákr̥taṃ yát te ásti-  uktháṃ návīyo janayasva yajñaíḥ

translation.text: This power of thine both heaven and earth acknowledge, the deathless Gods acknowledge it, O Indra. Do what thou ne'er hast done, O Mighty Worker: beget a new hymn at thy sacrifices.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हाँ इन्द्रो॑ नृ॒वदा च॑र्षणि॒प्रा उ॒त द्वि॒बर्हा॑ अमि॒नः सहो॑भिः अ॒स्म॒द्र्य॑ग्वावृधे वी॒र्या॑यो॒रुः पृ॒थुः सुकृ॑तः क॒र्तृभि॑र्भूत्
verses.transliteration: mahā́m̐ índro nr̥vád ā́ carṣaṇiprā́ḥ-  utá dvibárhā amináḥ sáhobhiḥ  asmadryàg vāvr̥dhe vīryā̀ya-  -urúḥ pr̥thúḥ súkr̥taḥ kartŕ̥bhir bhūt

translation.text: GREAT, hero-like controlling men is Indra, unwasting in his powers, doubled in vastness. He, turned to us, hath grown to hero vigour: broad, wide, he hath been decked by those who serve him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑मे॒व धि॒षणा॑ सा॒तये॑ धाद्बृ॒हन्त॑मृ॒ष्वम॒जरं॒ युवा॑नम् अषा॑ळ्हेन॒ शव॑सा शूशु॒वांसं॑ स॒द्यश्चि॒द्यो वा॑वृ॒धे असा॑मि
verses.transliteration: índram evá dhiṣáṇā sātáye dhād  br̥hántam r̥ṣvám ajáraṃ yúvānam  áṣāḷhena śávasā śūśuvā́ṃsaṃ  sadyáś cid yó vāvr̥dhé ásāmi

translation.text: The bowl made Indra swift to gather booty, the High, the Lofty, Youthful, Undecaying, Him who hath waxed by strength which none may conquer, and even at once grown to complete perfection.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पृ॒थू क॒रस्ना॑ बहु॒ला गभ॑स्ती अस्म॒द्र्य१॒॑क्सं मि॑मीहि॒ श्रवां॑सि यू॒थेव॑ प॒श्वः प॑शु॒पा दमू॑ना अ॒स्माँ इ॑न्द्रा॒भ्या व॑वृत्स्वा॒जौ
verses.transliteration: pr̥thū́ karásnā bahulā́ gábhastī  asmadryàk sám mimīhi śrávāṃsi  yūthéva paśváḥ paśupā́ dámūnāḥ-  asmā́m̐ indrābhy ā́ vavr̥tsvājaú

translation.text: Stretch out those hands of thine, extend to us-ward thy wide capacious arms, and grant us glory. Like as the household herdsman guards the cattle, so move thou round about us in the combat.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं व॒ इन्द्रं॑ च॒तिन॑मस्य शा॒कैरि॒ह नू॒नं वा॑ज॒यन्तो॑ हुवेम यथा॑ चि॒त्पूर्वे॑ जरि॒तार॑ आ॒सुरने॑द्या अनव॒द्या अरि॑ष्टाः
verses.transliteration: táṃ va índraṃ catínam asya śākaír  ihá nūnáṃ vājayánto huvema  yáthā cit pū́rve jaritā́ra āsúr  ánedyā anavadyā́ áriṣṭāḥ

translation.text: Now, fain for strength, let us invite your Indra hither, who lieth hidden with his Heroes,– Free from all blame, without reproach, uninjured, e'en as were those who sang, of old, his praises.

verses.sanskrit_deva: धृ॒तव्र॑तो धन॒दाः सोम॑वृद्धः॒ स हि वा॒मस्य॒ वसु॑नः पुरु॒क्षुः सं ज॑ग्मिरे प॒थ्या॒३॒॑ रायो॑ अस्मिन्त्समु॒द्रे न सिन्ध॑वो॒ याद॑मानाः
verses.transliteration: dhr̥távrato dhanadā́ḥ sómavr̥ddhaḥ  sá hí vāmásya vásunaḥ purukṣúḥ  sáṃ jagmire pathyā̀ rā́yo asmin  samudré ná síndhavo yā́damānāḥ

translation.text: With steadfast laws, wealth-giver, strong through Soma, he hath much fair and precious food to feed us. In him unite all paths that lead to riches, like rivers that commingle with the ocean.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शवि॑ष्ठं न॒ आ भ॑र शूर॒ शव॒ ओजि॑ष्ठ॒मोजो॑ अभिभूत उ॒ग्रम् विश्वा॑ द्यु॒म्ना वृष्ण्या॒ मानु॑षाणाम॒स्मभ्यं॑ दा हरिवो माद॒यध्यै॑
verses.transliteration: śáviṣṭhaṃ na ā́ bhara śūra śávaḥ-  ójiṣṭham ójo abhibhūta ugrám  víśvā dyumnā́ vŕ̥ṣṇyā mā́nuṣāṇām  asmábhyaṃ dā harivo mādayádhyai

translation.text: Bring unto us the mightiest might, O Hero, strong and most potent force, thou great Subduer! All splendid vigorous powers of men vouchsafe us, Lord of Bay Steeds, that they may make us joyful.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्ते॒ मदः॑ पृतना॒षाळमृ॑ध्र॒ इन्द्र॒ तं न॒ आ भ॑र शूशु॒वांस॑म् येन॑ तो॒कस्य॒ तन॑यस्य सा॒तौ मं॑सी॒महि॑ जिगी॒वांस॒स्त्वोताः॑
verses.transliteration: yás te mádaḥ pr̥tanāṣā́ḷ ámr̥dhraḥ-  índra táṃ na ā́ bhara śūśuvā́ṃsam  yéna tokásya tánayasya sātaú  maṃsīmáhi jigīvā́ṃsas tvótāḥ

translation.text: Bring us, grown mighty in its strength, O Indra, thy friendly rapturous joy that wins the battle, Wherewith by thee assisted and triumphant, we may laud thee in gaining seed and offspring.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ भर॒ वृष॑णं॒ शुष्म॑मिन्द्र धन॒स्पृतं॑ शूशु॒वांसं॑ सु॒दक्ष॑म् येन॒ वंसा॑म॒ पृत॑नासु॒ शत्रू॒न्तवो॒तिभि॑रु॒त जा॒मीँरजा॑मीन्
verses.transliteration: ā́ no bhara vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ śúṣmam indra  dhanaspŕ̥taṃ śūśuvā́ṃsaṃ sudákṣam  yéna váṃsāma pŕ̥tanāsu śátrūn  távotíbhir utá jāmī́m̐r ájāmīn

translation.text: Indra, bestow on us the power heroic skilled and exceeding strong, that wins the booty, Wherewith, by thine assistance, we may conquer our foes in battle, be they kin or stranger.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ ते॒ शुष्मो॑ वृष॒भ ए॑तु प॒श्चादोत्त॒राद॑ध॒रादा पु॒रस्ता॑त् आ वि॒श्वतो॑ अ॒भि समे॑त्व॒र्वाङिन्द्र॑ द्यु॒म्नं स्व॑र्वद्धेह्य॒स्मे
verses.transliteration: ā́ te śúṣmo vr̥ṣabhá etu paścā́d  óttarā́d adharā́d ā́ purástāt  ā́ viśváto abhí sám etv arvā́ṅ  índra dyumnáṃ svàrvad dhehy asmé

translation.text: Let thine heroic strength come from behind us, before us, from above us or below us. From every side may it approach us, Indra. Give us the glory of the realm of splendour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नृ॒वत्त॑ इन्द्र॒ नृत॑माभिरू॒ती वं॑सी॒महि॑ वा॒मं श्रोम॑तेभिः ईक्षे॒ हि वस्व॑ उ॒भय॑स्य राज॒न्धा रत्नं॒ महि॑ स्थू॒रं बृ॒हन्त॑म्
verses.transliteration: nr̥vát ta indra nŕ̥tamābhir ūtī́  vaṃsīmáhi vāmáṃ śrómatebhiḥ  ī́kṣe hí vásva ubháyasya rājan  dhā́ rátnam máhi sthūrám br̥hántam

translation.text: With most heroic aid from thee, like heroes Indra, may we win wealth by deeds glory. Thou, King, art Lord of earthly, heavenly treasure: vouchsafe us riches vast, sublime, and lasting.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒रुत्व॑न्तं वृष॒भं वा॑वृधा॒नमक॑वारिं दि॒व्यं शा॒समिन्द्र॑म् वि॒श्वा॒साह॒मव॑से॒ नूत॑नायो॒ग्रं स॑हो॒दामि॒ह तं हु॑वेम
verses.transliteration: marútvantaṃ vr̥ṣabháṃ vāvr̥dhānám  ákavāriṃ divyáṃ śāsám índram  viśvāsā́ham ávase nū́tanāya-  -ugráṃ sahodā́m ihá táṃ huvema

translation.text: The Bull, whose strength hath waxed, whom Maruts follow, free-giving Indra, the Celestial Ruler, Mighty, all-conquering, the victory-giver, him let us call to grant us new protection.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जनं॑ वज्रि॒न्महि॑ चि॒न्मन्य॑मानमे॒भ्यो नृभ्यो॑ रन्धया॒ येष्वस्मि॑ अधा॒ हि त्वा॑ पृथि॒व्यां शूर॑सातौ॒ हवा॑महे॒ तन॑ये॒ गोष्व॒प्सु
verses.transliteration: jánaṃ vajrin máhi cin mányamānam  ebhyó nŕ̥bhyo randhayā yéṣv ásmi  ádhā hí tvā pr̥thivyā́ṃ śū́rasātau  hávāmahe tánaye góṣv apsú

translation.text: Give up the people who are high and haughty to these men and to me, O Thunder-wielder! Therefore upon the earth do we invoke thee, where heroes win, for sons and kine and waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒यं त॑ ए॒भिः पु॑रुहूत स॒ख्यैः शत्रोः॑शत्रो॒रुत्त॑र॒ इत्स्या॑म घ्नन्तो॑ वृ॒त्राण्यु॒भया॑नि शूर रा॒या म॑देम बृह॒ता त्वोताः॑
verses.transliteration: vayáṃ ta ebhíḥ puruhūta sakhyaíḥ  śátroḥ-śatror úttara ít syāma  ghnánto vr̥trā́ṇy ubháyāni śūra  rāyā́ madema br̥hatā́ tvótāḥ

translation.text: Through these thy friendships, God invoked of many! may we be victors over every foeman. Slaying both kinds of foe, may we, O Hero, be happy, helped by thee, with ample riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्यौर्न य इ॑न्द्रा॒भि भूमा॒र्यस्त॒स्थौ र॒यिः शव॑सा पृ॒त्सु जना॑न् तं नः॑ स॒हस्र॑भरमुर्वरा॒सां द॒द्धि सू॑नो सहसो वृत्र॒तुर॑म्
verses.transliteration: dyaúr ná yá indrābhí bhū́māryás  tasthaú rayíḥ śávasā pr̥tsú jánān  táṃ naḥ sahásrabharam urvarāsā́ṃ  daddhí sūno sahaso vr̥tratúram

translation.text: GIVE us wealth, Indra, that with might, as heaven o'ertops the earth, o'ercomes our foes in battle Wealth that brings thousands and that wins the corn-lands, wealth, Son of Strength! that vanquishes the foeman.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒वो न तुभ्य॒मन्वि॑न्द्र स॒त्रासु॒र्यं॑ दे॒वेभि॑र्धायि॒ विश्व॑म् अहिं॒ यद्वृ॒त्रम॒पो व॑व्रि॒वांसं॒ हन्नृ॑जीषि॒न्विष्णु॑ना सचा॒नः
verses.transliteration: divó ná túbhyam ánv indra satrā́-  -asuryàṃ devébhir dhāyi víśvam  áhiṃ yád vr̥trám apó vavrivā́ṃsaṃ  hánn r̥jīṣin víṣṇunā sacānáḥ

translation.text: Even as the power of Dyaus, to thee, O Indra, all Asura sway was by the Gods entrusted, When thou, Impetuous! leagued with Vishṇu, slewest Vr̥itra the Dragon who enclosed the waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तूर्व॒न्नोजी॑यान्त॒वस॒स्तवी॑यान्कृ॒तब्र॒ह्मेन्द्रो॑ वृ॒द्धम॑हाः राजा॑भव॒न्मधु॑नः सो॒म्यस्य॒ विश्वा॑सां॒ यत्पु॒रां द॒र्त्नुमाव॑त्
verses.transliteration: tū́rvann ójīyān tavásas távīyān  kr̥tábrahméndro vr̥ddhámahāḥ  rā́jābhavan mádhunaḥ somyásya  víśvāsāṃ yát purā́ṃ dartnúm ā́vat

translation.text: Indra, Strong, Victor, Mightier than the mighty, addressed with prayer and perfect in his splendour, Lord of the bolt that breaketh forts in pieces, became the King of the sweet juice of Soma..

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒तैर॑पद्रन्प॒णय॑ इ॒न्द्रात्र॒ दशो॑णये क॒वये॒ऽर्कसा॑तौ व॒धैः शुष्ण॑स्या॒शुष॑स्य मा॒याः पि॒त्वो नारि॑रेची॒त्किं च॒न प्र
verses.transliteration: śataír apadran paṇáya indrā́tra  dáśoṇaye kaváye 'rkásātau  vadhaíḥ śúṣṇasyāśúṣasya māyā́ḥ  pitvó nā́rirecīt kíṃ caná prá

translation.text: There, Indra, while the light was won, the Paṇis fled, 'neath a hundred blows, for wise Dasoni, And greedy Ṣushṇa's magical devices nor left he any of their food remaining.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हो द्रु॒हो अप॑ वि॒श्वायु॑ धायि॒ वज्र॑स्य॒ यत्पत॑ने॒ पादि॒ शुष्णः॑ उ॒रु ष स॒रथं॒ सार॑थये क॒रिन्द्रः॒ कुत्सा॑य॒ सूर्य॑स्य सा॒तौ
verses.transliteration: mahó druhó ápa viśvā́yu dhāyi  vájrasya yát pátane pā́di śúṣṇaḥ  urú ṣá saráthaṃ sā́rathaye kar  índraḥ kútsāya sū́ryasya sātaú

translation.text: What time the thunder fell and Ṣushṇa perished, all life's support from the great Druh was taken. Indra made room for his car-drivcr Kutsa who sate beside him, when he gained the sunlight.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र श्ये॒नो न म॑दि॒रमं॒शुम॑स्मै॒ शिरो॑ दा॒सस्य॒ नमु॑चेर्मथा॒यन् प्राव॒न्नमीं॑ सा॒प्यं स॒सन्तं॑ पृ॒णग्रा॒या समि॒षा सं स्व॒स्ति
verses.transliteration: prá śyenó ná madirám aṃśúm asmai  śíro dāsásya námucer mathāyán  prā́van námīṃ sāpyáṃ sasántam  pr̥ṇág rāyā́ sám iṣā́ sáṃ svastí

translation.text: As the Hawk rent for him the stalk that gladdens, he wrenched the head from Namuci the Dâsa. He guarded Namî, Sayya's son, in slumber, and sated him with food, success, and riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि पिप्रो॒रहि॑मायस्य दृ॒ळ्हाः पुरो॑ वज्रि॒ञ्छव॑सा॒ न द॑र्दः सुदा॑म॒न्तद्रेक्णो॑ अप्रमृ॒ष्यमृ॒जिश्व॑ने दा॒त्रं दा॒शुषे॑ दाः
verses.transliteration: ví pípror áhimāyasya dr̥ḷhā́ḥ  púro vajriñ chávasā ná dardaḥ  súdāman tád rékṇo apramr̥ṣyám  r̥jíśvane dātráṃ dāśúṣe dāḥ

translation.text: Thou, thunder-armed, with thy great might hast shattered Pipru's strong forts who knew the wiles of serpents. Thou gavest to thy worshipper R̥ijiṣvan imperishable Wealth, O Bounteous Giver.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स वे॑त॒सुं दश॑मायं॒ दशो॑णिं॒ तूतु॑जि॒मिन्द्रः॑ स्वभि॒ष्टिसु॑म्नः आ तुग्रं॒ शश्व॒दिभं॒ द्योत॑नाय मा॒तुर्न सी॒मुप॑ सृजा इ॒यध्यै॑
verses.transliteration: sá vetasúṃ dáśamāyaṃ dáśoṇiṃ  tū́tujim índraḥ svabhiṣṭísumnaḥ  ā́ túgraṃ śáśvad íbhaṃ dyótanāya  mātúr ná sīm úpa sr̥jā iyádhyai

translation.text: The crafty Vetasu, the swift Dasni, and Tugra speedily with all his servants, Hath Indra, gladdening with strong assistance, forced near as 'twere to glorify the Mother.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स ईं॒ स्पृधो॑ वनते॒ अप्र॑तीतो॒ बिभ्र॒द्वज्रं॑ वृत्र॒हणं॒ गभ॑स्तौ तिष्ठ॒द्धरी॒ अध्यस्ते॑व॒ गर्ते॑ वचो॒युजा॑ वहत॒ इन्द्र॑मृ॒ष्वम्
verses.transliteration: sá īṃ spŕ̥dho vanate ápratīto  bíbhrad vájraṃ vr̥traháṇaṃ gábhastau  tíṣṭhad dhárī ádhy ásteva gárte  vacoyújā vahata índram r̥ṣvám

translation.text: Resistless, with the hosts he battles, bearing in both his arms the Vr̥itra-slaying thunder. He mounts his Bays, as the car-seat an archer: yoked at a word they bear the lofty Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒नेम॒ तेऽव॑सा॒ नव्य॑ इन्द्र॒ प्र पू॒रवः॑ स्तवन्त ए॒ना य॒ज्ञैः स॒प्त यत्पुरः॒ शर्म॒ शार॑दी॒र्दर्द्धन्दासीः॑ पुरु॒कुत्सा॑य॒ शिक्ष॑न्
verses.transliteration: sanéma té 'vasā návya indra  prá pūráva stavanta enā́ yajñaíḥ  saptá yát púraḥ śárma śā́radīr dárt  -hán dā́sīḥ purukútsāya śíkṣan

translation.text: May we, O Indra, gain by thy new favour: so Pûrus laud thee, with their sacrifices, That thou hast wrecked seven autumn forts, their shelter, slain Dâsa tribes and aided Purukutsa.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं वृ॒ध इ॑न्द्र पू॒र्व्यो भू॑र्वरिव॒स्यन्नु॒शने॑ का॒व्याय॑ परा॒ नव॑वास्त्वमनु॒देयं॑ म॒हे पि॒त्रे द॑दाथ॒ स्वं नपा॑तम्
verses.transliteration: tváṃ vr̥dhá indra pūrvyó bhūr  varivasyánn uśáne kāvyā́ya  párā návavāstvam anudéyam  mahé pitré dadātha sváṃ nápātam

translation.text: Favouring Uṣanâ the son of Kavi, thou wast his ancient strengthener, O Indra. Thou gavest Navavâstva. as a present, to the great father gavest back his grandson.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं धुनि॑रिन्द्र॒ धुनि॑मतीर्ऋ॒णोर॒पः सी॒रा न स्रव॑न्तीः प्र यत्स॑मु॒द्रमति॑ शूर॒ पर्षि॑ पा॒रया॑ तु॒र्वशं॒ यदुं॑ स्व॒स्ति
verses.transliteration: tváṃ dhúnir indra dhúnimatīr  r̥ṇór apáḥ sīrā́ ná srávantīḥ  prá yát samudrám áti śūra párṣi  pāráyā turváśaṃ yáduṃ svastí

translation.text: Thou, roaring Indra, drovest on the waters that made a roaring sound like rushing rivers, What time, O Hero, o'er the sea thou broughtest, in safety broughtest Turvaṣa and Yadu.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तव॑ ह॒ त्यदि॑न्द्र॒ विश्व॑मा॒जौ स॒स्तो धुनी॒चुमु॑री॒ या ह॒ सिष्व॑प् दी॒दय॒दित्तुभ्यं॒ सोमे॑भिः सु॒न्वन्द॒भीति॑रि॒ध्मभृ॑तिः प॒क्थ्य१॒॑र्कैः
verses.transliteration: táva ha tyád indra víśvam ājaú  sastó dhúnīcúmurī yā́ ha síṣvap  dīdáyad ít túbhyaṃ sómebhiḥ sunván  dabhī́tir idhmábhr̥tiḥ pakthy àrkaíḥ

translation.text: This Indra, was thy work in war: thou sentest Dhuni and Chumuri to sleep and slumber. Dabhîti lit the flame for thee, and worshipped with fuel, hymns, poured Soma, dressed oblations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मा उ॑ त्वा पुरु॒तम॑स्य का॒रोर्हव्यं॑ वीर॒ हव्या॑ हवन्ते धियो॑ रथे॒ष्ठाम॒जरं॒ नवी॑यो र॒यिर्विभू॑तिरीयते वच॒स्या
verses.transliteration: imā́ u tvā purutámasya kārór  hávyaṃ vīra hávyā havante  dhíyo ratheṣṭhā́m ajáraṃ návīyo  rayír víbhūtir īyate vacasyā́

translation.text: THESE the most constant singer's invocations call thee who art to be invoked, O Hero; Hymns call anew the chariot-borne, Eternal: by eloquence men gain abundant riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमु॑ स्तुष॒ इन्द्रं॒ यो विदा॑नो॒ गिर्वा॑हसं गी॒र्भिर्य॒ज्ञवृ॑द्धम् यस्य॒ दिव॒मति॑ म॒ह्ना पृ॑थि॒व्याः पु॑रुमा॒यस्य॑ रिरि॒चे म॑हि॒त्वम्
verses.transliteration: tám u stuṣa índraṃ yó vídāno  gírvāhasaṃ gīrbhír yajñávr̥ddham  yásya dívam áti mahnā́ pr̥thivyā́ḥ  purumāyásya riricé mahitvám

translation.text: I praise that Indra, known to all men, honoured with songs, extolled with hymns at sacrifices, Whose majesty, rich in wondrous arts, surpasseth the magnitude of earth, and heaven in greatness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स इत्तमो॑ऽवयु॒नं त॑त॒न्वत्सूर्ये॑ण व॒युन॑वच्चकार क॒दा ते॒ मर्ता॑ अ॒मृत॑स्य॒ धामेय॑क्षन्तो॒ न मि॑नन्ति स्वधावः
verses.transliteration: sá ít támo 'vayunáṃ tatanvát  sū́ryeṇa vayúnavac cakāra  kadā́ te mártā amŕ̥tasya dhā́ma-  -íyakṣanto ná minanti svadhāvaḥ

translation.text: He hath made pathways, with the Sun to aid him, throughout the darkness that extended pathless. Mortals who yearn to worship ne'er dishonour, O Mighty God, thy Law who art Immortal.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्ता च॒कार॒ स कुह॑ स्वि॒दिन्द्रः॒ कमा जनं॑ चरति॒ कासु॑ वि॒क्षु कस्ते॑ य॒ज्ञो मन॑से॒ शं वरा॑य॒ को अ॒र्क इ॑न्द्र कत॒मः स होता॑
verses.transliteration: yás tā́ cakā́ra sá kúha svid índraḥ  kám ā́ jánaṃ carati kā́su vikṣú  kás te yajñó mánase śáṃ várāya  kó arká indra katamáḥ sá hótā

translation.text: And he who did these things, where is that Indra? among what tribes? what people doth he visit? What sacrifice contents thy mind , and wishes? What priest among them all? what hymn, O Indra?

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒दा हि ते॒ वेवि॑षतः पुरा॒जाः प्र॒त्नास॑ आ॒सुः पु॑रुकृ॒त्सखा॑यः ये म॑ध्य॒मास॑ उ॒त नूत॑नास उ॒ताव॒मस्य॑ पुरुहूत बोधि
verses.transliteration: idā́ hí te véviṣataḥ purājā́ḥ  pratnā́sa āsúḥ purukr̥t sákhāyaḥ  yé madhyamā́sa utá nū́tanāsaḥ-  utā́vamásya puruhūta bodhi

translation.text: Yea, here were they who, born of old, have served thee, thy friends of ancient time, thou active Worker. Bethink thee now of these, Invoked of many! the midmost and the recent, and the youngest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं पृ॒च्छन्तोऽव॑रासः॒ परा॑णि प्र॒त्ना त॑ इन्द्र॒ श्रुत्यानु॑ येमुः अर्चा॑मसि वीर ब्रह्मवाहो॒ यादे॒व वि॒द्म तात्त्वा॑ म॒हान्त॑म्
verses.transliteration: tám pr̥chántó 'varāsaḥ párāṇi  pratnā́ ta indra śrútyā́nu yemuḥ  árcāmasi vīra brahmavāho  yā́d evá vidmá tā́t tvā mahā́ntam

translation.text: Inquiring after him, thy later servants, Indra, have gained thy former old traditions. Hero, to whom the prayer is brought, we praise thee as great for that wherein we know thee mighty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि त्वा॒ पाजो॑ र॒क्षसो॒ वि त॑स्थे॒ महि॑ जज्ञा॒नम॒भि तत्सु ति॑ष्ठ तव॑ प्र॒त्नेन॒ युज्ये॑न॒ सख्या॒ वज्रे॑ण धृष्णो॒ अप॒ ता नु॑दस्व
verses.transliteration: abhí tvā pā́jo rakṣáso ví tasthe  máhi jajñānám abhí tát sú tiṣṭha  táva pratnéna yújyena sákhyā  vájreṇa dhr̥ṣṇo ápa tā́ nudasva

translation.text: The demon's strength is gathered fast against thee: great as that strength hath grown, go forth to meet it. With thine own ancient friend and companion, the thunderbolt, brave Champion! drive it backward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स तु श्रु॑धीन्द्र॒ नूत॑नस्य ब्रह्मण्य॒तो वी॑र कारुधायः त्वं ह्या॒३॒॑पिः प्र॒दिवि॑ पितॄ॒णां शश्व॑द्ब॒भूथ॑ सु॒हव॒ एष्टौ॑
verses.transliteration: sá tú śrudhīndra nū́tanasya  brahmaṇyató vīra kārudhāyaḥ  tváṃ hy ā̀píḥ pradívi pitr̥̄ṇā́ṃ  śáśvad babhū́tha suháva éṣṭau

translation.text: Hear, too, the prayer of this thy present beadsman, O Indra, Hero, cherishing the singer. For thou wast aye our fathers' Friend aforetime, still swift to listen to their supplication.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रोतये॒ वरु॑णं मि॒त्रमिन्द्रं॑ म॒रुतः॑ कृ॒ष्वाव॑से नो अ॒द्य प्र पू॒षणं॒ विष्णु॑म॒ग्निं पुरं॑धिं सवि॒तार॒मोष॑धीः॒ पर्व॑ताँश्च
verses.transliteration: prótáye váruṇam mitrám índram  marútaḥ kr̥ṣvā́vase no adyá  prá pūṣáṇaṃ víṣṇum agním púraṃdhiṃ  savitā́ram óṣadhīḥ párvatāṃś ca

translation.text: Bring to our help this day, for our protection, Varuṇa, Mitra , Indra, and the Maruts, Pûshan and Vishṇu, Agni and Purandhi, Savitar also, and the Plants and Mountains.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒म उ॑ त्वा पुरुशाक प्रयज्यो जरि॒तारो॑ अ॒भ्य॑र्चन्त्य॒र्कैः श्रु॒धी हव॒मा हु॑व॒तो हु॑वा॒नो न त्वावाँ॑ अ॒न्यो अ॑मृत॒ त्वद॑स्ति
verses.transliteration: imá u tvā puruśāka prayajyo  jaritā́ro abhy àrcanty arkaíḥ  śrudhī́ hávam ā́ huvató huvānó  ná tvā́vām̐ anyó amr̥ta tvád asti

translation.text: The singers here exalt with hymns and praises thee who art very Mighty and Most Holy. Hear, when invoked, the invoker's invocation. Beside thee there is nonelike thee, Immortal!

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू म॒ आ वाच॒मुप॑ याहि वि॒द्वान्विश्वे॑भिः सूनो सहसो॒ यज॑त्रैः ये अ॑ग्निजि॒ह्वा ऋ॑त॒साप॑ आ॒सुर्ये मनुं॑ च॒क्रुरुप॑रं॒ दसा॑य
verses.transliteration: nū́ ma ā́ vā́cam úpa yāhi vidvā́n  víśvebhiḥ sūno sahaso yájatraiḥ  yé agnijihvā́ r̥tasā́pa āsúr  yé mánuṃ cakrúr úparaṃ dásāya

translation.text: Now to my words come quickly thou who knowest, O Son of Strength, with all who claim our worship, Who visit sacred rites, whose tongue is Agni, Gods who made Manu stronger than the Dasyu.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स नो॑ बोधि पुरए॒ता सु॒गेषू॒त दु॒र्गेषु॑ पथि॒कृद्विदा॑नः ये अश्र॑मास उ॒रवो॒ वहि॑ष्ठा॒स्तेभि॑र्न इन्द्रा॒भि व॑क्षि॒ वाज॑म्
verses.transliteration: sá no bodhi puraetā́ sugéṣu-  -utá durgéṣu pathikŕ̥d vídānaḥ  yé áśramāsa urávo váhiṣṭhās  tébhir na indrābhí vakṣi vā́jam

translation.text: On good and evil ways be thou our Leader, thou who art known to all as Path-preparer. Bring power to us, O Indra, with thy Horses, Steeds that are best to draw, broad-backed, unwearied.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य एक॒ इद्धव्य॑श्चर्षणी॒नामिन्द्रं॒ तं गी॒र्भिर॒भ्य॑र्च आ॒भिः यः पत्य॑ते वृष॒भो वृष्ण्या॑वान्त्स॒त्यः सत्वा॑ पुरुमा॒यः सह॑स्वान्
verses.transliteration: yá éka íd dhávyaś carṣaṇīnā́m  índraṃ táṃ gīrbhír abhy àrca ābhíḥ  yáḥ pátyate vr̥ṣabhó vŕ̥ṣṇyāvān  satyáḥ sátvā purumāyáḥ sáhasvān

translation.text: WITH these my hymns I glorify that Indra who is alone to be invoked by mortals, The Lord, the Mighty One, of manly vigour, victorious, Hero, true, and full of wisdom.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमु॑ नः॒ पूर्वे॑ पि॒तरो॒ नव॑ग्वाः स॒प्त विप्रा॑सो अ॒भि वा॒जय॑न्तः न॒क्ष॒द्दा॒भं ततु॑रिं पर्वते॒ष्ठामद्रो॑घवाचं म॒तिभिः॒ शवि॑ष्ठम्
verses.transliteration: tám u naḥ pū́rve pitáro návagvāḥ  saptá víprāso abhí vājáyantaḥ  nakṣaddābháṃ táturim parvateṣṭhā́m  ádroghavācam matíbhiḥ śáviṣṭham

translation.text: Our sires of old,. Navagvas, sages seven, while urging him to show his might, extolled him, Dwelling on heights, swift, smiting down opponents, guileless in word, and in his thoughts most mighty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमी॑मह॒ इन्द्र॑मस्य रा॒यः पु॑रु॒वीर॑स्य नृ॒वतः॑ पुरु॒क्षोः यो अस्कृ॑धोयुर॒जरः॒ स्व॑र्वा॒न्तमा भ॑र हरिवो माद॒यध्यै॑
verses.transliteration: tám īmaha índram asya rāyáḥ  puruvī́rasya nr̥vátaḥ purukṣóḥ  yó áskr̥dhoyur ajáraḥ svàrvān  tám ā́ bhara harivo mādayádhyai

translation.text: We seek that Indra to obtain his riches that bring much food, and men, and store of heroes. Bring us, Lord of Bay Steeds, to make us joyful, celestial wealth, abundant, undecaying.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तन्नो॒ वि वो॑चो॒ यदि॑ ते पु॒रा चि॑ज्जरि॒तार॑ आन॒शुः सु॒म्नमि॑न्द्र कस्ते॑ भा॒गः किं वयो॑ दुध्र खिद्वः॒ पुरु॑हूत पुरूवसोऽसुर॒घ्नः
verses.transliteration: tán no ví voco yádi te purā́ cij  jaritā́ra ānaśúḥ sumnám indra  kás te bhāgáḥ kíṃ váyo dudhra khidvaḥ  púruhūta purūvaso 'suraghnáḥ

translation.text: Tell thou us this, if at thy hand aforetime the earlier singers have obtained good fortune, What is thy share and portion, Strong Subduer, Asura-slayer, rich, invoked of many?

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं पृ॒च्छन्ती॒ वज्र॑हस्तं रथे॒ष्ठामिन्द्रं॒ वेपी॒ वक्व॑री॒ यस्य॒ नू गीः तु॒वि॒ग्रा॒भं तु॑विकू॒र्मिं र॑भो॒दां गा॒तुमि॑षे॒ नक्ष॑ते॒ तुम्र॒मच्छ॑
verses.transliteration: tám pr̥chántī vájrahastaṃ ratheṣṭhā́m  índraṃ vépī vákvarī yásya nū́ gī́ḥ  tuvigrābháṃ tuvikūrmíṃ rabhodā́m  gātúm iṣe nákṣate túmram ácha

translation.text: He who for car-borne Indra, armed with thunder, hath a hymn, craving, deeply-piercing, fluent, Who sends a song effectual, firmly-grasping, and strength-bestowing, he comes near the mighty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒या ह॒ त्यं मा॒यया॑ वावृधा॒नं म॑नो॒जुवा॑ स्वतवः॒ पर्व॑तेन अच्यु॑ता चिद्वीळि॒ता स्वो॑जो रु॒जो वि दृ॒ळ्हा धृ॑ष॒ता वि॑रप्शिन्
verses.transliteration: ayā́ ha tyám māyáyā vāvr̥dhānám  manojúvā svatavaḥ párvatena  ácyutā cid vīḷitā́ svojo  rujó ví dr̥ḷhā́ dhr̥ṣatā́ virapśin

translation.text: Strong of thyself, thou by this art hast shattered, with thought-swift Parvata, him who waxed against thee, And, Mightiest! roaring! boldly rent in pieces things that were firmly fixed and never shaken.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं वो॑ धि॒या नव्य॑स्या॒ शवि॑ष्ठं प्र॒त्नं प्र॑त्न॒वत्प॑रितंस॒यध्यै॑ स नो॑ वक्षदनिमा॒नः सु॒वह्मेन्द्रो॒ विश्वा॒न्यति॑ दु॒र्गहा॑णि
verses.transliteration: táṃ vo dhiyā́ návyasyā śáviṣṭham  pratnám pratnavát paritaṃsayádhyai  sá no vakṣad animānáḥ suváhmā-  -índro víśvāny áti durgáhāṇi

translation.text: Him will we fit for you with new devotion, the strongest Ancient One, in ancient manner. So may that Indra, boundless, faithful Leader, conduct us o'er all places hard to traverse.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ जना॑य॒ द्रुह्व॑णे॒ पार्थि॑वानि दि॒व्यानि॑ दीपयो॒ऽन्तरि॑क्षा तपा॑ वृषन्वि॒श्वतः॑ शो॒चिषा॒ तान्ब्र॑ह्म॒द्विषे॑ शोचय॒ क्षाम॒पश्च॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ jánāya drúhvaṇe pā́rthivāni  divyā́ni dīpayo 'ntárikṣā  tápā vr̥ṣan viśvátaḥ śocíṣā tā́n  brahmadvíṣe śocaya kṣā́m apáś ca

translation.text: Thou for the people who oppress hast kindled the earthly firmament and that of heaven. With heat, O Bull, on every side consume them: heat earth and flood for him who hates devotion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भुवो॒ जन॑स्य दि॒व्यस्य॒ राजा॒ पार्थि॑वस्य॒ जग॑तस्त्वेषसंदृक् धि॒ष्व वज्रं॒ दक्षि॑ण इन्द्र॒ हस्ते॒ विश्वा॑ अजुर्य दयसे॒ वि मा॒याः
verses.transliteration: bhúvo jánasya divyásya rā́jā  pā́rthivasya jágatas tveṣasaṃdr̥k  dhiṣvá vájraṃ dákṣiṇa indra háste  víśvā ajurya dayase ví māyā́ḥ

translation.text: Of all the Heavenly Folk, of earthly creatures thou art the King, O God of splendid aspect. In thy right hand, O Indra, grasp die thunder: Eternal! thou destroyest all enchantments.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ सं॒यत॑मिन्द्र णः स्व॒स्तिं श॑त्रु॒तूर्या॑य बृह॒तीममृ॑ध्राम् यया॒ दासा॒न्यार्या॑णि वृ॒त्रा करो॑ वज्रिन्त्सु॒तुका॒ नाहु॑षाणि
verses.transliteration: ā́ saṃyátam indra ṇaḥ svastíṃ  śatrutū́ryāya br̥hatī́m ámr̥dhrām  yáyā dā́sāny ā́ryāṇi vr̥trā́  káro vajrin sutúkā nā́huṣāṇi

translation.text: Give us confirmed prosperity, O Indra, vast and exhaustless for the foe's subduing. Strengthen therewith the Arya's hate and Dâsa's, and let the arms of Nahushas be mighty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स नो॑ नि॒युद्भिः॑ पुरुहूत वेधो वि॒श्ववा॑राभि॒रा ग॑हि प्रयज्यो न या अदे॑वो॒ वर॑ते॒ न दे॒व आभि॑र्याहि॒ तूय॒मा म॑द्र्य॒द्रिक्
verses.transliteration: sá no niyúdbhiḥ puruhūta vedho  viśvávārābhir ā́ gahi prayajyo  ná yā́ ádevo várate ná deváḥ-  ā́bhir yāhi tū́yam ā́ madryadrík

translation.text: Come with thy team which brings all blessings hither, Disposer, much-invoked, exceeding holy. Thou whom no fiend, no God can stay or hinder, come swittly with these Steeds in my direction.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒त इत्त्वं निमि॑श्ल इन्द्र॒ सोमे॒ स्तोमे॒ ब्रह्म॑णि श॒स्यमा॑न उ॒क्थे यद्वा॑ यु॒क्ताभ्यां॑ मघव॒न्हरि॑भ्यां॒ बिभ्र॒द्वज्रं॑ बा॒ह्वोरि॑न्द्र॒ यासि॑
verses.transliteration: sutá ít tváṃ nímiśla indra sóme  stóme bráhmaṇi śasyámāna ukthé  yád vā yuktā́bhyām maghavan háribhyām  bíbhrad vájram bāhvór indra yā́si

translation.text: THOU art attached to pressed-out Soma, Indra, at laud, at prayer, and when the hymn is chanted; Or when with yoked Bays, Maghavan, thou comest, O Indra, bearing in thine arms the thunder.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद्वा॑ दि॒वि पार्ये॒ सुष्वि॑मिन्द्र वृत्र॒हत्येऽव॑सि॒ शूर॑सातौ यद्वा॒ दक्ष॑स्य बि॒भ्युषो॒ अबि॑भ्य॒दर॑न्धयः॒ शर्ध॑त इन्द्र॒ दस्यू॑न्
verses.transliteration: yád vā diví pā́rye súṣvim indra  vr̥trahátyé 'vasi śū́rasātau  yád vā dákṣasya bibhyúṣo ábibhyad  árandhayaḥ śárdhata indra dásyūn

translation.text: Or when on that decisive day thou holpest the presser of the juice at Vr̥itra's slaughter; Or when thou, while the strong one feared, undaunted, gavest to death, Indra, the daring Dasyus.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पाता॑ सु॒तमिन्द्रो॑ अस्तु॒ सोमं॑ प्रणे॒नीरु॒ग्रो ज॑रि॒तार॑मू॒ती कर्ता॑ वी॒राय॒ सुष्व॑य उ लो॒कं दाता॒ वसु॑ स्तुव॒ते की॒रये॑ चित्
verses.transliteration: pā́tā sutám índro astu sómam  praṇenī́r ugró jaritā́ram ūtī́  kártā vīrā́ya súṣvaya ulokáṃ  dā́tā vásu stuvaté kīráye cit

translation.text: Let Indra drink the pressed-out Soma, Helper and mighty Guide of him who sings his praises. He gives the hero room who pours oblations, and treasure even to the lowly singer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गन्तेया॑न्ति॒ सव॑ना॒ हरि॑भ्यां ब॒भ्रिर्वज्रं॑ प॒पिः सोमं॑ द॒दिर्गाः कर्ता॑ वी॒रं नर्यं॒ सर्व॑वीरं॒ श्रोता॒ हवं॑ गृण॒तः स्तोम॑वाहाः
verses.transliteration: gántéyānti sávanā háribhyām  babhrír vájram papíḥ sómaṃ dadír gā́ḥ  kártā vīráṃ náryaṃ sárvavīraṃ  śrótā hávaṃ gr̥ṇatá stómavāhāḥ

translation.text: E'en humble rites with his Bay steeds he visits: he wields the bolt, drinks Soma, gives us cattle. He makes the valiant rich in store of heroes, accepts our praise and hears the singer's calling.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अस्मै॑ व॒यं यद्वा॒वान॒ तद्वि॑विष्म॒ इन्द्रा॑य॒ यो नः॑ प्र॒दिवो॒ अप॒स्कः सु॒ते सोमे॑ स्तु॒मसि॒ शंस॑दु॒क्थेन्द्रा॑य॒ ब्रह्म॒ वर्ध॑नं॒ यथास॑त्
verses.transliteration: ásmai vayáṃ yád vāvā́na tád viviṣmaḥ-  índrāya yó naḥ pradívo ápas káḥ  suté sóme stumási śáṃsad ukthā́-  -índrāya bráhma várdhanaṃ yáthā́sat

translation.text: What he hath longed for we have brought to Indra, who from the days of old hath done us service. While Soma flows we will sing hymn, and laud him, so that our prayer may streng. then Indra's vigour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ब्रह्मा॑णि॒ हि च॑कृ॒षे वर्ध॑नानि॒ ताव॑त्त इन्द्र म॒तिभि॑र्विविष्मः सु॒ते सोमे॑ सुतपाः॒ शंत॑मानि॒ राण्ड्या॑ क्रियास्म॒ वक्ष॑णानि य॒ज्ञैः
verses.transliteration: bráhmāṇi hí cakr̥ṣé várdhanāni  tā́vat ta indra matíbhir viviṣmaḥ  suté sóme sutapāḥ śáṃtamāni  rā́ṇḍyā kriyāsma vákṣaṇāni yajñaíḥ

translation.text: Thou hast made prayer the means of thine exalting, therefore we wait on thee with hymns, O Indra. May we, by the pressed Soma, Somadrinker! bring thee, with sacrifice, blissful sweet refreshment.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स नो॑ बोधि पुरो॒ळाशं॒ ररा॑णः॒ पिबा॒ तु सोमं॒ गोऋ॑जीकमिन्द्र एदं ब॒र्हिर्यज॑मानस्य सीदो॒रुं कृ॑धि त्वाय॒त उ॑ लो॒कम्
verses.transliteration: sá no bodhi puroḷā́śaṃ rárāṇaḥ  píbā tú sómaṃ gór̥jīkam indra  édám barhír yájamānasya sīda-  -urúṃ kr̥dhi tvāyatá ulokám

translation.text: Mark well our sacrificial cake, delighted Indra, drink Soma and the milk commingled. Here on the sacrificer's grass be seated: give ample room to thy devoted servant.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स म॑न्दस्वा॒ ह्यनु॒ जोष॑मुग्र॒ प्र त्वा॑ य॒ज्ञास॑ इ॒मे अ॑श्नुवन्तु प्रेमे हवा॑सः पुरुहू॒तम॒स्मे आ त्वे॒यं धीरव॑स इन्द्र यम्याः
verses.transliteration: sá mandasvā hy ánu jóṣam ugra  prá tvā yajñā́sa imé aśnuvantu  prémé hávāsaḥ puruhūtám asmé  ā́ tveyáṃ dhī́r ávasa indra yamyāḥ

translation.text: O Mighty One, be joyful as thou willest. Let these our sacrifices reach and find thee; And may this hymn and these our invocations turn thee, whom many men invoke, to help us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं वः॑ सखायः॒ सं यथा॑ सु॒तेषु॒ सोमे॑भिरीं पृणता भो॒जमिन्द्र॑म् कु॒वित्तस्मा॒ अस॑ति नो॒ भरा॑य॒ न सुष्वि॒मिन्द्रोऽव॑से मृधाति
verses.transliteration: táṃ vaḥ sakhāyaḥ sáṃ yáthā sutéṣu  sómebhir īm pr̥ṇatā bhojám índram  kuvít tásmā ásati no bhárāya  ná súṣvim índró 'vase mr̥dhāti

translation.text: Friends, when thejuices flow, replenish duly your own, your bounteous Indra with the Soma. Will it not aid him to support us? Indra. spares him who sheds the juice to win his favour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वेदिन्द्रः॑ सु॒ते अ॑स्तावि॒ सोमे॑ भ॒रद्वा॑जेषु॒ क्षय॒दिन्म॒घोनः॑ अस॒द्यथा॑ जरि॒त्र उ॒त सू॒रिरिन्द्रो॑ रा॒यो वि॒श्ववा॑रस्य दा॒ता
verses.transliteration: evéd índraḥ suté astāvi sóme  bharádvājeṣu kṣáyad ín maghónaḥ  ásad yáthā jaritrá utá sūrír  índro rāyó viśvávārasya dātā́

translation.text: While Soma flowed, thus Indra hath been lauded, Ruler of nobles, mid the Bharadvâjas, That Indra may become the singer's patron and give him wealth in every kind of treasure.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वृषा॒ मद॒ इन्द्रे॒ श्लोक॑ उ॒क्था सचा॒ सोमे॑षु सुत॒पा ऋ॑जी॒षी अ॒र्च॒त्र्यो॑ म॒घवा॒ नृभ्य॑ उ॒क्थैर्द्यु॒क्षो राजा॑ गि॒रामक्षि॑तोतिः
verses.transliteration: vŕ̥ṣā máda índre ślóka ukthā́  sácā sómeṣu sutapā́ r̥jīṣī́  arcatryò maghávā nŕ̥bhya ukthaír  dyukṣó rā́jā girā́m ákṣitotiḥ

translation.text: STRONG rapturous joy, praise, glory are with Indra: impetuous God, he quaffs the juice of Soma: That Maghavan whom men must laud with singing, Heaven-dweller, King of songs, whose help is lasting.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ततु॑रिर्वी॒रो नर्यो॒ विचे॑ताः॒ श्रोता॒ हवं॑ गृण॒त उ॒र्व्यू॑तिः वसुः॒ शंसो॑ न॒रां का॒रुधा॑या वा॒जी स्तु॒तो वि॒दथे॑ दाति॒ वाज॑म्
verses.transliteration: táturir vīró náryo vícetāḥ  śrótā hávaṃ gr̥ṇatá urvyū̀tiḥ  vásuḥ śáṃso narā́ṃ kārúdhāyāḥ-  vājī́ stutó vidáthe dāti vā́jam

translation.text: He, Friend of man, most wise, victorious Hero, hears, with far-reaching aid, the singer call him. Excellent, Praise of Men, the bard's Supporter, Strong, he gives strength, extolled in holy synod.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अक्षो॒ न च॒क्र्योः॑ शूर बृ॒हन्प्र ते॑ म॒ह्ना रि॑रिचे॒ रोद॑स्योः वृ॒क्षस्य॒ नु ते॑ पुरुहूत व॒या व्यू॒३॒॑तयो॑ रुरुहुरिन्द्र पू॒र्वीः
verses.transliteration: ákṣo ná cakryòḥ śūra br̥hán  prá te mahnā́ ririce ródasyoḥ  vr̥kṣásya nú te puruhūta vayā́ḥ-  vy ū̀táyo ruruhur indra pūrvī́ḥ

translation.text: The lofty axle of thy wheels, O Hero, is not surpassed by heaven and earth in greatness. Like branches of a tree, Invoked of many manifold aids spring forth from thee, O Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शची॑वतस्ते पुरुशाक॒ शाका॒ गवा॑मिव स्रु॒तयः॑ सं॒चर॑णीः व॒त्सानां॒ न त॒न्तय॑स्त इन्द्र॒ दाम॑न्वन्तो अदा॒मानः॑ सुदामन्
verses.transliteration: śácīvatas te puruśāka śā́kāḥ-  gávām iva srutáyaḥ saṃcáraṇīḥ  vatsā́nāṃ ná tantáyas ta indra  dā́manvanto adāmā́naḥ sudāman

translation.text: Strong Lord, thine energies, endowed with vigour, are like the paths of kine converging homeward. Like bonds of cord, Indra, that bind the younglings, no bonds are they, O thou of boundless bounty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒न्यद॒द्य कर्व॑रम॒न्यदु॒ श्वोऽस॑च्च॒ सन्मुहु॑राच॒क्रिरिन्द्रः॑ मि॒त्रो नो॒ अत्र॒ वरु॑णश्च पू॒षार्यो वश॑स्य पर्ये॒तास्ति॑
verses.transliteration: anyád adyá kárvaram anyád u śvó  -ásac ca sán múhur ācakrír índraḥ  mitró no átra váruṇaś ca pūṣā́-  -aryó váśasya paryetā́sti

translation.text: One act to-day, another act tomorrow oft Indra makes what is not yet existeni. Here have we Mitra, Varuṇa, and Pûshan to overcome the foeman's domination.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि त्वदापो॒ न पर्व॑तस्य पृ॒ष्ठादु॒क्थेभि॑रिन्द्रानयन्त य॒ज्ञैः तं त्वा॒भिः सु॑ष्टु॒तिभि॑र्वा॒जय॑न्त आ॒जिं न ज॑ग्मुर्गिर्वाहो॒ अश्वाः॑
verses.transliteration: ví tvád ā́po ná párvatasya pr̥ṣṭhā́d  ukthébhir indrānayanta yajñaíḥ  táṃ tvābhíḥ suṣṭutíbhir vājáyantaḥ-  ājíṃ ná jagmur girvāho áśvāḥ

translation.text: By song and sacrifice men brought the waters from thee, as from a mountain's ridge, O Indra. Urging thy might, with these fair lauds they seek thee, O theme of song, as horses rush tobattle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न यं जर॑न्ति श॒रदो॒ न मासा॒ न द्याव॒ इन्द्र॑मवक॒र्शय॑न्ति वृ॒द्धस्य॑ चिद्वर्धतामस्य त॒नूः स्तोमे॑भिरु॒क्थैश्च॑ श॒स्यमा॑ना
verses.transliteration: ná yáṃ járanti śarádo ná mā́sāḥ-  ná dyā́va índram avakarśáyanti  vr̥ddhásya cid vardhatām asya tanū́ḥ-  stómebhir ukthaíś ca śasyámānā

translation.text: That Indra whom nor months nor autumn seasons wither with age, nor fleeting days enfeeble,– Still may his body Wax, e'en now so mighty, glorified by the lauds and hymns that praise him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न वी॒ळवे॒ नम॑ते॒ न स्थि॒राय॒ न शर्ध॑ते॒ दस्यु॑जूताय स्त॒वान् अज्रा॒ इन्द्र॑स्य गि॒रय॑श्चिदृ॒ष्वा ग॑म्भी॒रे चि॑द्भवति गा॒धम॑स्मै
verses.transliteration: ná vīḷáve námate ná sthirā́ya  ná śárdhate dásyujūtāya stavā́n  ájrā índrasya giráyaś cid r̥ṣvā́ḥ-  gambhīré cid bhavati gādhám asmai

translation.text: Extolled, he bends not to the strong, the steadfast, nor to the bold incited by the Dasyu. High mountains are as level plains to Indra: even in the deep he finds firm ground to rest on.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ग॒म्भी॒रेण॑ न उ॒रुणा॑मत्रि॒न्प्रेषो य॑न्धि सुतपाव॒न्वाजा॑न् स्था ऊ॒ षु ऊ॒र्ध्व ऊ॒ती अरि॑षण्यन्न॒क्तोर्व्यु॑ष्टौ॒ परि॑तक्म्यायाम्
verses.transliteration: gambhīréṇa na urúṇāmatrin  préṣó yandhi sutapāvan vā́jān  sthā́ ū ṣú ūrdhvá ūtī́ áriṣaṇyann  aktór vyùṣṭau páritakmyāyām

translation.text: Impetuous Speeder through all depth and distance, give strengthening food, thou drinker of the juices. Stand up erect to help us, unreluctant, what time the gloom of night brightens to morning.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सच॑स्व ना॒यमव॑से अ॒भीक॑ इ॒तो वा॒ तमि॑न्द्र पाहि रि॒षः अ॒मा चै॑न॒मर॑ण्ये पाहि रि॒षो मदे॑म श॒तहि॑माः सु॒वीराः॑
verses.transliteration: sácasva nāyám ávase abhī́ke-  itó vā tám indra pāhi riṣáḥ  amā́ cainam áraṇye pāhi riṣó  mádema śatáhimāḥ suvī́rāḥ

translation.text: Hasting to help, come hither and protect him, keep him from harm when he is here, O Indra. At home, abroad, from injury preserve him. May brave sons gladden us through a hundred winters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या त॑ ऊ॒तिर॑व॒मा या प॑र॒मा या म॑ध्य॒मेन्द्र॑ शुष्मि॒न्नस्ति॑ ताभि॑रू॒ षु वृ॑त्र॒हत्ये॑ऽवीर्न ए॒भिश्च॒ वाजै॑र्म॒हान्न॑ उग्र
verses.transliteration: yā́ ta ūtír avamā́ yā́ paramā́  yā́ madhyaméndra śuṣminn ásti  tā́bhir ū ṣú vr̥trahátye 'vīr naḥ-  ebhíś ca vā́jair mahā́n na ugra

translation.text: WITH thine assistance, O thou Mighty Indra, be it the least, the midmost, or the highest,– Great with those aids and by these powers support us, Strong God! in battle that subdues our foemen.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आभिः॒ स्पृधो॑ मिथ॒तीररि॑षण्यन्न॒मित्र॑स्य व्यथया म॒न्युमि॑न्द्र आभि॒र्विश्वा॑ अभि॒युजो॒ विषू॑ची॒रार्या॑य॒ विशोऽव॑ तारी॒र्दासीः॑
verses.transliteration: ā́bhi spŕ̥dho mithatī́r áriṣaṇyann  amítrasya vyathayā manyúm indra  ā́bhir víśvā abhiyújo víṣūcīr  ā́ryāya víśó 'va tārīr dā́sīḥ

translation.text: With these discomfit hosts that fight against us, and check the opponent's wrath, thyself uninjured. With these chase all our foes to every quarter: subdue the tribes of Dâsas to the Ârya.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑ जा॒मय॑ उ॒त येऽजा॑मयोऽर्वाची॒नासो॑ व॒नुषो॑ युयु॒ज्रे त्वमे॑षां विथु॒रा शवां॑सि ज॒हि वृष्ण्या॑नि कृणु॒ही परा॑चः
verses.transliteration: índra jāmáya utá yé 'jāmayo  -arvācīnā́so vanúṣo yuyujré  tvám eṣāṃ vithurā́ śávāṃsi  jahí vŕ̥ṣṇyāni kr̥ṇuhī́ párācaḥ

translation.text: Those who array themselves as foes to smite us, O Indra, be they kin or be they strangers,– Strike thou their manly strength that it be feeble, and drive in headlong flight our foemen backward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शूरो॑ वा॒ शूरं॑ वनते॒ शरी॑रैस्तनू॒रुचा॒ तरु॑षि॒ यत्कृ॒ण्वैते॑ तो॒के वा॒ गोषु॒ तन॑ये॒ यद॒प्सु वि क्रन्द॑सी उ॒र्वरा॑सु॒ ब्रवै॑ते
verses.transliteration: śū́ro vā śū́raṃ vanate śárīrais  tanūrúcā táruṣi yát kr̥ṇvaíte  toké vā góṣu tánaye yád apsú  ví krándasī urvárāsu brávaite

translation.text: With strength of limb the hero slays the hero, when bright in arms they range them for the combat. When two opposing hosts contend in battle for seed and offspring, waters, kine, or corn-lands.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न॒हि त्वा॒ शूरो॒ न तु॒रो न धृ॒ष्णुर्न त्वा॑ यो॒धो मन्य॑मानो यु॒योध॑ इन्द्र॒ नकि॑ष्ट्वा॒ प्रत्य॑स्त्येषां॒ विश्वा॑ जा॒तान्य॒भ्य॑सि॒ तानि॑
verses.transliteration: nahí tvā śū́ro ná turó ná dhr̥ṣṇúr  ná tvā yodhó mányamāno yuyódha  índra nákiṣ ṭvā práty asty eṣāṃ  víśvā jātā́ny abhy àsi tā́ni

translation.text: Yet no strong man hath conquered thee, no hero, no brave, no warrior trusting in his valour. Not one of these is match for thee, O Indra. Thou far surpassest all these living creatures.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स प॑त्यत उ॒भयो॑र्नृ॒म्णम॒योर्यदी॑ वे॒धसः॑ समि॒थे हव॑न्ते वृ॒त्रे वा॑ म॒हो नृ॒वति॒ क्षये॑ वा॒ व्यच॑स्वन्ता॒ यदि॑ वितन्त॒सैते॑
verses.transliteration: sá patyata ubháyor nr̥mṇám ayór  yádī vedhásaḥ samithé hávante  vr̥tré vā mahó nr̥váti kṣáye vā  vyácasvantā yádi vitantasaíte

translation.text: He is the Lord of both these armies' valour when the commanders call them to the conflict: When with their ranks expanded they are fighting with a great foe or for a home with heroes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध॑ स्मा ते चर्ष॒णयो॒ यदेजा॒निन्द्र॑ त्रा॒तोत भ॑वा वरू॒ता अ॒स्माका॑सो॒ ये नृत॑मासो अ॒र्य इन्द्र॑ सू॒रयो॑ दधि॒रे पु॒रो नः॑
verses.transliteration: ádha smā te carṣaṇáyo yád éjān  índra trātótá bhavā varūtā́  asmā́kāso yé nŕ̥tamāso aryáḥ-  índra sūráyo dadhiré puró naḥ

translation.text: And when the people stir themselves for battle, be thou their saviour, Indra, and protector, And theirs, thy manliest of our friends, the pious, the chiefs who have installed us priests, O Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अनु॑ ते दायि म॒ह इ॑न्द्रि॒याय॑ स॒त्रा ते॒ विश्व॒मनु॑ वृत्र॒हत्ये॑ अनु॑ क्ष॒त्रमनु॒ सहो॑ यज॒त्रेन्द्र॑ दे॒वेभि॒रनु॑ ते नृ॒षह्ये॑
verses.transliteration: ánu te dāyi mahá indriyā́ya  satrā́ te víśvam ánu vr̥trahátye  ánu kṣatrám ánu sáho yajatra-  -índra devébhir ánu te nr̥ṣáhye

translation.text: To thee for high dominion hath been for evermore, for slaughtering the Vr̥itras, All lordly power and might, O Holy Indra, given by Gods for victory in battle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा नः॒ स्पृधः॒ सम॑जा स॒मत्स्विन्द्र॑ रार॒न्धि मि॑थ॒तीरदे॑वीः वि॒द्याम॒ वस्तो॒रव॑सा गृ॒णन्तो॑ भ॒रद्वा॑जा उ॒त त॑ इन्द्र नू॒नम्
verses.transliteration: evā́ na spŕ̥dhaḥ sám ajā samátsu-  índra rārandhí mithatī́r ádevīḥ  vidyā́ma vástor ávasā gr̥ṇánto  bharádvājā utá ta indra nūnám

translation.text: So urge our hosts together in the combats: yield up the godless bands that fight against us. Singing, at morn may we find thee with favour, yea, Indra, and e'en now, we Bharadvâjas.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्रु॒धी न॑ इन्द्र॒ ह्वया॑मसि त्वा म॒हो वाज॑स्य सा॒तौ वा॑वृषा॒णाः सं यद्विशोऽय॑न्त॒ शूर॑साता उ॒ग्रं नोऽवः॒ पार्ये॒ अह॑न्दाः
verses.transliteration: śrudhī́ na indra hváyāmasi tvā  mahó vā́jasya sātaú vāvr̥ṣāṇā́ḥ  sáṃ yád víśó 'yanta śū́rasātau-  ugráṃ nó 'vaḥ pā́rye áhan dāḥ

translation.text: O INDRA, hear us. Raining down the Soma, we call on thee to win us mighty valour. Give us strong succour on the day of trial, when the tribes gather on the field of battle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वां वा॒जी ह॑वते वाजिने॒यो म॒हो वाज॑स्य॒ गध्य॑स्य सा॒तौ त्वां वृ॒त्रेष्वि॑न्द्र॒ सत्प॑तिं॒ तरु॑त्रं॒ त्वां च॑ष्टे मुष्टि॒हा गोषु॒ युध्य॑न्
verses.transliteration: tvā́ṃ vājī́ havate vājineyó  mahó vā́jasya gádhyasya sātaú  tvā́ṃ vr̥tréṣv indra sátpatiṃ tárutraṃ  tvā́ṃ caṣṭe muṣṭihā́ góṣu yúdhyan

translation.text: The warrior, son of warrior sire, invokes thee, to gain great strength that may be won as booty: To thee, the brave man's Lord, the fiends' subduer, he looks when fighting hand to hand for cattle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं क॒विं चो॑दयो॒ऽर्कसा॑तौ॒ त्वं कुत्सा॑य॒ शुष्णं॑ दा॒शुषे॑ वर्क् त्वं शिरो॑ अम॒र्मणः॒ परा॑हन्नतिथि॒ग्वाय॒ शंस्यं॑ करि॒ष्यन्
verses.transliteration: tváṃ kavíṃ codayo 'rkásātau  tváṃ kútsāya śúṣṇaṃ dāśúṣe vark  tváṃ śíro amarmáṇaḥ párāhann  atithigvā́ya śáṃsyaṃ kariṣyán

translation.text: Thou didst impel the sage to win the daylight, didst ruin Ṣushṇa for the pious Kutsa. The invulnerable demon's head thou clavest when thou wouldst win the praise of Âtithigva.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं रथं॒ प्र भ॑रो यो॒धमृ॒ष्वमावो॒ युध्य॑न्तं वृष॒भं दश॑द्युम् त्वं तुग्रं॑ वेत॒सवे॒ सचा॑ह॒न्त्वं तुजिं॑ गृ॒णन्त॑मिन्द्र तूतोः
verses.transliteration: tváṃ rátham prá bharo yodhám r̥ṣvám  ā́vo yúdhyantaṃ vr̥ṣabháṃ dáśadyum  tváṃ túgraṃ vetasáve sácāhan  tváṃ tújiṃ gr̥ṇántam indra tūtoḥ

translation.text: The lofty battle-car thou broughtest forward; thou holpest Daṣadyu the strong when fighting. Along with Vetasu thou slewest Tugra, and madest Tuji strong, who praised thee, Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं तदु॒क्थमि॑न्द्र ब॒र्हणा॑ कः॒ प्र यच्छ॒ता स॒हस्रा॑ शूर॒ दर्षि॑ अव॑ गि॒रेर्दासं॒ शम्ब॑रं ह॒न्प्रावो॒ दिवो॑दासं चि॒त्राभि॑रू॒ती
verses.transliteration: tváṃ tád ukthám indra barháṇā kaḥ  prá yác chatā́ sahásrā śūra dárṣi  áva girér dā́saṃ śámbaraṃ han  prā́vo dívodāsaṃ citrā́bhir ūtī́

translation.text: Thou madest good the laud, what time thou rentest a hundred thousand fighting foes, O Hero, Slewest the Dâsa Ṣambara of the mountain, and with strange aids didst succour Divodâsa.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं श्र॒द्धाभि॑र्मन्दसा॒नः सोमै॑र्द॒भीत॑ये॒ चुमु॑रिमिन्द्र सिष्वप् त्वं र॒जिं पिठी॑नसे दश॒स्यन्त्श॒ष्टिं स॒हस्रा॒ शच्या॒ सचा॑हन्
verses.transliteration: tváṃ śraddhā́bhir mandasānáḥ sómair  dabhī́taye cúmurim indra siṣvap  tváṃ rajím píṭhīnase daśasyán  ṣaṣṭíṃ sahásrā śácyā sácāhan

translation.text: Made glad with Soma-draughts and faith, thou sentest Chumuri to his sleep, to please Dabhîti. Thou, kindly giving Raji to Piṭhînas, slewest with might, at once, the sixty thousand.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒हं च॒न तत्सू॒रिभि॑रानश्यां॒ तव॒ ज्याय॑ इन्द्र सु॒म्नमोजः॑ त्वया॒ यत्स्तव॑न्ते सधवीर वी॒रास्त्रि॒वरू॑थेन॒ नहु॑षा शविष्ठ
verses.transliteration: aháṃ caná tát sūríbhir ānaśyāṃ  táva jyā́ya indra sumnám ójaḥ  tváyā yát stávante sadhavīra vīrā́s  trivárūthena náhuṣā śaviṣṭha

translation.text: May I too, with the liberal chiefs, O Indra, acquire thy blin supreme and domination, When, Mightiest! Hero-girt! Nahusha heroes boast them in thee, the triply-strong Defender.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒यं ते॑ अ॒स्यामि॑न्द्र द्यु॒म्नहू॑तौ॒ सखा॑यः स्याम महिन॒ प्रेष्ठाः॑ प्रात॑र्दनिः क्षत्र॒श्रीर॑स्तु॒ श्रेष्ठो॑ घ॒ने वृ॒त्राणां॑ स॒नये॒ धना॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: vayáṃ te asyā́m indra dyumnáhūtau  sákhāyaḥ syāma mahina préṣṭhāḥ  prā́tardaniḥ kṣatraśrī́r astu śréṣṭho  ghané vr̥trā́ṇāṃ sanáye dhánānām

translation.text: So may we he thy friends, thy best beloved, O Indra, at this holy invocation. Best be Pratardani, illustrious ruler, in slaying foemen and in gaining riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: किम॑स्य॒ मदे॒ किम्व॑स्य पी॒ताविन्द्रः॒ किम॑स्य स॒ख्ये च॑कार रणा॑ वा॒ ये नि॒षदि॒ किं ते अ॑स्य पु॒रा वि॑विद्रे॒ किमु॒ नूत॑नासः
verses.transliteration: kím asya máde kím v asya pītā́v  índraḥ kím asya sakhyé cakāra  ráṇā vā yé niṣádi kíṃ té asya  purā́ vividre kím u nū́tanāsaḥ

translation.text: WHAT deed hath Indra done in the wild transport, in quaffing or in friendship with, the Soma? What joys have men of ancient times or recent obtained within the chamber of libation?

verses.sanskrit_deva: सद॑स्य॒ मदे॒ सद्व॑स्य पी॒ताविन्द्रः॒ सद॑स्य स॒ख्ये च॑कार रणा॑ वा॒ ये नि॒षदि॒ सत्ते अ॑स्य पु॒रा वि॑विद्रे॒ सदु॒ नूत॑नासः
verses.transliteration: sád asya máde sád v asya pītā́v  índraḥ sád asya sakhyé cakāra  ráṇā vā yé niṣádi sát té asya  purā́ vividre sád u nū́tanāsaḥ

translation.text: In its wild joy Indra hath proved him faithful, faithful in quaffing, faithful in its friendship. His truth is the delight that in this chamber the men of old and recent times have tasted.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न॒हि नु ते॑ महि॒मनः॑ समस्य॒ न म॑घवन्मघव॒त्त्वस्य॑ वि॒द्म न राध॑सोराधसो॒ नूत॑न॒स्येन्द्र॒ नकि॑र्ददृश इन्द्रि॒यं ते॑
verses.transliteration: nahí nú te mahimánaḥ samasya  ná maghavan maghavattvásya vidmá  ná rā́dhaso-rādhaso nū́tanasya-  -índra nákir dadr̥śa indriyáṃ te

translation.text: All thy vast power, O Maghavan, we know not, know not the riches of thy full abundance. No one hath seen that might of thine, productive of bounty every day renewed, O Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒तत्त्यत्त॑ इन्द्रि॒यम॑चेति॒ येनाव॑धीर्व॒रशि॑खस्य॒ शेषः॑ वज्र॑स्य॒ यत्ते॒ निह॑तस्य॒ शुष्मा॑त्स्व॒नाच्चि॑दिन्द्र पर॒मो द॒दार॑
verses.transliteration: etát tyát ta indriyám aceti  yénā́vadhīr varáśikhasya śéṣaḥ  vájrasya yát te níhatasya śúṣmāt  svanā́c cid indra paramó dadā́ra

translation.text: This one great power of thine our eyes have witnessed, wherewith thou slewest Varaṣikha's children, When by the force of thy descending thunder, at the mere solund, their boldest was demolished.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वधी॒दिन्द्रो॑ व॒रशि॑खस्य॒ शेषो॑ऽभ्याव॒र्तिने॑ चायमा॒नाय॒ शिक्ष॑न् वृ॒चीव॑तो॒ यद्ध॑रियू॒पीया॑यां॒ हन्पूर्वे॒ अर्धे॑ भि॒यसाप॑रो॒ दर्त्
verses.transliteration: vádhīd índro varáśikhasya śéṣo  -abhyāvartíne cāyamānā́ya śíkṣan  vr̥cī́vato yád dhariyūpī́yāyāṃ  hán pū́rve árdhe bhiyásā́paro dárt

translation.text: In aid of Abhyâvartin Châyamâna, Indra destroyed the seed of Varaṣikha. At Hariyûpîyâ he smote the vanguard of the Vr̥ichîvans, and the rear fled frighted.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रिं॒शच्छ॑तं व॒र्मिण॑ इन्द्र सा॒कं य॒व्याव॑त्यां पुरुहूत श्रव॒स्या वृ॒चीव॑न्तः॒ शर॑वे॒ पत्य॑मानाः॒ पात्रा॑ भिन्दा॒ना न्य॒र्थान्या॑यन्
verses.transliteration: triṃśácchataṃ varmíṇa indra sākáṃ  yavyā́vatyām puruhūta śravasyā́  vr̥cī́vantaḥ śárave pátyamānāḥ  pā́trā bhindānā́ nyarthā́ny āyan

translation.text: Three thousand, mailed, in quest of fame, together, on the Yavyâvatî, O much-sought Indra, Vr̥ichîvan's sons, falling before the arrow, like bursting vessels went to their destruction.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्य॒ गावा॑वरु॒षा सू॑यव॒स्यू अ॒न्तरू॒ षु चर॑तो॒ रेरि॑हाणा स सृञ्ज॑याय तु॒र्वशं॒ परा॑दाद्वृ॒चीव॑तो दैववा॒ताय॒ शिक्ष॑न्
verses.transliteration: yásya gā́vāv aruṣā́ sūyavasyū́  antár ū ṣú cárato rérihāṇā  sá sŕ̥ñjayāya turváśam párādād  vr̥cī́vato daivavātā́ya śíkṣan

translation.text: He, whose two red Steers, seeking goodly pasture, plying their tongues move on 'twixt earth and heaven, Gave Turvaṣa to Sr̥injaya, and, to aid him, gave the Vr̥ichîvans up to Daivavata.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्व॒याँ अ॑ग्ने र॒थिनो॑ विंश॒तिं गा व॒धूम॑तो म॒घवा॒ मह्यं॑ स॒म्राट् अ॒भ्या॒व॒र्ती चा॑यमा॒नो द॑दाति दू॒णाशे॒यं दक्षि॑णा पार्थ॒वाना॑म्
verses.transliteration: dvayā́m̐ agne rathíno viṃśatíṃ gā́ḥ-  vadhū́mato maghávā máhyaṃ samrā́ṭ  abhyāvartī́ cāyamānó dadāti  dūṇā́śeyáṃ dákṣiṇā pārthavā́nām

translation.text: Two wagon-teams, with damsels, twenty oxen, O Agni, Abhyâvartin Châyamâna, The liberal Sovran, giveth me. This guerdon of Pr̥ithu's seed is hard to win from others.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ गावो॑ अग्मन्नु॒त भ॒द्रम॑क्र॒न्त्सीद॑न्तु गो॒ष्ठे र॒णय॑न्त्व॒स्मे प्र॒जाव॑तीः पुरु॒रूपा॑ इ॒ह स्यु॒रिन्द्रा॑य पू॒र्वीरु॒षसो॒ दुहा॑नाः
verses.transliteration: ā́ gā́vo agmann utá bhadrám akran  sī́dantu goṣṭhé raṇáyantv asmé  prajā́vatīḥ pururū́pā ihá syur  índrāya pūrvī́r uṣáso dúhānāḥ

translation.text: THE Kine have come and brought good fortune: let them rest in the cow-pen and be happy near us. Here let them stay prolific, many-coloured, and yield through many morns their milk for Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रो॒ यज्व॑ने पृण॒ते च॑ शिक्ष॒त्युपेद्द॑दाति॒ न स्वं मु॑षायति भूयो॑भूयो र॒यिमिद॑स्य व॒र्धय॒न्नभि॑न्ने खि॒ल्ये नि द॑धाति देव॒युम्
verses.transliteration: índro yájvane pr̥ṇaté ca śikṣati-  úpéd dadāti ná svám muṣāyati  bhū́yo-bhūyo rayím íd asya vardháyann  ábhinne khilyé ní dadhāti devayúm

translation.text: Indra aids him who offers sacrifice and gifts: he takes not what is his, and gives him more thereto. Increasing ever more and ever more his wealth, he makes the pious dwell within unbroken bounds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न ता न॑शन्ति॒ न द॑भाति॒ तस्क॑रो॒ नासा॑मामि॒त्रो व्यथि॒रा द॑धर्षति दे॒वाँश्च॒ याभि॒र्यज॑ते॒ ददा॑ति च॒ ज्योगित्ताभिः॑ सचते॒ गोप॑तिः स॒ह
verses.transliteration: ná tā́ naśanti ná dabhāti táskaro  nā́sām āmitró vyáthir ā́ dadharṣati  devā́ṃś ca yā́bhir yájate dádāti ca  jyóg ít tā́bhiḥ sacate gópatiḥ sahá

translation.text: These are ne'er lost, no robber ever injures them: no evil-minded foe attempts to harass them. The master of the Kine lives many a year with these, the Cows whereby he pours his gifts and serves the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न ता अर्वा॑ रे॒णुक॑काटो अश्नुते॒ न सं॑स्कृत॒त्रमुप॑ यन्ति॒ ता अ॒भि उ॒रु॒गा॒यमभ॑यं॒ तस्य॒ ता अनु॒ गावो॒ मर्त॑स्य॒ वि च॑रन्ति॒ यज्व॑नः
verses.transliteration: ná tā́ árvā reṇúkakāṭo aśnute  ná saṃskr̥tatrám úpa yanti tā́ abhí  urugāyám ábhayaṃ tásya tā́ ánu  gā́vo mártasya ví caranti yájvanaḥ

translation.text: The charger with his dusty brow o'ertakes them not, and never to the shambles do they take their way. These Cows, the cattle of the pious worshipper, roam over widespread pasture where no danger is.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गावो॒ भगो॒ गाव॒ इन्द्रो॑ मे अच्छा॒न्गावः॒ सोम॑स्य प्रथ॒मस्य॑ भ॒क्षः इ॒मा या गावः॒ स ज॑नास॒ इन्द्र॑ इ॒च्छामीद्धृ॒दा मन॑सा चि॒दिन्द्र॑म्
verses.transliteration: gā́vo bhágo gā́va índro me achān  gā́vaḥ sómasya prathamásya bhakṣáḥ  imā́ yā́ gā́vaḥ sá janāsa índraḥ-  ichā́mī́d dhr̥dā́ mánasā cid índram

translation.text: To me the Cows seem Bhaga, they seem Indra, they seem a portion of the first-poured Soma. These present Cows, they, O ye Indra. I long for Indra with my heart and spirit.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यू॒यं गा॑वो मेदयथा कृ॒शं चि॑दश्री॒रं चि॑त्कृणुथा सु॒प्रती॑कम् भ॒द्रं गृ॒हं कृ॑णुथ भद्रवाचो बृ॒हद्वो॒ वय॑ उच्यते स॒भासु॑
verses.transliteration: yūyáṃ gāvo medayathā kr̥śáṃ cid  aśrīráṃ cit kr̥ṇuthā suprátīkam  bhadráṃ gr̥háṃ kr̥ṇutha bhadravāco  br̥hád vo váya ucyate sabhā́su

translation.text: O Cows, ye fatten e'en the worn and wasted, and make the unlovely beautiful tolook on. Prosper my house, ye with auspicious voices. Your power is glorified in our assemblies.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र॒जाव॑तीः सू॒यव॑सं रि॒शन्तीः॑ शु॒द्धा अ॒पः सु॑प्रपा॒णे पिब॑न्तीः मा वः॑ स्ते॒न ई॑शत॒ माघशं॑सः॒ परि॑ वो हे॒ती रु॒द्रस्य॑ वृज्याः
verses.transliteration: prajā́vatīḥ sūyávasaṃ riśántīḥ  śuddhā́ apáḥ suprapāṇé píbantīḥ  mā́ va stená īśata mā́gháśaṃsaḥ  pári vo hetī́ rudrásya vr̥jyāḥ

translation.text: Crop goodly pasturage and be prolific drink pure sweet water at good drinking places. Never be thief or sinful man your matter, and may the dart of Rudra still avoid you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उपे॒दमु॑प॒पर्च॑नमा॒सु गोषूप॑ पृच्यताम् उप॑ ऋष॒भस्य॒ रेत॒स्युपे॑न्द्र॒ तव॑ वी॒र्ये॑
verses.transliteration: úpedám upapárcanam  āsú góṣū́pa pr̥cyatām  úpa r̥ṣabhásya rétasi-  úpendra táva vīryè

translation.text: Now let this close admixture be close intermigled with these Cows, Mixt with the Steer's prolific flow, and, Indra, with thy hero might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रं॑ वो॒ नरः॑ स॒ख्याय॑ सेपुर्म॒हो यन्तः॑ सुम॒तये॑ चका॒नाः म॒हो हि दा॒ता वज्र॑हस्तो॒ अस्ति॑ म॒हामु॑ र॒ण्वमव॑से यजध्वम्
verses.transliteration: índraṃ vo náraḥ sakhyā́ya sepur  mahó yántaḥ sumatáye cakānā́ḥ  mahó hí dātā́ vájrahasto ásti  mahā́m u raṇvám ávase yajadhvam

translation.text: YOUR men have followed Indra for his friendship, and for his loving-kindness glorified him. For he bestows great wealth, the Thunder-wielder: worship him, Great and Kind, to win his favour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ यस्मि॒न्हस्ते॒ नर्या॑ मिमि॒क्षुरा रथे॑ हिर॒ण्यये॑ रथे॒ष्ठाः आ र॒श्मयो॒ गभ॑स्त्योः स्थू॒रयो॒राध्व॒न्नश्वा॑सो॒ वृष॑णो युजा॒नाः
verses.transliteration: ā́ yásmin háste náryā mimikṣúr  ā́ ráthe hiraṇyáye ratheṣṭhā́ḥ  ā́ raśmáyo gábhastyo sthūráyor  ā́dhvann áśvāso vŕ̥ṣaṇo yujānā́ḥ

translation.text: Him to whose hand, men closely cling, and drivers stand on his golden chariot firmly stationed. With his firm arms he holds the reins; his Horses, the Stallions, are yoked ready for the journey.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्रि॒ये ते॒ पादा॒ दुव॒ आ मि॑मिक्षुर्धृ॒ष्णुर्व॒ज्री शव॑सा॒ दक्षि॑णावान् वसा॑नो॒ अत्कं॑ सुर॒भिं दृ॒शे कं स्व१॒॑र्ण नृ॑तविषि॒रो ब॑भूथ
verses.transliteration: śriyé te pā́dā dúva ā́ mimikṣur  dhr̥ṣṇúr vajrī́ śávasā dákṣiṇāvān  vásāno átkaṃ surabhíṃ dr̥śé káṃ  svàr ṇá nr̥tav iṣiró babhūtha

translation.text: Thy devotees embrace thy feet for glory. Bold, thunder-armed, rich, through thy strength, in guerdon, Robed in a garment fair as heaven to look on, thou hast displayed thee like an active dancer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स सोम॒ आमि॑श्लतमः सु॒तो भू॒द्यस्मि॑न्प॒क्तिः प॒च्यते॒ सन्ति॑ धा॒नाः इन्द्रं॒ नरः॑ स्तु॒वन्तो॑ ब्रह्मका॒रा उ॒क्था शंस॑न्तो दे॒ववा॑ततमाः
verses.transliteration: sá sóma ā́miślatamaḥ sutó bhūd  yásmin paktíḥ pacyáte sánti dhānā́ḥ  índraṃ nára stuvánto brahmakārā́ḥ-  ukthā́ śáṃsanto devávātatamāḥ

translation.text: That Soma when effused hath best consistence, for which the food is dressed and grain is mingled; By which the men who pray, extolling Indra chief favourites of Gods, recite their praises.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न ते॒ अन्तः॒ शव॑सो धाय्य॒स्य वि तु बा॑बधे॒ रोद॑सी महि॒त्वा आ ता सू॒रिः पृ॑णति॒ तूतु॑जानो यू॒थेवा॒प्सु स॒मीज॑मान ऊ॒ती
verses.transliteration: ná te ántaḥ śávaso dhāyy asyá  ví tú bābadhe ródasī mahitvā́  ā́ tā́ sūríḥ pr̥ṇati tū́tujāno  yūthévāpsú samī́jamāna ūtī́

translation.text: No limit of thy might hath been appointed, which by its greatness sundered earth and heaven. These the Prince filleth full with strong endeavour, driving, as 'twere, with help his flocks to waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वेदिन्द्रः॑ सु॒हव॑ ऋ॒ष्वो अ॑स्तू॒ती अनू॑ती हिरिशि॒प्रः सत्वा॑ ए॒वा हि जा॒तो अस॑मात्योजाः पु॒रू च॑ वृ॒त्रा ह॑नति॒ नि दस्यू॑न्
verses.transliteration: evéd índraḥ suháva r̥ṣvó astu-  -ūtī́ ánūtī hiriśipráḥ sátvā  evā́ hí jātó ásamātyojāḥ  purū́ ca vr̥trā́ hanati ní dásyūn

translation.text: So be the lofty Indra prompt to listen, Helper unaided, golden-visored Hero. Yea, so may he, shown forth in might unequalled, smite down the many Vr̥itras and the Dasyus.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भूय॒ इद्वा॑वृधे वी॒र्या॑यँ॒ एको॑ अजु॒र्यो द॑यते॒ वसू॑नि प्र रि॑रिचे दि॒व इन्द्रः॑ पृथि॒व्या अ॒र्धमिद॑स्य॒ प्रति॒ रोद॑सी उ॒भे
verses.transliteration: bhū́ya íd vāvr̥dhe vīryā̀yam̐  éko ajuryó dayate vásūni  prá ririce divá índraḥ pr̥thivyā́ḥ-  ardhám íd asya práti ródasī ubhé

translation.text: INDRA hath waxed yet more for hero prowess, alone, Eternal, he bestoweth treasures. Indra transcendeth both the worlds in greatness: one half of him equalleth earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अधा॑ मन्ये बृ॒हद॑सु॒र्य॑मस्य॒ यानि॑ दा॒धार॒ नकि॒रा मि॑नाति दि॒वेदि॑वे॒ सूर्यो॑ दर्श॒तो भू॒द्वि सद्मा॑न्युर्वि॒या सु॒क्रतु॑र्धात्
verses.transliteration: ádhā manye br̥hád asuryàm asya  yā́ni dādhā́ra nákir ā́ mināti  divé-dive sū́ryo darśató bhūd  ví sádmāny urviyā́ sukrátur dhāt

translation.text: Yea, mighty I esteem his Godlike nature: none hindereth what he hath once determined. Near and afar he spread and set the regions, and every day the Sun became apparent.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒द्या चि॒न्नू चि॒त्तदपो॑ न॒दीनां॒ यदा॑भ्यो॒ अर॑दो गा॒तुमि॑न्द्र नि पर्व॑ता अद्म॒सदो॒ न से॑दु॒स्त्वया॑ दृ॒ळ्हानि॑ सुक्रतो॒ रजां॑सि
verses.transliteration: adyā́ cin nū́ cit tád ápo nadī́nāṃ  yád ābhyo árado gātúm indra  ní párvatā admasádo ná sedus  tváyā dr̥ḷhā́ni sukrato rájāṃsi

translation.text: E'en now endures thine exploit of the Rivers, when, Indra, for their floods thou clavest passage. Like men who sit at meat the mountains settled: by thee, Most Wise! the regions were made steadfast.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒त्यमित्तन्न त्वावाँ॑ अ॒न्यो अ॒स्तीन्द्र॑ दे॒वो न मर्त्यो॒ ज्याया॑न् अह॒न्नहिं॑ परि॒शया॑न॒मर्णोऽवा॑सृजो अ॒पो अच्छा॑ समु॒द्रम्
verses.transliteration: satyám ít tán ná tvā́vām̐ anyó asti-  -índra devó ná mártyo jyā́yān  áhann áhim pariśáyānam árṇaḥ-  -ávāsr̥jo apó áchā samudrám

translation.text: This is the truth, none else is like thee, Indra, no God superior to thee, no mortal. Thou slewest Ahi who besieged the waters, and lettest loose the streams to hurry seaward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वम॒पो वि दुरो॒ विषू॑ची॒रिन्द्र॑ दृ॒ळ्हम॑रुजः॒ पर्व॑तस्य राजा॑भवो॒ जग॑तश्चर्षणी॒नां सा॒कं सूर्यं॑ ज॒नय॒न्द्यामु॒षास॑म्
verses.transliteration: tvám apó ví dúro víṣūcīr  índra dr̥ḷhám arujaḥ párvatasya  rā́jābhavo jágataś carṣaṇīnā́ṃ  sākáṃ sū́ryaṃ janáyan dyā́m uṣā́sam

translation.text: Indra, thou breakest up the floods and portals on all sides, and the firmness of the mountain. Thou art the King of men, of all that liveth, engendering at once Sun, Heaven, and Morning.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अभू॒रेको॑ रयिपते रयी॒णामा हस्त॑योरधिथा इन्द्र कृ॒ष्टीः वि तो॒के अ॒प्सु तन॑ये च॒ सूरेऽवो॑चन्त चर्ष॒णयो॒ विवा॑चः
verses.transliteration: ábhūr éko rayipate rayīṇā́m  ā́ hástayor adhithā indra kr̥ṣṭī́ḥ  ví toké apsú tánaye ca sū́re-  -ávocanta carṣaṇáyo vívācaḥ

translation.text: SOLE Lord of wealth art thou, O Lord of riches: thou in thine hands hast held the people, Indra! Men have invoked thee with contending voices for seed and waters, progeny and sunlight.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वद्भि॒येन्द्र॒ पार्थि॑वानि॒ विश्वाच्यु॑ता चिच्च्यावयन्ते॒ रजां॑सि द्यावा॒क्षामा॒ पर्व॑तासो॒ वना॑नि॒ विश्वं॑ दृ॒ळ्हं भ॑यते॒ अज्म॒न्ना ते॑
verses.transliteration: tvád bhiyéndra pā́rthivāni víśvā-  -ácyutā cic cyāvayante rájāṃsi  dyā́vākṣā́mā párvatāso vánāni  víśvaṃ dr̥ḷhám bhayate ájmann ā́ te

translation.text: Through fear of thee, O Indra, all the regions of earth, though naught may move them, shake and tremble. All that is firm is frightened at thy coming, -the earth, the heaven, the mountain, and the forest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं कुत्से॑ना॒भि शुष्ण॑मिन्द्रा॒शुषं॑ युध्य॒ कुय॑वं॒ गवि॑ष्टौ दश॑ प्रपि॒त्वे अध॒ सूर्य॑स्य मुषा॒यश्च॒क्रमवि॑वे॒ रपां॑सि
verses.transliteration: tváṃ kútsenābhí śúṣṇam indra-  -aśúṣaṃ yudhya kúyavaṃ gáviṣṭau  dáśa prapitvé ádha sū́ryasya  muṣāyáś cakrám áviver ápāṃsi

translation.text: With Kutsa, Indra! thou didst conquer Ṣushṇa, voracious, bane of crops, in fight for cattle. In the close fray thou rentest him: thou stolest the Sun's wheel and didst drive away misfortunes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं श॒तान्यव॒ शम्ब॑रस्य॒ पुरो॑ जघन्थाप्र॒तीनि॒ दस्योः॑ अशि॑क्षो॒ यत्र॒ शच्या॑ शचीवो॒ दिवो॑दासाय सुन्व॒ते सु॑तक्रे भ॒रद्वा॑जाय गृण॒ते वसू॑नि
verses.transliteration: tváṃ śatā́ny áva śámbarasya  púro jaghanthāpratī́ni dásyoḥ  áśikṣo yátra śácyā śacīvo  dívodāsāya sunvaté sutakre  bharádvājāya gr̥ṇaté vásūni

translation.text: Thou smotest to the ground the hundred castles, impregnable, of Ṣambara the Dasyu, When, Strong, with might thou holpest Divodâsa who poured libations out, O Soma-buyer, and madest Bharadvâja rich who praised thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स स॑त्यसत्वन्मह॒ते रणा॑य॒ रथ॒मा ति॑ष्ठ तुविनृम्ण भी॒मम् या॒हि प्र॑पथि॒न्नव॒सोप॑ म॒द्रिक्प्र च॑ श्रुत श्रावय चर्ष॒णिभ्यः॑
verses.transliteration: sá satyasatvan mahaté ráṇāya  rátham ā́ tiṣṭha tuvinr̥mṇa bhīmám  yāhí prapathinn ávasópa madrík  prá ca śruta śrāvaya carṣaṇíbhyaḥ

translation.text: As such, true Hero, for great joy of battle mount thy terrific car, O Brave and Manly. Come with thine help to me, thou distant Roamer, and, glorious God, spread among men my glory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अपू॑र्व्या पुरु॒तमा॑न्यस्मै म॒हे वी॒राय॑ त॒वसे॑ तु॒राय॑ वि॒र॒प्शिने॑ व॒ज्रिणे॒ शंत॑मानि॒ वचां॑स्या॒सा स्थवि॑राय तक्षम्
verses.transliteration: ápūrvyā purutámāny asmai  mahé vīrā́ya taváse turā́ya  virapśíne vajríṇe śáṃtamāni  vácāṃsy āsā́ sthávirāya takṣam

translation.text: I WITH my lips have fashioned for this Hero words never matched, most plentiful and auspicious, For him the Ancient, Great, Strong, Energetic, the very mighty Wielder of the Thunder.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स मा॒तरा॒ सूर्ये॑णा कवी॒नामवा॑सयद्रु॒जदद्रिं॑ गृणा॒नः स्वा॒धीभि॒र्ऋक्व॑भिर्वावशा॒न उदु॒स्रिया॑णामसृजन्नि॒दान॑म्
verses.transliteration: sá mātárā sū́ryeṇā kavīnā́m  ávāsayad rujád ádriṃ gr̥ṇānáḥ  svādhī́bhir ŕ̥kvabhir vāvaśānáḥ-  úd usríyāṇām asr̥jan nidā́nam

translation.text: Amid the sages, with the Sun he brightened the Parents: glorified, he burst the mountain; And, roaring with the holy-thoughted singers, he loosed the bond that held the beams of Morning.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स वह्नि॑भि॒र्ऋक्व॑भि॒र्गोषु॒ शश्व॑न्मि॒तज्ञु॑भिः पुरु॒कृत्वा॑ जिगाय पुरः॑ पुरो॒हा सखि॑भिः सखी॒यन्दृ॒ळ्हा रु॑रोज क॒विभिः॑ क॒विः सन्
verses.transliteration: sá váhnibhir ŕ̥kvabhir góṣu śáśvan  mitájñubhiḥ purukŕ̥tvā jigāya  púraḥ purohā́ sákhibhiḥ sakhīyán  dr̥ḷhā́ ruroja kavíbhiḥ kavíḥ sán

translation.text: Famed for great deeds, with priests who kneel and laud him, he still hath conquered in the frays for cattle, And broken down the forts, the Fort-destroyer, a Friend with friends, a Sage among the sages.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स नी॒व्या॑भिर्जरि॒तार॒मच्छा॑ म॒हो वाजे॑भिर्म॒हद्भि॑श्च॒ शुष्मैः॑ पु॒रु॒वीरा॑भिर्वृषभ क्षिती॒नामा गि॑र्वणः सुवि॒ताय॒ प्र या॑हि
verses.transliteration: sá nīvyā̀bhir jaritā́ram áchā  mahó vā́jebhir mahádbhiś ca śúṣmaiḥ  puruvī́rābhir vr̥ṣabha kṣitīnā́m  ā́ girvaṇaḥ suvitā́ya prá yāhi

translation.text: Come with thy girthed mares, with abundant vigour and plenteous strength to him who sings thy praises. Come hither, borne by mares with many heroes, Lover of song! Steer! for the people's welfare.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स सर्गे॑ण॒ शव॑सा त॒क्तो अत्यै॑र॒प इन्द्रो॑ दक्षिण॒तस्तु॑रा॒षाट् इ॒त्था सृ॑जा॒ना अन॑पावृ॒दर्थं॑ दि॒वेदि॑वे विविषुरप्रमृ॒ष्यम्
verses.transliteration: sá sárgeṇa śávasā taktó átyair  apá índro dakṣiṇatás turāṣā́ṭ  itthā́ sr̥jānā́ ánapāvr̥d árthaṃ  divé-dive viviṣur apramr̥ṣyám

translation.text: Indra with rush and might, sped by his Coursers, hath swiftly won the waters from the southward. Thus set at liberty the rivers daily flow to their goal, incessant and exhaustless.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य ओजि॑ष्ठ इन्द्र॒ तं सु नो॑ दा॒ मदो॑ वृषन्त्स्वभि॒ष्टिर्दास्वा॑न् सौव॑श्व्यं॒ यो व॒नव॒त्स्वश्वो॑ वृ॒त्रा स॒मत्सु॑ सा॒सह॑द॒मित्रा॑न्
verses.transliteration: yá ójiṣṭha indra táṃ sú no dāḥ-  mádo vr̥ṣan svabhiṣṭír dā́svān  saúvaśvyaṃ yó vanávat sváśvo  vr̥trā́ samátsu sāsáhad amítrān

translation.text: GIVE us the rapture that is mightiest, Indra, prompt to bestow and swift to aid, O Hero, That wins with brave steeds where brave steeds encounter, and quells the Vr̥itras and the foes in battle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वां ही॒३॒॑न्द्राव॑से॒ विवा॑चो॒ हव॑न्ते चर्ष॒णयः॒ शूर॑सातौ त्वं विप्रे॑भि॒र्वि प॒णीँर॑शाय॒स्त्वोत॒ इत्सनि॑ता॒ वाज॒मर्वा॑
verses.transliteration: tvā́ṃ hī̀ndrā́vase vívāco  hávante carṣaṇáyaḥ śū́rasātau  tváṃ víprebhir ví paṇī́m̐r aśāyas  tvóta ít sánitā vā́jam árvā

translation.text: For with loud voice the tribes invoke thee, Indra, to aid them in the battlefield of heroes. Thou, with the singers, hast pierced through the Paṇis: the charger whom thou aidest wins the booty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं ताँ इ॑न्द्रो॒भयाँ॑ अ॒मित्रा॒न्दासा॑ वृ॒त्राण्यार्या॑ च शूर वधी॒र्वने॑व॒ सुधि॑तेभि॒रत्कै॒रा पृ॒त्सु द॑र्षि नृ॒णां नृ॑तम
verses.transliteration: tváṃ tā́m̐ indrobháyām̐ amítrān  dā́sā vr̥trā́ṇy ā́ryā ca śūra  vádhīr váneva súdhitebhir átkair  ā́ pr̥tsú darṣi nr̥ṇā́ṃ nr̥tama

translation.text: Both races, Indra, of opposing foemen, O Hero, both the Ârya and the Dâsa, Hast thou struck down like woods with well-shot lightnings: thou rentest them in fight, most manly Chieftain!

verses.sanskrit_deva: स त्वं न॑ इ॒न्द्राक॑वाभिरू॒ती सखा॑ वि॒श्वायु॑रवि॒ता वृ॒धे भूः॑ स्व॑र्षाता॒ यद्ध्वया॑मसि त्वा॒ युध्य॑न्तो ने॒मधि॑ता पृ॒त्सु शू॑र
verses.transliteration: sá tváṃ na indrā́kavābhir ūtī́  sákhā viśvā́yur avitā́ vr̥dhé bhūḥ  svàrṣātā yád dhváyāmasi tvā  yúdhyanto nemádhitā pr̥tsú śūra

translation.text: Indra, befriend us with no scanty succour, prosper and aid us, Loved of all that liveth, When, fighting for the sunlight, we invoke thee, O Hero, in the fray, in war's division.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू॒नं न॑ इन्द्राप॒राय॑ च स्या॒ भवा॑ मृळी॒क उ॒त नो॑ अ॒भिष्टौ॑ इ॒त्था गृ॒णन्तो॑ म॒हिन॑स्य॒ शर्म॑न्दि॒वि ष्या॑म॒ पार्ये॑ गो॒षत॑माः
verses.transliteration: nūnáṃ na indrāparā́ya ca syāḥ-  bhávā mr̥ḷīká utá no abhíṣṭau  itthā́ gr̥ṇánto mahínasya śárman  diví ṣyāma pā́rye goṣátamāḥ

translation.text: Be ours, O Indra, now and for the future, be graciously inclined and near to help us. Thus may we, singing, sheltered by the Mighty, win many cattle on the day of trial.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं च॒ त्वे ज॒ग्मुर्गिर॑ इन्द्र पू॒र्वीर्वि च॒ त्वद्य॑न्ति वि॒भ्वो॑ मनी॒षाः पु॒रा नू॒नं च॑ स्तु॒तय॒ ऋषी॑णां पस्पृ॒ध्र इन्द्रे॒ अध्यु॑क्था॒र्का
verses.transliteration: sáṃ ca tvé jagmúr gíra indra pūrvī́r  ví ca tvád yanti vibhvò manīṣā́ḥ  purā́ nūnáṃ ca stutáya ŕ̥ṣīṇām  paspr̥dhrá índre ádhy ukthārkā́

translation.text: FULL Many songs have met in thee, O Indra, and many a noble thought from thee proceedeth. Now and of old the eulogies of sages, their holy hymns and lauds, have yearned for Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒रु॒हू॒तो यः पु॑रुगू॒र्त ऋभ्वाँ॒ एकः॑ पुरुप्रश॒स्तो अस्ति॑ य॒ज्ञैः रथो॒ न म॒हे शव॑से युजा॒नो॒३॒॑ऽस्माभि॒रिन्द्रो॑ अनु॒माद्यो॑ भूत्
verses.transliteration: puruhūtó yáḥ purugūrtá ŕ̥bhvām̐  ékaḥ purupraśastó ásti yajñaíḥ  rátho ná mahé śávase yujānáḥ-  -asmā́bhir índro anumā́dyo bhūt

translation.text: He, praised of many, bold, invoked of many, alone is glorified at sacrifices. Like a car harnessed for some great achievement, Indra must be the cause of our rejoicing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न यं हिंस॑न्ति धी॒तयो॒ न वाणी॒रिन्द्रं॒ नक्ष॒न्तीद॒भि व॒र्धय॑न्तीः यदि॑ स्तो॒तारः॑ श॒तं यत्स॒हस्रं॑ गृ॒णन्ति॒ गिर्व॑णसं॒ शं तद॑स्मै
verses.transliteration: ná yáṃ híṃsanti dhītáyo ná vā́ṇīr  índraṃ nákṣantī́d abhí vardháyantīḥ  yádi stotā́raḥ śatáṃ yát sahásraṃ  gr̥ṇánti gírvaṇasaṃ śáṃ tád asmai

translation.text: They make their way to Indra and exalt him, bim whom no prayers and no laudations trouble; For when a hundred or a thousand singers. laud him who loves the song their praise delights him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अस्मा॑ ए॒तद्दि॒व्य१॒॑र्चेव॑ मा॒सा मि॑मि॒क्ष इन्द्रे॒ न्य॑यामि॒ सोमः॑ जनं॒ न धन्व॑न्न॒भि सं यदापः॑ स॒त्रा वा॑वृधु॒र्हव॑नानि य॒ज्ञैः
verses.transliteration: ásmā etád divy àrcéva māsā́  mimikṣá índre ny àyāmi sómaḥ  jánaṃ ná dhánvann abhí sáṃ yád ā́paḥ  satrā́ vāvr̥dhur hávanāni yajñaíḥ

translation.text: As brightness mingles with the Moon in heaven, the offered Soma yearns to mix with Indra. Like water brought to men in desert places, our gifts at sacrifice have still refreshed him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अस्मा॑ ए॒तन्मह्या॑ङ्गू॒षम॑स्मा॒ इन्द्रा॑य स्तो॒त्रं म॒तिभि॑रवाचि अस॒द्यथा॑ मह॒ति वृ॑त्र॒तूर्य॒ इन्द्रो॑ वि॒श्वायु॑रवि॒ता वृ॒धश्च॑
verses.transliteration: ásmā etán máhy āṅgūṣám asmai-  índrāya stotrám matíbhir avāci  ásad yáthā mahatí vr̥tratū́rye-  índro viśvā́yur avitā́ vr̥dháś ca

translation.text: To him this mighty eulogy, to Indra hath this our laud been uttered by the poets, That in the great encounter with the foemen, Loved of all life, Indra may guard and help us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क॒दा भु॑व॒न्रथ॑क्षयाणि॒ ब्रह्म॑ क॒दा स्तो॒त्रे स॑हस्रपो॒ष्यं॑ दाः क॒दा स्तोमं॑ वासयोऽस्य रा॒या क॒दा धियः॑ करसि॒ वाज॑रत्नाः
verses.transliteration: kadā́ bhuvan ráthakṣayāṇi bráhma  kadā́ stotré sahasrapoṣyàṃ dāḥ  kadā́ stómaṃ vāsayo 'sya rāyā́  kadā́ dhíyaḥ karasi vā́jaratnāḥ

translation.text: WHEN shall our prayers rest in thy car beside thee? When dost thou give the singer food for thousands? When wilt thou clothe this poet's laud with plenty, and when wilt thou enrich our hymns with booty?

verses.sanskrit_deva: कर्हि॑ स्वि॒त्तदि॑न्द्र॒ यन्नृभि॒र्नॄन्वी॒रैर्वी॒रान्नी॒ळया॑से॒ जया॒जीन् त्रि॒धातु॒ गा अधि॑ जयासि॒ गोष्विन्द्र॑ द्यु॒म्नं स्व॑र्वद्धेह्य॒स्मे
