verses.transliteration: kárhi svit tád indra yán nŕ̥bhir nr̥̄́n  vīraír vīrā́n nīḷáyāse jáyājī́n  tridhā́tu gā́ ádhi jayāsi góṣu-  índra dyumnáṃ svàrvad dhehy asmé

translation.text: When wilt thou gather men with men, O Indra, heroes with heroes, and prevail in combat? Thou shalt win triply kine in frays for cattle, so, Indra, give thou us celestial glory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कर्हि॑ स्वि॒त्तदि॑न्द्र॒ यज्ज॑रि॒त्रे वि॒श्वप्सु॒ ब्रह्म॑ कृ॒णवः॑ शविष्ठ क॒दा धियो॒ न नि॒युतो॑ युवासे क॒दा गोम॑घा॒ हव॑नानि गच्छाः
verses.transliteration: kárhi svit tád indra yáj jaritré  viśvápsu bráhma kr̥ṇávaḥ śaviṣṭha  kadā́ dhíyo ná niyúto yuvāse  kadā́ gómaghā hávanāni gachāḥ

translation.text: Yea, when wilt thou, O Indra, thou Most Mighty, make the prayer all-sustaining for the singer? When wilt thou yoke, as we yoke songs, thy Horses, and come to offerings that bring wealth in cattle?

verses.sanskrit_deva: स गोम॑घा जरि॒त्रे अश्व॑श्चन्द्रा॒ वाज॑श्रवसो॒ अधि॑ धेहि॒ पृक्षः॑ पी॒पि॒हीषः॑ सु॒दुघा॑मिन्द्र धे॒नुं भ॒रद्वा॑जेषु सु॒रुचो॑ रुरुच्याः
verses.transliteration: sá gómaghā jaritré áśvaścandrāḥ-  vā́jaśravaso ádhi dhehi pŕ̥kṣaḥ  pīpihī́ṣaḥ sudúghām indra dhenúm  bharádvājeṣu surúco rurucyāḥ

translation.text: Grant to the Singer food with store of cattle, splendid with horses and the fame of riches. Send food to swell the milch-cow good at milking: bright be its shine among the Bharadvâjas.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमा नू॒नं वृ॒जन॑म॒न्यथा॑ चि॒च्छूरो॒ यच्छ॑क्र॒ वि दुरो॑ गृणी॒षे मा निर॑रं शुक्र॒दुघ॑स्य धे॒नोरा॑ङ्गिर॒सान्ब्रह्म॑णा विप्र जिन्व
verses.transliteration: tám ā́ nūnáṃ vr̥jánam anyáthā cic  -śū́ro yác chakra ví dúro gr̥ṇīṣé  mā́ nír araṃ śukradúghasya dhenór  āṅgirasā́n bráhmaṇā vipra jinva

translation.text: Lead otherwise this present foeman, Ṣakra! Hence art thou praised as Hero, foe destroyer Him who gives pure gifts may I praise unceasing. Sage, quicken the Angirases by devotion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒त्रा मदा॑स॒स्तव॑ वि॒श्वज॑न्याः स॒त्रा रायोऽध॒ ये पार्थि॑वासः स॒त्रा वाजा॑नामभवो विभ॒क्ता यद्दे॒वेषु॑ धा॒रय॑था असु॒र्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: satrā́ mádāsas táva viśvájanyāḥ  satrā́ rā́yó 'dha yé pā́rthivāsaḥ  satrā́ vā́jānām abhavo vibhaktā́  yád devéṣu dhāráyathā asuryàm

translation.text: THY raptures ever were for all men's profit: so evermore have been thine earthly riches. Thou still hast been the dealer-forth of vigour, since among Gods thou hast had power and Godhead.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अनु॒ प्र ये॑जे॒ जन॒ ओजो॑ अस्य स॒त्रा द॑धिरे॒ अनु॑ वी॒र्या॑य स्यू॒म॒गृभे॒ दुध॒येऽर्व॑ते च॒ क्रतुं॑ वृञ्ज॒न्त्यपि॑ वृत्र॒हत्ये॑
verses.transliteration: ánu prá yeje jána ójo asya  satrā́ dadhire ánu vīryā̀ya  syūmagŕ̥bhe dúdhayé 'rvate ca  krátuṃ vr̥ñjanty ápi vr̥trahátye

translation.text: Men have obtained his strength by sacrificing, and ever urged him, on to hero valour. For the rein-seizing, the impetuous Charger they furnished power even for Vr̥itra's slaughter.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं स॒ध्रीची॑रू॒तयो॒ वृष्ण्या॑नि॒ पौंस्या॑नि नि॒युतः॑ सश्चु॒रिन्द्र॑म् स॒मु॒द्रं न सिन्ध॑व उ॒क्थशु॑ष्मा उरु॒व्यच॑सं॒ गिर॒ आ वि॑शन्ति
verses.transliteration: táṃ sadhrī́cīr ūtáyo vŕ̥ṣṇyāni  paúṃsyāni niyútaḥ saścur índram  samudráṃ ná síndhava uktháśuṣmāḥ-  uruvyácasaṃ gíra ā́ viśanti

translation.text: Associate with him, as teams of horses, help, manly might, and vigour follow Indra. As rivers reach the sea, so, strong with praises, our holy songs reach him the Comprehensive.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स रा॒यस्खामुप॑ सृजा गृणा॒नः पु॑रुश्च॒न्द्रस्य॒ त्वमि॑न्द्र॒ वस्वः॑ पति॑र्बभू॒थास॑मो॒ जना॑ना॒मेको॒ विश्व॑स्य॒ भुव॑नस्य॒ राजा॑
verses.transliteration: sá rāyás khā́m úpa sr̥jā gr̥ṇānáḥ  puruścandrásya tvám indra vásvaḥ  pátir babhūthā́samo jánānām  éko víśvasya bhúvanasya rā́jā

translation.text: Lauded by us, let flow the spring, O Indra, of excellent and brightly-shining riches. For thou art Lord of men, without an equal: of all the world thou art the only Sovran.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स तु श्रु॑धि॒ श्रुत्या॒ यो दु॑वो॒युर्द्यौर्न भूमा॒भि रायो॑ अ॒र्यः असो॒ यथा॑ नः॒ शव॑सा चका॒नो यु॒गेयु॑गे॒ वय॑सा॒ चेकि॑तानः
verses.transliteration: sá tú śrudhi śrútyā yó duvoyúr  dyaúr ná bhū́mābhí rā́yo aryáḥ  áso yáthā naḥ śávasā cakānó  yugé-yuge váyasā cékitānaḥ

translation.text: Hear what thou mayst hear, thou who, fain for worship, as heaven girds earth, guardest thy servant's treasure; Tlat thou mayst be our own, joying in power, famed through thy might in every generation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒र्वाग्रथं॑ वि॒श्ववा॑रं त उ॒ग्रेन्द्र॑ यु॒क्तासो॒ हर॑यो वहन्तु की॒रिश्चि॒द्धि त्वा॒ हव॑ते॒ स्व॑र्वानृधी॒महि॑ सध॒माद॑स्ते अ॒द्य
verses.transliteration: arvā́g ráthaṃ viśvávāraṃ ta ugra-  -índra yuktā́so hárayo vahantu  kīríś cid dhí tvā hávate svàrvān  r̥dhīmáhi sadhamā́das te adyá

translation.text: LET thy Bay Horses, yoked, O mighty Indra, bring thy car hither fraught with every blessing. For thee, the Heavenly, e'en the poor invoketh: may we this day, thy feast-companions, prosper.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रो द्रोणे॒ हर॑यः॒ कर्मा॑ग्मन्पुना॒नास॒ ऋज्य॑न्तो अभूवन् इन्द्रो॑ नो अ॒स्य पू॒र्व्यः प॑पीयाद्द्यु॒क्षो मद॑स्य सो॒म्यस्य॒ राजा॑
verses.transliteration: pró dróṇe hárayaḥ kármāgman  punānā́sa ŕ̥jyanto abhūvan  índro no asyá pūrvyáḥ papīyād  dyukṣó mádasya somyásya rā́jā

translation.text: Forth to the vat the brown drops flow for service, and purified proceed directly forward. May Indra drink of this, our guest aforetime, Celestial King of the strong draught of Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒स॒स्रा॒णासः॑ शवसा॒नमच्छेन्द्रं॑ सुच॒क्रे र॒थ्या॑सो॒ अश्वाः॑ अ॒भि श्रव॒ ऋज्य॑न्तो वहेयु॒र्नू चि॒न्नु वा॒योर॒मृतं॒ वि द॑स्येत्
verses.transliteration: āsasrāṇā́saḥ śavasānám áchā-  -índraṃ sucakré rathyā̀so áśvāḥ  abhí śráva ŕ̥jyanto vaheyur  nū́ cin nú vāyór amŕ̥taṃ ví dasyet

translation.text: Bringing us hitherward all-potent Indra on well-wheeled chariot, may the Steeds who bear him Convey him on the road direct to glory, and ne'er may Vâyu's Amrit cease and fail him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वरि॑ष्ठो अस्य॒ दक्षि॑णामिय॒र्तीन्द्रो॑ म॒घोनां॑ तुविकू॒र्मित॑मः यया॑ वज्रिवः परि॒यास्यंहो॑ म॒घा च॑ धृष्णो॒ दय॑से॒ वि सू॒रीन्
verses.transliteration: váriṣṭho asya dákṣiṇām iyarti-  -índro maghónāṃ tuvikūrmítamaḥ  yáyā vajrivaḥ pariyā́sy áṃho  maghā́ ca dhr̥ṣṇo dáyase ví sūrī́n

translation.text: Supreme, he stirs this man to give the guerdon,– Indra, most efficacious of the princes,– Wherewith, O Thunderer, thou removest sorrow, and, Bold One! partest wealth among the nobles.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रो॒ वाज॑स्य॒ स्थवि॑रस्य दा॒तेन्द्रो॑ गी॒र्भिर्व॑र्धतां वृ॒द्धम॑हाः इन्द्रो॑ वृ॒त्रं हनि॑ष्ठो अस्तु॒ सत्वा ता सू॒रिः पृ॑णति॒ तूतु॑जानः
verses.transliteration: índro vā́jasya sthávirasya dātā́-  -índro gīrbhír vardhatāṃ vr̥ddhámahāḥ  índro vr̥tráṃ hániṣṭho astu sátvā-  ā́ tā́ sūríḥ pr̥ṇati tū́tujāno

translation.text: Indra is hewho gives enduring vigour: may our songs magnify the God Most Mighty. Best Vr̥itra-slayer be the Hero Indra these things he gives as Prince, with strong endeavour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अपा॑दि॒त उदु॑ नश्चि॒त्रत॑मो म॒हीं भ॑र्षद्द्यु॒मती॒मिन्द्र॑हूतिम् पन्य॑सीं धी॒तिं दैव्य॑स्य॒ याम॒ञ्जन॑स्य रा॒तिं व॑नते सु॒दानुः॑
verses.transliteration: ápād itá úd u naś citrátamo  mahī́m bharṣad dyumátīm índrahūtim  pányasīṃ dhītíṃ daívyasya yā́mañ  jánasya rātíṃ vanate sudā́nuḥ

translation.text: HE hath drunk hence, Most Marvellous, and carried away our great and splendid call on Indra. The Bounteous, when we serve the Gods, accepteth song yet more famous and the gifts we bring him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दू॒राच्चि॒दा व॑सतो अस्य॒ कर्णा॒ घोषा॒दिन्द्र॑स्य तन्यति ब्रुवा॒णः एयमे॑नं दे॒वहू॑तिर्ववृत्यान्म॒द्र्य१॒॑गिन्द्र॑मि॒यमृ॒च्यमा॑ना
verses.transliteration: dūrā́c cid ā́ vasato asya kárṇā  ghóṣād índrasya tanyati bruvāṇáḥ  éyám enaṃ deváhūtir vavr̥tyāt-  madryàg índram iyám r̥cyámānā

translation.text: The speaker filleth with a cry to Indra his ears who cometh nigh e'en from a distance. May this my call bring Indra to my presence, this call to Gods composed in sacred verses.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं वो॑ धि॒या प॑र॒मया॑ पुरा॒जाम॒जर॒मिन्द्र॑म॒भ्य॑नूष्य॒र्कैः ब्रह्मा॑ च॒ गिरो॑ दधि॒रे सम॑स्मिन्म॒हाँश्च॒ स्तोमो॒ अधि॑ वर्ध॒दिन्द्रे॑
verses.transliteration: táṃ vo dhiyā́ paramáyā purājā́m  ajáram índram abhy ànūṣy arkaíḥ  bráhmā ca gíro dadhiré sám asmin  mahā́ṃś ca stómo ádhi vardhad índre

translation.text: Him have I sung with my best song and praises, Indra of ancient birth and Everlasting. For prayer and songs in him are concentrated: let laud wax mighty when addressed to Indra:

verses.sanskrit_deva: वर्धा॒द्यं य॒ज्ञ उ॒त सोम॒ इन्द्रं॒ वर्धा॒द्ब्रह्म॒ गिर॑ उ॒क्था च॒ मन्म॑ वर्धाहै॑नमु॒षसो॒ याम॑न्न॒क्तोर्वर्धा॒न्मासाः॑ श॒रदो॒ द्याव॒ इन्द्र॑म्
verses.transliteration: várdhād yáṃ yajñá utá sóma índraṃ  várdhād bráhma gíra ukthā́ ca mánma  várdhā́hainam uṣáso yā́mann aktór  várdhān mā́sāḥ śarádo dyā́va índram

translation.text: Indra, whom sacrifice shall strengthen, Soma, and song and hymn, and praises and devotion, Whom Dawns shall strengthen when the night departeth, Indra whom days shall strengthen, months, and autumns.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा ज॑ज्ञा॒नं सह॑से॒ असा॑मि वावृधा॒नं राध॑से च श्रु॒ताय॑ म॒हामु॒ग्रमव॑से विप्र नू॒नमा वि॑वासेम वृत्र॒तूर्ये॑षु
verses.transliteration: evā́ jajñānáṃ sáhase ásāmi  vāvr̥dhānáṃ rā́dhase ca śrutā́ya  mahā́m ugrám ávase vipra nūnám  ā́ vivāsema vr̥tratū́ryeṣu

translation.text: Him, born for conquering might in full perfection, and waxen strongfor bounty and for glory, Great, Powerful, will we to-day, O singer, invite to aid. us and to quell our foemen.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒न्द्रस्य॑ क॒वेर्दि॒व्यस्य॒ वह्ने॒र्विप्र॑मन्मनो वच॒नस्य॒ मध्वः॑ अपा॑ न॒स्तस्य॑ सच॒नस्य॑ दे॒वेषो॑ युवस्व गृण॒ते गोअ॑ग्राः
verses.transliteration: mandrásya kavér divyásya váhner  vípramanmano vacanásya mádhvaḥ  ápā nas tásya sacanásya deva-  -íṣo yuvasva gr̥ṇaté góagrāḥ

translation.text: OF this our charming, our celestial Soma, eloquent, wise, Priest, with inspired devotion, Of this thy close attendant, hast thou drunken. God, send the singer food with milk to grace it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यमु॑शा॒नः पर्यद्रि॑मु॒स्रा ऋ॒तधी॑तिभिर्ऋत॒युग्यु॑जा॒नः रु॒जदरु॑ग्णं॒ वि व॒लस्य॒ सानुं॑ प॒णीँर्वचो॑भिर॒भि यो॑ध॒दिन्द्रः॑
verses.transliteration: ayám uśānáḥ páry ádrim usrā́ḥ-  r̥tádhītibhir r̥tayúg yujānáḥ  rujád árugṇaṃ ví valásya sā́num  paṇī́m̐r vácobhir abhí yodhad índraḥ

translation.text: Craving the kine, rushing against the mountain led on by Law, with holyminded comrades, He broke the never-broken ridge of Vala. With words of might Indra subdued the Paṇis.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं द्यो॑तयद॒द्युतो॒ व्य१॒॑क्तून्दो॒षा वस्तोः॑ श॒रद॒ इन्दु॑रिन्द्र इ॒मं के॒तुम॑दधु॒र्नू चि॒दह्नां॒ शुचि॑जन्मन उ॒षस॑श्चकार
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ dyotayad adyúto vy àktū́n  doṣā́ vástoḥ śaráda índur indra  imáṃ ketúm adadhur nū́ cid áhnāṃ  śúcijanmana uṣásaś cakāra

translation.text: This Indu lighted darksome nights, O Indra, throughout the years, at morning and at evening. Him have they stablished as the days' bright ensign. He made the Mornings to be born in splendour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं रो॑चयद॒रुचो॑ रुचा॒नो॒३॒॑ऽयं वा॑सय॒द्व्यृ१॒॑तेन॑ पू॒र्वीः अ॒यमी॑यत ऋत॒युग्भि॒रश्वैः॑ स्व॒र्विदा॒ नाभि॑ना चर्षणि॒प्राः
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ rocayad arúco rucānáḥ-  -ayáṃ vāsayad vy r̥̀téna pūrvī́ḥ  ayám īyata r̥tayúgbhir áśvaiḥ  svarvídā nā́bhinā carṣaṇiprā́ḥ

translation.text: He shone and caused to shme the worlds that shone not. By Law he lighted up the host of Mornings. He moves with Steeds yoked by eternal Order, contenting men with nave that finds the sunlight.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू गृ॑णा॒नो गृ॑ण॒ते प्र॑त्न राज॒न्निषः॑ पिन्व वसु॒देया॑य पू॒र्वीः अ॒प ओष॑धीरवि॒षा वना॑नि॒ गा अर्व॑तो॒ नॄनृ॒चसे॑ रिरीहि
verses.transliteration: nū́ gr̥ṇānó gr̥ṇaté pratna rājann  íṣaḥ pinva vasudéyāya pūrvī́ḥ  apá óṣadhīr aviṣā́ vánāni  gā́ árvato nr̥̄́n r̥cáse rirīhi

translation.text: Now, praised, O Ancient King! fill thou the singer with plenteous food that he may deal forth treasures. Give waters, herbs that have no poison, forests, and kine, and steeds, and men, to him who lauds thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॒ पिब॒ तुभ्यं॑ सु॒तो मदा॒याव॑ स्य॒ हरी॒ वि मु॑चा॒ सखा॑या उ॒त प्र गा॑य ग॒ण आ नि॒षद्याथा॑ य॒ज्ञाय॑ गृण॒ते वयो॑ धाः
verses.transliteration: índra píba túbhyaṃ sutó mádāya-  -áva sya hárī ví mucā sákhāyā  utá prá gāya gaṇá ā́ niṣádya-  -áthā yajñā́ya gr̥ṇaté váyo dhāḥ

translation.text: DRINK, Indra; juice is shed to make thee joyful: loose thy Bay Steeds and give thy friends their freedom. Begin the song, seated in our assembly. Give strength for sacrifice to him who singeth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अस्य॑ पिब॒ यस्य॑ जज्ञा॒न इ॑न्द्र॒ मदा॑य॒ क्रत्वे॒ अपि॑बो विरप्शिन् तमु॑ ते॒ गावो॒ नर॒ आपो॒ अद्रि॒रिन्दुं॒ सम॑ह्यन्पी॒तये॒ सम॑स्मै
verses.transliteration: ásya piba yásya jajñāná indra  mádāya krátve ápibo virapśin  tám u te gā́vo nára ā́po ádrir  índuṃ sám ahyan pītáye sám asmai

translation.text: Drink thou of this whereof at birth, O Indra, thou drankest, Mighty One for power and rapture. The men, the pressing-stones, the cows, the waters have made this Soma ready for thy drinking.

verses.sanskrit_deva: समि॑द्धे अ॒ग्नौ सु॒त इ॑न्द्र॒ सोम॒ आ त्वा॑ वहन्तु॒ हर॑यो॒ वहि॑ष्ठाः त्वा॒य॒ता मन॑सा जोहवी॒मीन्द्रा या॑हि सुवि॒ताय॑ म॒हे नः॑
verses.transliteration: sámiddhe agnaú sutá indra sóme-  ā́ tvā vahantu hárayo váhiṣṭhāḥ  tvāyatā́ mánasā johavīmi-  -índrā́ yāhi suvitā́ya mahé naḥ

translation.text: The fire is kindled, Soma pressed, O Indra: let thy Bays, best to draw, convey thee hither. With mind devoted, Indra, I invoke thee. Come, for our great prosperity approach us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ या॑हि॒ शश्व॑दुश॒ता य॑या॒थेन्द्र॑ म॒हा मन॑सा सोम॒पेय॑म् उप॒ ब्रह्मा॑णि शृणव इ॒मा नोऽथा॑ ते य॒ज्ञस्त॒न्वे॒३॒॑ वयो॑ धात्
verses.transliteration: ā́ yāhi śáśvad uśatā́ yayātha-  -índra mahā́ mánasā somapéyam  úpa bráhmāṇi śr̥ṇava imā́ naḥ-  -áthā te yajñás tanvè váyo dhāt

translation.text: Indra, come hither: evermore thou camest through our great strong desire to drink the Soma. Listen and hear the prayers which now we offer, and let this sacrifice increase thy vigour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदि॑न्द्र दि॒वि पार्ये॒ यदृध॒ग्यद्वा॒ स्वे सद॑ने॒ यत्र॒ वासि॑ अतो॑ नो य॒ज्ञमव॑से नि॒युत्वा॑न्त्स॒जोषाः॑ पाहि गिर्वणो म॒रुद्भिः॑
verses.transliteration: yád indra diví pā́rye yád ŕ̥dhag  yád vā své sádane yátra vā́si  áto no yajñám ávase niyútvān  sajóṣāḥ pāhi girvaṇo marúdbhiḥ

translation.text: Mayst thou, O Indra, on the day of trial, present or absent, wheresoe'er thou dwellest, Thence, with thy team, accordant with the Maruts, Song-lover! guard our sacrifice, to help us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अहे॑ळमान॒ उप॑ याहि य॒ज्ञं तुभ्यं॑ पवन्त॒ इन्द॑वः सु॒तासः॑ गावो॒ न व॑ज्रि॒न्त्स्वमोको॒ अच्छेन्द्रा ग॑हि प्रथ॒मो य॒ज्ञिया॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: áheḷamāna úpa yāhi yajñáṃ  túbhyam pavanta índavaḥ sutā́saḥ  gā́vo ná vajrin svám óko áchā-  -índrā́ gahi prathamó yajñíyānām

translation.text: COME gracious to our sacrifice, O Indra: pressed Soma-drops are purified to please thee. As cattle seek their home, so Thunderwielder, come, Indra, first of those who claim our worship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या ते॑ का॒कुत्सुकृ॑ता॒ या वरि॑ष्ठा॒ यया॒ शश्व॒त्पिब॑सि॒ मध्व॑ ऊ॒र्मिम् तया॑ पाहि॒ प्र ते॑ अध्व॒र्युर॑स्था॒त्सं ते॒ वज्रो॑ वर्ततामिन्द्र ग॒व्युः
verses.transliteration: yā́ te kākút súkr̥tā yā́ váriṣṭhā  yáyā śáśvat píbasi mádhva ūrmím  táyā pāhi prá te adhvaryúr asthāt  sáṃ te vájro vartatām indra gavyúḥ

translation.text: With that well-formed most wide-extending palate, wherewith thou ever drinkest streams of sweetness, Drink thou; the Adhvaryu standeth up before thee: let thy spoil-winning thunderbolt attend thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ष द्र॒प्सो वृ॑ष॒भो वि॒श्वरू॑प॒ इन्द्रा॑य॒ वृष्णे॒ सम॑कारि॒ सोमः॑ ए॒तं पि॑ब हरिवः स्थातरुग्र॒ यस्येशि॑षे प्र॒दिवि॒ यस्ते॒ अन्न॑म्
verses.transliteration: eṣá drapsó vr̥ṣabhó viśvárūpaḥ-  índrāya vŕ̥ṣṇe sám akāri sómaḥ  etám piba hariva sthātar ugra  yásyéśiṣe pradívi yás te ánnam

translation.text: This drop, steer-strong and omniform, the Soma, hath been made ready for the Bull, for India. Drink this, Lord of the Bays, thou Strong Supporter, this that is thine of old, thy food for ever.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒तः सोमो॒ असु॑तादिन्द्र॒ वस्या॑न॒यं श्रेया॑ञ्चिकि॒तुषे॒ रणा॑य ए॒तं ति॑तिर्व॒ उप॑ याहि य॒ज्ञं तेन॒ विश्वा॒स्तवि॑षी॒रा पृ॑णस्व
verses.transliteration: sutáḥ sómo ásutād indra vásyān  ayáṃ śréyāñ cikitúṣe ráṇāya  etáṃ titirva úpa yāhi yajñáṃ  téna víśvās táviṣīr ā́ pr̥ṇasva

translation.text: Soma when pressed excels the unpressed Soma, better, for one who knows, to give him pleasure. Come to this sacrifice of ours, O Victor replenish all thy powers with this libation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ह्वया॑मसि॒ त्वेन्द्र॑ याह्य॒र्वाङरं॑ ते॒ सोम॑स्त॒न्वे॑ भवाति शत॑क्रतो मा॒दय॑स्वा सु॒तेषु॒ प्रास्माँ अ॑व॒ पृत॑नासु॒ प्र वि॒क्षु
verses.transliteration: hváyāmasi tvéndra yāhy arvā́ṅ  áraṃ te sómas tanvè bhavāti  śátakrato mādáyasvā sutéṣu  prā́smā́m̐ ava pŕ̥tanāsu prá vikṣú

translation.text: We call on thee, O Indra: come thou hither: sufficient be the Soma for thy body. Rejoice thee, Ṣatakratu! in the juices guard us in wars, guard us among our people.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रत्य॑स्मै॒ पिपी॑षते॒ विश्वा॑नि वि॒दुषे॑ भर अ॒रं॒ग॒माय॒ जग्म॒येऽप॑श्चाद्दघ्वने॒ नरे॑
verses.transliteration: práty asmai pípīṣate  víśvāni vidúṣe bhara  araṃgamā́ya jágmaye-  -ápaścāddaghvane náre

translation.text: BRING sacrificial gifts to him, Omniscient, for he longs to drink, The Wanderer who comes with speed, the Hero ever in the van.

verses.sanskrit_deva: एमे॑नं प्र॒त्येत॑न॒ सोमे॑भिः सोम॒पात॑मम् अम॑त्रेभिर्ऋजी॒षिण॒मिन्द्रं॑ सु॒तेभि॒रिन्दु॑भिः
verses.transliteration: ém enam pratyétana  sómebhiḥ somapā́tamam  ámatrebhir r̥jīṣíṇam  índraṃ sutébhir índubhiḥ

translation.text: With Soma go ye nigh to him chief drinker of the Soma's juice: With beakers to the Impetuous God, to Indra with the drops effused.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदी॑ सु॒तेभि॒रिन्दु॑भिः॒ सोमे॑भिः प्रति॒भूष॑थ वेदा॒ विश्व॑स्य॒ मेधि॑रो धृ॒षत्तंत॒मिदेष॑ते
verses.transliteration: yádī sutébhir índubhiḥ  sómebhiḥ pratibhū́ṣatha  védā víśvasya médhiro  dhr̥ṣát táṃ-tam íd éṣate

translation.text: What time, with Soma, with the juice effused, ye come before the God, Full wise he knows the hope of each, and, Bold One, strikes this foe and that.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्माअ॑स्मा॒ इदन्ध॒सोऽध्व॑र्यो॒ प्र भ॑रा सु॒तम् कु॒वित्स॑मस्य॒ जेन्य॑स्य॒ शर्ध॑तो॒ऽभिश॑स्तेरव॒स्पर॑त्
verses.transliteration: asmā́-asmā íd ándhasaḥ-  -ádhvaryo prá bharā sutám  kuvít samasya jényasya śárdhato  -abhíśaster avaspárat

translation.text: To him, Adhvaryu! yea, to him give offerings of the juice expressed. Will he not keep us safely from the spiteful curse of each presumptuous high-born foe?

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्य॒ त्यच्छम्ब॑रं॒ मदे॒ दिवो॑दासाय र॒न्धयः॑ अ॒यं स सोम॑ इन्द्र ते सु॒तः पिब॑
verses.transliteration: yásya tyác chámbaram máde  dívodāsāya randháyaḥ  ayáṃ sá sóma indra te sutáḥ píba

translation.text: IN whose wild joy thou madest once Ṣambara Divodâsa's prey, This Soma is pressed out for thee, O Indra: drink!

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्य॑ तीव्र॒सुतं॒ मदं॒ मध्य॒मन्तं॑ च॒ रक्ष॑से अ॒यं स सोम॑ इन्द्र ते सु॒तः पिब॑
verses.transliteration: yásya tīvrasútam mádam  mádhyam ántaṃ ca rákṣase  ayáṃ sá sóma indra te sutáḥ píba

translation.text: Whose gladdening draught, shed from the points, thou guardest in the midst and end, This Soma is pressed out for thee, O Indra drink!

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्य॒ गा अ॒न्तरश्म॑नो॒ मदे॑ दृ॒ळ्हा अ॒वासृ॑जः अ॒यं स सोम॑ इन्द्र ते सु॒तः पिब॑
verses.transliteration: yásya gā́ antár áśmano  máde dr̥ḷhā́ avā́sr̥jaḥ  ayáṃ sá sóma indra te sutáḥ píba

translation.text: In whose wild joy thou settest free the kine held fast within the rock, This Soma is pressed out for thee, O Indra: drink!

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्य॑ मन्दा॒नो अन्ध॑सो॒ माघो॑नं दधि॒षे शवः॑ अ॒यं स सोम॑ इन्द्र ते सु॒तः पिब॑
verses.transliteration: yásya mandānó ándhaso  mā́ghonaṃ dadhiṣé śávaḥ  ayáṃ sá sóma indra te sutáḥ píba

translation.text: This, in whose juice delighting thou gainest the might of Maghavan, This Soma is pressed out for thee, O Indra drink!

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो र॑यिवो र॒यिंत॑मो॒ यो द्यु॒म्नैर्द्यु॒म्नव॑त्तमः सोमः॑ सु॒तः स इ॑न्द्र॒ तेऽस्ति॑ स्वधापते॒ मदः॑
verses.transliteration: yó rayivo rayíṃtamo  yó dyumnaír dyumnávattamaḥ  sómaḥ sutáḥ sá indra te-  -ásti svadhāpate mádaḥ

translation.text: THAT which is wealthiest, Wealthy God in splendoursmost illustrious, Soma is pressed: thy gladdening draught, Indra! libation's Lord! is this.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यः श॒ग्मस्तु॑विशग्म ते रा॒यो दा॒मा म॑ती॒नाम् सोमः॑ सु॒तः स इ॑न्द्र॒ तेऽस्ति॑ स्वधापते॒ मदः॑
verses.transliteration: yáḥ śagmás tuviśagma te  rāyó dāmā́ matīnā́m  sómaḥ sutáḥ sá indra te-  -ásti svadhāpate mádaḥ

translation.text: Effectual, Most Effectual One! thine, as bestowing wealth of hymns, Soma is pressed: thy gladdening draught, Indra! libation's Lord! is this.

verses.sanskrit_deva: येन॑ वृ॒द्धो न शव॑सा तु॒रो न स्वाभि॑रू॒तिभिः॑ सोमः॑ सु॒तः स इ॑न्द्र॒ तेऽस्ति॑ स्वधापते॒ मदः॑
verses.transliteration: yéna vr̥ddhó ná śávasā  turó ná svā́bhir ūtíbhiḥ  sómaḥ sutáḥ sá indra te-  -ásti svadhāpate mádaḥ

translation.text: Wherewith thou art increased in strength, and conquerest with thy proper aids, Soma is pressed: thy gladdening draught, Indra! libation's Lord! is this.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्यमु॑ वो॒ अप्र॑हणं गृणी॒षे शव॑स॒स्पति॑म् इन्द्रं॑ विश्वा॒साहं॒ नरं॒ मंहि॑ष्ठं वि॒श्वच॑र्षणिम्
verses.transliteration: tyám u vo áprahaṇaṃ  gr̥ṇīṣé śávasas pátim  índraṃ viśvāsā́haṃ náram  máṃhiṣṭhaṃ viśvácarṣaṇim

translation.text: Him for your sake I glorify as Lord of Strength who wrongeth none, The Hero Indra, conquering all, Most Bounteous, God of all the tribes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यं व॒र्धय॒न्तीद्गिरः॒ पतिं॑ तु॒रस्य॒ राध॑सः तमिन्न्व॑स्य॒ रोद॑सी दे॒वी शुष्मं॑ सपर्यतः
verses.transliteration: yáṃ vardháyantī́d gíraḥ  pátiṃ turásya rā́dhasaḥ  tám ín nv àsya ródasī  devī́ śúṣmaṃ saparyataḥ

translation.text: Those Goddesses, both Heaven and Earth, revere the power and might of him, Him whom our songs increase in strength, the Lord of bounty swift to come.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तद्व॑ उ॒क्थस्य॑ ब॒र्हणेन्द्रा॑योपस्तृणी॒षणि॑ विपो॒ न यस्यो॒तयो॒ वि यद्रोह॑न्ति स॒क्षितः॑
verses.transliteration: tád va ukthásya barháṇā-  -índrāyopastr̥ṇīṣáṇi  vípo ná yásyotáyo  ví yád róhanti sakṣítaḥ

translation.text: To seat your Indra, I will spread abroad with power this song of praise. The saving succours that abide in him, like songs, extend and grow.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अवि॑द॒द्दक्षं॑ मि॒त्रो नवी॑यान्पपा॒नो दे॒वेभ्यो॒ वस्यो॑ अचैत् स॒स॒वान्त्स्तौ॒लाभि॑र्धौ॒तरी॑भिरुरु॒ष्या पा॒युर॑भव॒त्सखि॑भ्यः
verses.transliteration: ávidad dákṣam mitró návīyān  papānó devébhyo vásyo acait  sasavā́n staulā́bhir dhautárībhir  uruṣyā́ pāyúr abhavat sákhibhyaḥ

translation.text: A recent Friend, he found the skilful priest: he drank, and showed forth treasure from the Gods. He conquered, borne by strong all-shaking mares, and was with far-spread power his friends' Protector.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒तस्य॑ प॒थि वे॒धा अ॑पायि श्रि॒ये मनां॑सि दे॒वासो॑ अक्रन् दधा॑नो॒ नाम॑ म॒हो वचो॑भि॒र्वपु॑र्दृ॒शये॑ वे॒न्यो व्या॑वः
verses.transliteration: r̥tásya pathí vedhā́ apāyi  śriyé mánāṃsi devā́so akran  dádhāno nā́ma mahó vácobhir  vápur dr̥śáye venyó vy ā̀vaḥ

translation.text: In course of Law the sapient juice was quaffed: the Deities to glory turned their mind. Winning through hymns a lofty title, he, the Lovely, made his beauteous form apparent.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्यु॒मत्त॑मं॒ दक्षं॑ धेह्य॒स्मे सेधा॒ जना॑नां पू॒र्वीररा॑तीः वर्षी॑यो॒ वयः॑ कृणुहि॒ शची॑भि॒र्धन॑स्य सा॒ताव॒स्माँ अ॑विड्ढि
verses.transliteration: dyumáttamaṃ dákṣaṃ dhehy asmé  sédhā jánānām pūrvī́r árātīḥ  várṣīyo váyaḥ kr̥ṇuhi śácībhir  dhánasya sātā́v asmā́m̐ aviḍḍhi

translation.text: Bestow on us the most illustrious strength ward off men's manifold malignities. Give with thy might abundant vital force, and aid us graciously in gaining riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॒ तुभ्य॒मिन्म॑घवन्नभूम व॒यं दा॒त्रे ह॑रिवो॒ मा वि वे॑नः नकि॑रा॒पिर्द॑दृशे मर्त्य॒त्रा किम॒ङ्ग र॑ध्र॒चोद॑नं त्वाहुः
verses.transliteration: índra túbhyam ín maghavann abhūma  vayáṃ dātré harivo mā́ ví venaḥ  nákir āpír dadr̥śe martyatrā́  kím aṅgá radhracódanaṃ tvāhuḥ

translation.text: We turn to thee as Giver, liberal Indra. Lord of the Bay Steeds, be not thou ungracious. No friend among mankind have we to lookto: why have men called thee him who spurs the niggard?

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा जस्व॑ने वृषभ नो ररीथा॒ मा ते॑ रे॒वतः॑ स॒ख्ये रि॑षाम पू॒र्वीष्ट॑ इन्द्र नि॒ष्षिधो॒ जने॑षु ज॒ह्यसु॑ष्वी॒न्प्र वृ॒हापृ॑णतः
verses.transliteration: mā́ jásvane vr̥ṣabha no rarīthāḥ-  mā́ te revátaḥ sakhyé riṣāma  pūrvī́ṣ ṭa indra niṣṣídho jáneṣu  jahy ásuṣvīn prá vr̥hā́pr̥ṇataḥ

translation.text: Give us not up, Strong Hero! to the hungry: unharmed be we whom thou, so rich, befriendest. Full many a boon hast thou for men demolish those who present no gifts nor pour oblations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उद॒भ्राणी॑व स्त॒नय॑न्निय॒र्तीन्द्रो॒ राधां॒स्यश्व्या॑नि॒ गव्या॑ त्वम॑सि प्र॒दिवः॑ का॒रुधा॑या॒ मा त्वा॑दा॒मान॒ आ द॑भन्म॒घोनः॑
verses.transliteration: úd abhrā́ṇīva stanáyann iyarti-  -índro rā́dhāṃsy áśvyāni gávyā  tvám asi pradívaḥ kārúdhāyāḥ-  mā́ tvādāmā́na ā́ dabhan maghónaḥ

translation.text: As Indra thundering impels the rain-clouds, so doth he send us store of kine and horses. Thou art of old the Cherisher of singers let not the rich who bring no gifts deceive thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध्व॑र्यो वीर॒ प्र म॒हे सु॒ताना॒मिन्द्रा॑य भर॒ स ह्य॑स्य॒ राजा॑ यः पू॒र्व्याभि॑रु॒त नूत॑नाभिर्गी॒र्भिर्वा॑वृ॒धे गृ॑ण॒तामृषी॑णाम्
verses.transliteration: ádhvaryo vīra prá mahé sutā́nām  índrāya bhara sá hy àsya rā́jā  yáḥ pūrvyā́bhir utá nū́tanābhir  gīrbhír vāvr̥dhé gr̥ṇatā́m ŕ̥ṣīṇām

translation.text: Adbyaryu, hero, bring to mighty Indrafor he is King thereof-the pressed-out juices; To him exalted by the hymns and praises, ancient and modern, of the singing R̥ishis.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्य मदे॑ पु॒रु वर्पां॑सि वि॒द्वानिन्द्रो॑ वृ॒त्राण्य॑प्र॒ती ज॑घान तमु॒ प्र हो॑षि॒ मधु॑मन्तमस्मै॒ सोमं॑ वी॒राय॑ शि॒प्रिणे॒ पिब॑ध्यै
verses.transliteration: asyá máde purú várpāṃsi vidvā́n  índro vr̥trā́ṇy apratī́ jaghāna  tám u prá hoṣi mádhumantam asmai  sómaṃ vīrā́ya śipríṇe píbadhyai

translation.text: In the wild joy of this hath Indra, knowing full many a form, struck down resistless Vr̥itras. Proclaim aloud to him the savoury Soma so that the Hero, strong of jaw, may drink it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पाता॑ सु॒तमिन्द्रो॑ अस्तु॒ सोमं॒ हन्ता॑ वृ॒त्रं वज्रे॑ण मन्दसा॒नः गन्ता॑ य॒ज्ञं प॑रा॒वत॑श्चि॒दच्छा॒ वसु॑र्धी॒नाम॑वि॒ता का॒रुधा॑याः
verses.transliteration: pā́tā sutám índro astu sómam  hántā vr̥tráṃ vájreṇa mandasānáḥ  gántā yajñám parāvátaś cid áchā  vásur dhīnā́m avitā́ kārúdhāyāḥ

translation.text: May Indra drink this Soma poured to please him, and cheered therewith slay Vr̥itra with his thunder. Come to our sacrifice even from a distance, good lover of our songs, the bard's Supporter.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒दं त्यत्पात्र॑मिन्द्र॒पान॒मिन्द्र॑स्य प्रि॒यम॒मृत॑मपायि मत्स॒द्यथा॑ सौमन॒साय॑ दे॒वं व्य१॒॑स्मद्द्वेषो॑ यु॒यव॒द्व्यंहः॑
verses.transliteration: idáṃ tyát pā́tram indrapā́nam  índrasya priyám amŕ̥tam apāyi  mátsad yáthā saumanasā́ya deváṃ  vy àsmád dvéṣo yuyávad vy áṃhaḥ

translation.text: The cup whence Indra drinks the draught is present: the Amrit dear to Indra hath been drunken, That it may cheer the God to gracious favour, and keep far from us hatred and affliction.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ना म॑न्दा॒नो ज॒हि शू॑र॒ शत्रू॑ञ्जा॒मिमजा॑मिं मघवन्न॒मित्रा॑न् अ॒भि॒षे॒णाँ अ॒भ्या॒३॒॑देदि॑शाना॒न्परा॑च इन्द्र॒ प्र मृ॑णा ज॒ही च॑
verses.transliteration: enā́ mandānó jahí śūra śátrūñ  jāmím ájāmim maghavann amítrān  abhiṣeṇā́m̐ abhy ā̀dédiśānān  párāca indra prá mr̥ṇā jahī́ ca

translation.text: Therewith enraptured, Hero, slay our foemen, the unfriendly, Maghavan be they kin or strangers, Those who still aim their hostile darts to smite us, turn them to flight, O Indra, crush and kill them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒सु ष्मा॑ णो मघवन्निन्द्र पृ॒त्स्व१॒॑स्मभ्यं॒ महि॒ वरि॑वः सु॒गं कः॑ अ॒पां तो॒कस्य॒ तन॑यस्य जे॒ष इन्द्र॑ सू॒रीन्कृ॑णु॒हि स्मा॑ नो अ॒र्धम्
verses.transliteration: āsú ṣmā ṇo maghavann indra pr̥tsú-  -asmábhyam máhi várivaḥ sugáṃ kaḥ  apā́ṃ tokásya tánayasya jeṣé  índra sūrī́n kr̥ṇuhí smā no ardhám

translation.text: O Indra Maghavan, in these our battles win easy paths for us and ample freedom. That we may gain waters and seed and offspring, set thou our princes on thy side, O Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ त्वा॒ हर॑यो॒ वृष॑णो युजा॒ना वृष॑रथासो॒ वृष॑रश्म॒योऽत्याः॑ अ॒स्म॒त्राञ्चो॒ वृष॑णो वज्र॒वाहो॒ वृष्णे॒ मदा॑य सु॒युजो॑ वहन्तु
verses.transliteration: ā́ tvā hárayo vŕ̥ṣaṇo yujānā́ḥ-  vŕ̥ṣarathāso vŕ̥ṣaraśmayó 'tyāḥ  asmatrā́ñco vŕ̥ṣaṇo vajravā́ho  vŕ̥ṣṇe mádāya suyújo vahantu

translation.text: Let thy Bay Stallions, harnessed, bring thee hither, Steeds with strong chariot and strong reins to hold them, Strong Horses, speeding hither, bearing thunder, well-harnessed, for the strong exciting potion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ ते॑ वृष॒न्वृष॑णो॒ द्रोण॑मस्थुर्घृत॒प्रुषो॒ नोर्मयो॒ मद॑न्तः इन्द्र॒ प्र तुभ्यं॒ वृष॑भिः सु॒तानां॒ वृष्णे॑ भरन्ति वृष॒भाय॒ सोम॑म्
verses.transliteration: ā́ te vr̥ṣan vŕ̥ṣaṇo dróṇam asthur  ghr̥taprúṣo nórmáyo mádantaḥ  índra prá túbhyaṃ vŕ̥ṣabhiḥ sutā́nāṃ  vŕ̥ṣṇe bharanti vr̥ṣabhā́ya sómam

translation.text: Beside the vat, Strong God! stand thy strong Horses, shining with holy oil, like waves exulting. Indra, they bring to thee, the Strong and Mighty, Soma of juices shed by mighty press-stones.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वृषा॑सि दि॒वो वृ॑ष॒भः पृ॑थि॒व्या वृषा॒ सिन्धू॑नां वृष॒भः स्तिया॑नाम् वृष्णे॑ त॒ इन्दु॑र्वृषभ पीपाय स्वा॒दू रसो॑ मधु॒पेयो॒ वरा॑य
verses.transliteration: vŕ̥ṣāsi divó vr̥ṣabháḥ pr̥thivyā́ḥ-  vŕ̥ṣā síndhūnāṃ vr̥ṣabhá stíyānām  vŕ̥ṣṇe ta índur vr̥ṣabha pīpāya  svādū́ ráso madhupéyo várāya

translation.text: Thou art the Bull of earth, the Bull of heaven, Bull of the rivers, Bull of standing waters. For thee, the Strong, O Bull, hath Indu swollen. juice pleasant, sweet to drink, for thine election.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं दे॒वः सह॑सा॒ जाय॑मान॒ इन्द्रे॑ण यु॒जा प॒णिम॑स्तभायत् अ॒यं स्वस्य॑ पि॒तुरायु॑धा॒नीन्दु॑रमुष्णा॒दशि॑वस्य मा॒याः
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ deváḥ sáhasā jā́yamānaḥ-  índreṇa yujā́ paṇím astabhāyat  ayáṃ svásya pitúr ā́yudhāni-  -índur amuṣṇād áśivasya māyā́ḥ

translation.text: This God, with might, when first he had his being, with Indra for ally, held fast the Paṇi. This Indu stole away the warlike weapons, and foiled the arts of his malignant father.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यम॑कृणोदु॒षसः॑ सु॒पत्नी॑र॒यं सूर्ये॑ अदधा॒ज्ज्योति॑र॒न्तः अ॒यं त्रि॒धातु॑ दि॒वि रो॑च॒नेषु॑ त्रि॒तेषु॑ विन्दद॒मृतं॒ निगू॑ळ्हम्
verses.transliteration: ayám akr̥ṇod uṣásaḥ supátnīr  ayáṃ sū́rye adadhāj jyótir antáḥ  ayáṃ tridhā́tu diví rocanéṣu  tritéṣu vindad amŕ̥taṃ nígūḷham

translation.text: The Dawns he wedded to a glorious Consort, and set within the Sun the light that lights him. He found in heaven, in the third lucid regions, the threefold Amrit in its close concealment.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी वि ष्क॑भायद॒यं रथ॑मयुनक्स॒प्तर॑श्मिम् अ॒यं गोषु॒ शच्या॑ प॒क्वम॒न्तः सोमो॑ दाधार॒ दश॑यन्त्र॒मुत्स॑म्
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ ví ṣkabhāyad  ayáṃ rátham ayunak saptáraśmim  ayáṃ góṣu śácyā pakvám antáḥ  sómo dādhāra dáśayantram útsam

translation.text: He stayed and held the heaven and earth asunder: the chariot with the sevenfold reins he harnessed. This Soma Set with power within the milch-kine a spring whose ripe contents ten fingers empty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य आन॑यत्परा॒वतः॒ सुनी॑ती तु॒र्वशं॒ यदु॑म् इन्द्रः॒ स नो॒ युवा॒ सखा॑
verses.transliteration: yá ā́nayat parāvátaḥ  súnītī turváśaṃ yádum  índraḥ sá no yúvā sákhā

translation.text: THAT Indra is our youthful Friend, who with his trusty guidance led Turvaṣa, Yadu from afar.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒वि॒प्रे चि॒द्वयो॒ दध॑दना॒शुना॑ चि॒दर्व॑ता इन्द्रो॒ जेता॑ हि॒तं धन॑म्
verses.transliteration: avipré cid váyo dádhad  anāśúnā cid árvatā  índro jétā hitáṃ dhánam

translation.text: Even to the dull and uninspired Indra, gives vital power, and wins Even with slow steed the offered prize.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हीर॑स्य॒ प्रणी॑तयः पू॒र्वीरु॒त प्रश॑स्तयः नास्य॑ क्षीयन्त ऊ॒तयः॑
verses.transliteration: mahī́r asya práṇītayaḥ  pūrvī́r utá práśastayaḥ  nā́sya kṣīyanta ūtáyaḥ

translation.text: Great are his ways of guiding us, and!nanilbld are Ins eulogies: His kind protections never fail.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सखा॑यो॒ ब्रह्म॑वाह॒सेऽर्च॑त॒ प्र च॑ गायत स हि नः॒ प्रम॑तिर्म॒ही
verses.transliteration: sákhāyo bráhmavāhase-  -árcata prá ca gāyata  sá hí naḥ prámatir mahī́

translation.text: Friends, sing your psalm and offer praise to him to whom the prayer is brought: For our great Providence is he.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वमेक॑स्य वृत्रहन्नवि॒ता द्वयो॑रसि उ॒तेदृशे॒ यथा॑ व॒यम्
verses.transliteration: tvám ékasya vr̥trahann  avitā́ dváyor asi  utédŕ̥śe yáthā vayám

translation.text: Thou, Slaughterer of Vr̥itra, art Guardian and Friend of one and two, Yea, of a man like one of us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नय॒सीद्वति॒ द्विषः॑ कृ॒णोष्यु॑क्थशं॒सिनः॑ नृभिः॑ सु॒वीर॑ उच्यसे
verses.transliteration: náyasī́d v áti dvíṣaḥ  kr̥ṇóṣy ukthaśaṃsínaḥ  nŕ̥bhiḥ suvī́ra ucyase

translation.text: Beyond men's hate thou leadest us, and givest cause to sing thy praise: Good hero art thou called by men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ब्र॒ह्माणं॒ ब्रह्म॑वाहसं गी॒र्भिः सखा॑यमृ॒ग्मिय॑म् गां न दो॒हसे॑ हुवे
verses.transliteration: brahmā́ṇam bráhmavāhasaṃ  gīrbhíḥ sákhāyam r̥gmíyam  gā́ṃ ná doháse huve

translation.text: I call with hymns, as 'twere a cow to milk, the Friend who merits praise, The Brahman who accepts the prayer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्य॒ विश्वा॑नि॒ हस्त॑योरू॒चुर्वसू॑नि॒ नि द्वि॒ता वी॒रस्य॑ पृतना॒षहः॑
verses.transliteration: yásya víśvāni hástayoḥ  ūcúr vásūni ní dvitā́  vīrásya pr̥tanāṣáhaḥ

translation.text: Him in whose hands they say are stored all treasures from the days of old, The Hero, conquering in the fight.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि दृ॒ळ्हानि॑ चिदद्रिवो॒ जना॑नां शचीपते वृ॒ह मा॒या अ॑नानत
verses.transliteration: ví dr̥ḷhā́ni cid adrivo  jánānāṃ śacīpate  vr̥há māyā́ anānata

translation.text: Lord of Strength, Caster of the Stone, destroy the firm forts built by men, And foil their arts, unbending God!

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमु॑ त्वा सत्य सोमपा॒ इन्द्र॑ वाजानां पते अहू॑महि श्रव॒स्यवः॑
verses.transliteration: tám u tvā satya somapāḥ-  índra vājānām pate  áhūmahi śravasyávaḥ

translation.text: Thee, thee as such, O Lord of Power, O Indra, Soma-drinker, true, We, fain for glory, have invoked.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमु॑ त्वा॒ यः पु॒रासि॑थ॒ यो वा॑ नू॒नं हि॒ते धने॑ हव्यः॒ स श्रु॑धी॒ हव॑म्
verses.transliteration: tám u tvā yáḥ purā́sitha  yó vā nūnáṃ hité dháne  hávyaḥ sá śrudhī hávam

translation.text: Such as thou wast of old, and art now to be called on when the prize lies ready, listen to our call.

verses.sanskrit_deva: धी॒भिरर्व॑द्भि॒रर्व॑तो॒ वाजाँ॑ इन्द्र श्र॒वाय्या॑न् त्वया॑ जेष्म हि॒तं धन॑म्
verses.transliteration: dhībhír árvadbhir árvato  vā́jām̐ indra śravā́yyān  tváyā jeṣma hitáṃ dhánam

translation.text: With hymns and coursers we will gain, Indra, through thee, both steeds and spoil Most glorious, and the proffered prize.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अभू॑रु वीर गिर्वणो म॒हाँ इ॑न्द्र॒ धने॑ हि॒ते भरे॑ वितन्त॒साय्यः॑
verses.transliteration: ábhūr u vīra girvaṇo  mahā́m̐ indra dháne hité  bháre vitantasā́yyaḥ

translation.text: Thou, Indra, Lover of the Song, whom men must stir to help, hast been Great in the contest for the prize.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या त॑ ऊ॒तिर॑मित्रहन्म॒क्षूज॑वस्त॒मास॑ति तया॑ नो हिनुही॒ रथ॑म्
verses.transliteration: yā́ ta ūtír amitrahan  makṣū́javastamā́sati  táyā no hinuhī rátham

translation.text: Slayer of foes, whatever aid of thine imparts the swiftest course, With that impel our car to speed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स रथे॑न र॒थीत॑मो॒ऽस्माके॑नाभि॒युग्व॑ना जेषि॑ जिष्णो हि॒तं धन॑म्
verses.transliteration: sá ráthena rathī́tamo  -asmā́kenābhiyúgvanā  jéṣi jiṣṇo hitáṃ dhánam

translation.text: As skilfullest of those who drive the chariot, with our art and aim, O Conqueror, win the proffered prize.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य एक॒ इत्तमु॑ ष्टुहि कृष्टी॒नां विच॑र्षणिः पति॑र्ज॒ज्ञे वृष॑क्रतुः
verses.transliteration: yá éka ít tám u ṣṭuhi  kr̥ṣṭīnā́ṃ vícarṣaṇiḥ  pátir jajñé vŕ̥ṣakratuḥ

translation.text: Praise him who, Matchless and Alone, was born the Lord of living men, Most active, with heroic soul.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो गृ॑ण॒तामिदासि॑था॒पिरू॒ती शि॒वः सखा॑ स त्वं न॑ इन्द्र मृळय
verses.transliteration: yó gr̥ṇatā́m íd ā́sitha-  -āpír ūtī́ śiváḥ sákhā  sá tváṃ na indra mr̥ḷaya

translation.text: Thou who hast been the singers' Friend, a Friend auspicious with thine aid, As such, O Indra, favour us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: धि॒ष्व वज्रं॒ गभ॑स्त्यो रक्षो॒हत्या॑य वज्रिवः सा॒स॒ही॒ष्ठा अ॒भि स्पृधः॑
verses.transliteration: dhiṣvá vájraṃ gábhastyo  rakṣohátyāya vajrivaḥ  sāsahīṣṭhā́ abhí spŕ̥dhaḥ

translation.text: Grasp in thine arms the thunderbolt, O Thunder-armed, to slay the fiends: Mayst thou subdue the foemen's host.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र॒त्नं र॑यी॒णां युजं॒ सखा॑यं कीरि॒चोद॑नम् ब्रह्म॑वाहस्तमं हुवे
verses.transliteration: pratnáṃ rayīṇā́ṃ yújaṃ  sákhāyaṃ kīricódanam  bráhmavāhastamaṃ huve

translation.text: I call the ancient Friend, allied with wealth, who speeds the lowly man, Him to whom chiefly prayer is brought.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स हि विश्वा॑नि॒ पार्थि॑वाँ॒ एको॒ वसू॑नि॒ पत्य॑ते गिर्व॑णस्तमो॒ अध्रि॑गुः
verses.transliteration: sá hí víśvāni pā́rthivām̐  éko vásūni pátyate  gírvaṇastamo ádhriguḥ

translation.text: For he alone is Lord of all the treasures of the earth: he speeds Hither, chief Lover of the Song.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स नो॑ नि॒युद्भि॒रा पृ॑ण॒ कामं॒ वाजे॑भिर॒श्विभिः॑ गोम॑द्भिर्गोपते धृ॒षत्
verses.transliteration: sá no niyúdbhir ā́ pr̥ṇa  kā́maṃ vā́jebhir aśvíbhiḥ  gómadbhir gopate dhr̥ṣát

translation.text: So with thy yoked teams satisfy our wish with power and wealth in steeds And cattle, boldly, Lord of kine!

verses.sanskrit_deva: तद्वो॑ गाय सु॒ते सचा॑ पुरुहू॒ताय॒ सत्व॑ने शं यद्गवे॒ न शा॒किने॑
verses.transliteration: tád vo gāya suté sácā  puruhūtā́ya sátvane  śáṃ yád gáve ná śākíne

translation.text: Sing this, what time the ' juice is pressed, to him your Hero, Much-invoked, To please him as a mighty Steer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न घा॒ वसु॒र्नि य॑मते दा॒नं वाज॑स्य॒ गोम॑तः यत्सी॒मुप॒ श्रव॒द्गिरः॑
verses.transliteration: ná ghā vásur ní yamate  dānáṃ vā́jasya gómataḥ  yát sīm úpa śrávad gíraḥ

translation.text: He, Excellent, withholdeth not his gift of power and wealth in kine, When he hath listened to our songs.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कु॒वित्स॑स्य॒ प्र हि व्र॒जं गोम॑न्तं दस्यु॒हा गम॑त् शची॑भि॒रप॑ नो वरत्
verses.transliteration: kuvítsasya prá hí vrajáṃ  gómantaṃ dasyuhā́ gámat  śácībhir ápa no varat

translation.text: May he with might unclose for us the cow's stall, whosesoe'er it be, To which the Dasyu-slayer goes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मा उ॑ त्वा शतक्रतो॒ऽभि प्र णो॑नुवु॒र्गिरः॑ इन्द्र॑ व॒त्सं न मा॒तरः॑
verses.transliteration: imā́ u tvā śatakrato  -abhí prá ṇonuvur gíraḥ  índra vatsáṃ ná mātáraḥ

translation.text: O Indra Ṣatakratu, these our songs have called aloud to thee, Like mother cows to meet their calves.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दू॒णाशं॑ स॒ख्यं तव॒ गौर॑सि वीर गव्य॒ते अश्वो॑ अश्वाय॒ते भ॑व
verses.transliteration: dūṇā́śaṃ sakhyáṃ táva  gaúr asi vīra gavyaté  áśvo aśvāyaté bhava

translation.text: Hard is thy love to win: thou art a Steer to him who longs for steers: Be to one craving steeds a Steed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स म॑न्दस्वा॒ ह्यन्ध॑सो॒ राध॑से त॒न्वा॑ म॒हे न स्तो॒तारं॑ नि॒दे क॑रः
verses.transliteration: sá mandasvā hy ándhaso  rā́dhase tanvā̀ mahé  ná stotā́raṃ nidé karaḥ

translation.text: Delight thee with the juice we pour for thine own great munificence: Yield not thy singer to reproach.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मा उ॑ त्वा सु॒तेसु॑ते॒ नक्ष॑न्ते गिर्वणो॒ गिरः॑ व॒त्सं गावो॒ न धे॒नवः॑
verses.transliteration: imā́ u tvā suté-sute  nákṣante girvaṇo gíraḥ  vatsáṃ gā́vo ná dhenávaḥ

translation.text: These songs with every draught we pour come, Lover of the Song, to thee, As milch-kine hasten to their young

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒रू॒तमं॑ पुरू॒णां स्तो॑तॄ॒णां विवा॑चि वाजे॑भिर्वाजय॒ताम्
verses.transliteration: purūtámam purūṇā́m  stotr̥̄ṇā́ṃ vívāci  vā́jebhir vājayatā́m

translation.text: To thee most oft invoked, amid the many singers' rivalry Who beg with all their might for wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्माक॑मिन्द्र भूतु ते॒ स्तोमो॒ वाहि॑ष्ठो॒ अन्त॑मः अ॒स्मान्रा॒ये म॒हे हि॑नु
verses.transliteration: asmā́kam indra bhūtu te  stómo vā́hiṣṭho ántamaḥ  asmā́n rāyé mahé hinu

translation.text: Nearest and most attractive may our laud, O Indra come to thee. Urge thou us on to ample wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अधि॑ बृ॒बुः प॑णी॒नां वर्षि॑ष्ठे मू॒र्धन्न॑स्थात् उ॒रुः कक्षो॒ न गा॒ङ्ग्यः
verses.transliteration: ádhi br̥búḥ paṇīnā́ṃ  várṣiṣṭhe mūrdhánn asthāt  urúḥ kákṣo ná gāṅgyáḥ

translation.text: Br̥ibu hath set himself above the Paṇis, o'er their highest head, Like the wide bush on Gangâ's bank.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्य॑ वा॒योरि॑व द्र॒वद्भ॒द्रा रा॒तिः स॑ह॒स्रिणी॑ स॒द्यो दा॒नाय॒ मंह॑ते
verses.transliteration: yásya vāyór iva dravád  bhadrā́ rātíḥ sahasríṇī  sadyó dānā́ya máṃhate

translation.text: He whose good bounty, thousandfold, swift as the rushing of the wind, Suddenly offers as a gift.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तत्सु नो॒ विश्वे॑ अ॒र्य आ सदा॑ गृणन्ति का॒रवः॑ बृ॒बुं स॑हस्र॒दात॑मं सू॒रिं स॑हस्र॒सात॑मम्
verses.transliteration: tát sú no víśve aryá ā́  sádā gr̥ṇanti kārávaḥ  br̥búṃ sahasradā́tamaṃ  sūríṃ sahasrasā́tamam

translation.text: So all our singers ever praise the pious Br̥ibu's noble deed, Chief, best to give his thousands, best to give a thousand liberal gifts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वामिद्धि हवा॑महे सा॒ता वाज॑स्य का॒रवः॑ त्वां वृ॒त्रेष्वि॑न्द्र॒ सत्प॑तिं॒ नर॒स्त्वां काष्ठा॒स्वर्व॑तः
verses.transliteration: tvā́m íd dhí hávāmahe  sātā́ vā́jasya kārávaḥ  tvā́ṃ vr̥tréṣv indra sátpatiṃ náras  tvā́ṃ kā́ṣṭhāsv árvataḥ

translation.text: THAT we may win us wealth and power we poets, verily, call on thee: In war men call on thee, Indra, the hero's Lord, in the steed's race-course call on thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स त्वं न॑श्चित्र वज्रहस्त धृष्णु॒या म॒हः स्त॑वा॒नो अ॑द्रिवः गामश्वं॑ र॒थ्य॑मिन्द्र॒ सं कि॑र स॒त्रा वाजं॒ न जि॒ग्युषे॑
verses.transliteration: sá tváṃ naś citra vajrahasta dhr̥ṣṇuyā́  mahá stavānó adrivaḥ  gā́m áśvaṃ rathyàm indra sáṃ kira  satrā́ vā́jaṃ ná jigyúṣe

translation.text: As such, O Wonderful, whose hand holds thunder, praised as mighty, Caster of the Stone! Pour on us boldly, Indra, kine and chariotsteeds, ever to be the conqueror's strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यः स॑त्रा॒हा विच॑र्षणि॒रिन्द्रं॒ तं हू॑महे व॒यम् सह॑स्रमुष्क॒ तुवि॑नृम्ण॒ सत्प॑ते॒ भवा॑ स॒मत्सु॑ नो वृ॒धे
verses.transliteration: yáḥ satrāhā́ vícarṣaṇir  índraṃ táṃ hūmahe vayám  sáhasramuṣka túvinr̥mṇa sátpate  bhávā samátsu no vr̥dhé

translation.text: We call upon that Indra, who, most active, ever slays the foe: Lord of the brave, Most Manly, with a thousand powers, help thou and prosper us in fight.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बाध॑से॒ जना॑न्वृष॒भेव॑ म॒न्युना॒ घृषौ॑ मी॒ळ्ह ऋ॑चीषम अ॒स्माकं॑ बोध्यवि॒ता म॑हाध॒ने त॒नूष्व॒प्सु सूर्ये॑
verses.transliteration: bā́dhase jánān vr̥ṣabhéva manyúnā  ghŕ̥ṣau mīḷhá r̥cīṣama  asmā́kam bodhy avitā́ mahādhané  tanū́ṣv apsú sū́rye

translation.text: Rcisama, thou forcest men as with a bull, with anger, in the furious fray. Be thou our Helper in the mighty battle fought for sunlight, water, and for life.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॒ ज्येष्ठं॑ न॒ आ भ॑रँ॒ ओजि॑ष्ठं॒ पपु॑रि॒ श्रवः॑ येने॒मे चि॑त्र वज्रहस्त॒ रोद॑सी॒ ओभे सु॑शिप्र॒ प्राः
verses.transliteration: índra jyéṣṭhaṃ na ā́ bharam̐  ójiṣṭham pápuri śrávaḥ  yénemé citra vajrahasta  ródasī óbhé suśipra prā́ḥ

translation.text: O Indra, bring us name and fame, enriching, mightiest, excellent, Wherewith, O Wondrous God, fair-visored, thunder-armed, thou hast filled full this earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वामु॒ग्रमव॑से चर्षणी॒सहं॒ राज॑न्दे॒वेषु॑ हूमहे विश्वा॒ सु नो॑ विथु॒रा पि॑ब्द॒ना व॑सो॒ऽमित्रा॑न्त्सु॒षहा॑न्कृधि
verses.transliteration: tvā́m ugrám ávase carṣaṇīsáhaṃ  rā́jan devéṣu hūmahe  víśvā sú no vithurā́ pibdanā́ vaso  -amítrān suṣáhān kr̥dhi

translation.text: We call on thee, O King, Mighty amid the Gods, Ruler of men, to succour us. All that is weak in us, Excellent God, make firm: make our foes easy to subdue.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदि॑न्द्र॒ नाहु॑षी॒ष्वाँ ओजो॑ नृ॒म्णं च॑ कृ॒ष्टिषु॑ यद्वा॒ पञ्च॑ क्षिती॒नां द्यु॒म्नमा भ॑र स॒त्रा विश्वा॑नि॒ पौंस्या॑
verses.transliteration: yád indra nā́huṣīṣv ā́m̐  ójo nr̥mṇáṃ ca kr̥ṣṭíṣu  yád vā páñca kṣitīnā́ṃ dyumnám ā́ bhara  satrā́ víśvāni paúṃsyā

translation.text: All strength and valour that is found, Indra, in tribes of Nahushas, and all the splendid fame that the Five Tribes enjoy Bring, yea, all manly powers at once.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद्वा॑ तृ॒क्षौ म॑घवन्द्रु॒ह्यावा जने॒ यत्पू॒रौ कच्च॒ वृष्ण्य॑म् अ॒स्मभ्यं॒ तद्रि॑रीहि॒ सं नृ॒षाह्ये॒ऽमित्रा॑न्पृ॒त्सु तु॒र्वणे॑
verses.transliteration: yád vā tr̥kṣaú maghavan druhyā́v ā́ jáne  yát pūraú kác ca vŕ̥ṣṇyam  asmábhyaṃ tád rirīhi sáṃ nr̥ṣā́hye  -amítrān pr̥tsú turváṇe

translation.text: Or, Maghavan, what vigorous strength in Tr̥ikshi lay, in Druhyus or in Pûru's folk, Fully bestow on us, that, in the conquering fray, we may subdue our foes in fight.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑ त्रि॒धातु॑ शर॒णं त्रि॒वरू॑थं स्वस्ति॒मत् छ॒र्दिर्य॑च्छ म॒घव॑द्भ्यश्च॒ मह्यं॑ च या॒वया॑ दि॒द्युमे॑भ्यः
verses.transliteration: índra tridhā́tu śaraṇáṃ  trivárūthaṃ svastimát  chardír yacha maghávadbhyaś ca máhyaṃ ca  yāváyā didyúm ebhyaḥ

translation.text: O Indra, grant a happy home, a triple refuge triply strong. Bestow a dwelling-place on the rich lords and me, and keep thy dart afar from these.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये ग॑व्य॒ता मन॑सा॒ शत्रु॑माद॒भुर॑भिप्र॒घ्नन्ति॑ धृष्णु॒या अध॑ स्मा नो मघवन्निन्द्र गिर्वणस्तनू॒पा अन्त॑मो भव
verses.transliteration: yé gavyatā́ mánasā śátrum ādabhúr  abhipraghnánti dhr̥ṣṇuyā́  ádha smā no maghavann indra girvaṇas  tanūpā́ ántamo bhava

translation.text: They who with minds intent on spoil subdue the foe, boldly attack and smite him down,– From these, O Indra Maghavan who lovest song, be closest guardian of our lives.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध॑ स्मा नो वृ॒धे भ॒वेन्द्र॑ ना॒यम॑वा यु॒धि यद॒न्तरि॑क्षे प॒तय॑न्ति प॒र्णिनो॑ दि॒द्यव॑स्ति॒ग्ममू॑र्धानः
verses.transliteration: ádha smā no vr̥dhé bhava-  -índra nāyám avā yudhí  yád antárikṣe patáyanti parṇíno  didyávas tigmámūrdhānaḥ

translation.text: And now, O Indra, strengthen us: come near and aid us in the fight, What time the feathered shafts are flying in the air, the arrows with their sharpened points.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्र॒ शूरा॑सस्त॒न्वो॑ वितन्व॒ते प्रि॒या शर्म॑ पितॄ॒णाम् अध॑ स्मा यच्छ त॒न्वे॒३॒॑ तने॑ च छ॒र्दिर॒चित्तं॑ या॒वय॒ द्वेषः॑
verses.transliteration: yátra śū́rāsas tanvò vitanvaté  priyā́ śárma pitr̥̄ṇā́m  ádha smā yacha tanvè táne ca chardír  acíttaṃ yāváya dvéṣaḥ

translation.text: Give us, where heroes strain their bodies in the fight, the shelter that our fathers loved. To us and to our sons give refuge: keep afar all unobserved hostility.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदि॑न्द्र॒ सर्गे॒ अर्व॑तश्चो॒दया॑से महाध॒ने अ॒स॒म॒ने अध्व॑नि वृजि॒ने प॒थि श्ये॒नाँ इ॑व श्रवस्य॒तः
verses.transliteration: yád indra sárge árvataś  codáyāse mahādhané  asamané ádhvani vr̥jiné pathí  śyenā́m̐ iva śravasyatáḥ

translation.text: When, Indra, in the mighty fray thou urgest chargers to their speed, On the uneven road and on a toilsome path, like falcons, eager for renown,

verses.sanskrit_deva: सिन्धूँ॑रिव प्रव॒ण आ॑शु॒या य॒तो यदि॒ क्लोश॒मनु॒ ष्वणि॑ आ ये वयो॒ न वर्वृ॑त॒त्यामि॑षि गृभी॒ता बा॒ह्वोर्गवि॑
verses.transliteration: síndhūm̐r iva pravaṇá āśuyā́ yató  yádi klóśam ánu ṣváṇi  ā́ yé váyo ná várvr̥taty ā́miṣi  gr̥bhītā́ bāhvór gávi

translation.text: Speeding like rivers rushing down a steep descent, responsive to the urging call, That come like birds attracted to the bait, held in by reins in both the driver's hands.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्वा॒दुष्किला॒यं मधु॑माँ उ॒तायं ती॒व्रः किला॒यं रस॑वाँ उ॒तायम् उ॒तो न्व१॒॑स्य प॑पि॒वांस॒मिन्द्रं॒ न कश्च॒न स॑हत आह॒वेषु॑
verses.transliteration: svādúṣ kílāyám mádhumām̐ utā́yáṃ  tīvráḥ kílāyáṃ rásavām̐ utā́yám  utó nv àsyá papivā́ṃsam índraṃ  ná káś caná sahata āhavéṣu

translation.text: YEA, this is good to taste and full of. sweetness, verily it is strong and rich in flavour. No one may conquer Indra in the battle when he hath drunken of the draught we offer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं स्वा॒दुरि॒ह मदि॑ष्ठ आस॒ यस्येन्द्रो॑ वृत्र॒हत्ये॑ म॒माद॑ पु॒रूणि॒ यश्च्यौ॒त्ना शम्ब॑रस्य॒ वि न॑व॒तिं नव॑ च दे॒ह्यो॒३॒॑ हन्
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ svādúr ihá mádiṣṭha āsa  yásyéndro vr̥trahátye mamā́da  purū́ṇi yáś cyautnā́ śámbarasya  ví navatíṃ náva ca dehyò hán

translation.text: This sweet juice here had mightiest power to gladden: it boldened Indra when he siaughtered Vr̥itra, When he defeated Ṣambara's many onslaughts, and battered down his nineand ninety ramparts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं मे॑ पी॒त उदि॑यर्ति॒ वाच॑म॒यं म॑नी॒षामु॑श॒तीम॑जीगः अ॒यं षळु॒र्वीर॑मिमीत॒ धीरो॒ न याभ्यो॒ भुव॑नं॒ कच्च॒नारे
verses.transliteration: ayám me pītá úd iyarti vā́cam  ayám manīṣā́m uśatī́m ajīgaḥ  ayáṃ ṣáḷ urvī́r amimīta dhī́ro  ná yā́bhyo bhúvanaṃ kác canā́ré

translation.text: This stirreth up my voice when I have drunk it: this hath aroused from sleep my yearning spirit. This Sage hath measured out the six expanses from which no single creature is excluded.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं स यो व॑रि॒माणं॑ पृथि॒व्या व॒र्ष्माणं॑ दि॒वो अकृ॑णोद॒यं सः अ॒यं पी॒यूषं॑ ति॒सृषु॑ प्र॒वत्सु॒ सोमो॑ दाधारो॒र्व१॒॑न्तरि॑क्षम्
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ sá yó varimā́ṇam pr̥thivyā́ḥ-  varṣmā́ṇaṃ divó ákr̥ṇod ayáṃ sáḥ  ayám pīyū́ṣaṃ tisŕ̥ṣu pravátsu  sómo dādhārorv àntárikṣam

translation.text: This, even this, is he who hath created the breadth of earth, the lofty height of heaven. He formed the nectar in three headlong rivers. Soma supports the wide mid-air above us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं वि॑दच्चित्र॒दृशी॑क॒मर्णः॑ शु॒क्रस॑द्मनामु॒षसा॒मनी॑के अ॒यं म॒हान्म॑ह॒ता स्कम्भ॑ने॒नोद्द्याम॑स्तभ्नाद्वृष॒भो म॒रुत्वा॑न्
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ vidac citradŕ̥śīkam árṇaḥ  śukrásadmanām uṣásām ánīke  ayám mahā́n mahatā́ skámbhanena-  -úd dyā́m astabhnād vr̥ṣabhó marútvān

translation.text: He found the wavy sea of brilliant colours in forefront of the Dawns who dwell in brightness. This Mighty One, the Steer begirt by Maruts, hath propped the heavens up with a mighty pillar.

verses.sanskrit_deva: धृ॒षत्पि॑ब क॒लशे॒ सोम॑मिन्द्र वृत्र॒हा शू॑र सम॒रे वसू॑नाम् माध्यं॑दिने॒ सव॑न॒ आ वृ॑षस्व रयि॒स्थानो॑ र॒यिम॒स्मासु॑ धेहि
verses.transliteration: dhr̥ṣát piba kaláśe sómam indra  vr̥trahā́ śūra samaré vásūnām  mā́dhyaṃdine sávana ā́ vr̥ṣasva  rayisthā́no rayím asmā́su dhehi

translation.text: Drink Soma boldly from the beaker, Indra, in war for treasures, Hero, Vr̥itra-slayer! Fill thyself full at the mid-day libation, and give us wealth, thou Treasury of riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॒ प्र णः॑ पुरए॒तेव॑ पश्य॒ प्र नो॑ नय प्रत॒रं वस्यो॒ अच्छ॑ भवा॑ सुपा॒रो अ॑तिपार॒यो नो॒ भवा॒ सुनी॑तिरु॒त वा॒मनी॑तिः
verses.transliteration: índra prá ṇaḥ puraetéva paśya  prá no naya prataráṃ vásyo ácha  bhávā supāró atipārayó no  bhávā súnītir utá vāmánītiḥ

translation.text: Look out for us, O Indra, as our Leader, and guide us on to gain yet goodlier treasure. Excellent Guardian, bear us well through peril, and lead us on to wealth with careful guidance.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒रुं नो॑ लो॒कमनु॑ नेषि वि॒द्वान्त्स्व॑र्व॒ज्ज्योति॒रभ॑यं स्व॒स्ति ऋ॒ष्वा त॑ इन्द्र॒ स्थवि॑रस्य बा॒हू उप॑ स्थेयाम शर॒णा बृ॒हन्ता॑
verses.transliteration: urúṃ no lokám ánu neṣi vidvā́n  svàrvaj jyótir ábhayaṃ svastí  r̥ṣvā́ ta indra sthávirasya bāhū́  úpa stheyāma śaraṇā́ br̥hántā

translation.text: Lead us to ample room, O thou who knowest, to happiness, security, and sunlight. High, Indra, are the arms of thee the Mighty: may we betake. us to their lofty shelter.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वरि॑ष्ठे न इन्द्र व॒न्धुरे॑ धा॒ वहि॑ष्ठयोः शताव॒न्नश्व॑यो॒रा इष॒मा व॑क्षी॒षां वर्षि॑ष्ठां॒ मा न॑स्तारीन्मघव॒न्रायो॑ अ॒र्यः
verses.transliteration: váriṣṭhe na indra vandhúre dhāḥ-  váhiṣṭhayoḥ śatāvann áśvayor ā́  íṣam ā́ vakṣīṣā́ṃ várṣiṣṭhām  mā́ nas tārīn maghavan rā́yo aryáḥ

translation.text: Set us on widest chariot-seat, O Indra, with two steeds best to draw, O Lord of Hundreds! Bring us the best among all sorts of viands: let not the foe's wealth, Maghavan, subdue us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑ मृ॒ळ मह्यं॑ जी॒वातु॑मिच्छ चो॒दय॒ धिय॒मय॑सो॒ न धारा॑म् यत्किं चा॒हं त्वा॒युरि॒दं वदा॑मि॒ तज्जु॑षस्व कृ॒धि मा॑ दे॒वव॑न्तम्
verses.transliteration: índra mr̥ḷá máhyaṃ jīvā́tum icha  codáya dhíyam áyaso ná dhā́rām  yát kíṃ cāháṃ tvāyúr idáṃ vádāmi  táj juṣasva kr̥dhí mā devávantam

translation.text: Be gracious, Indra, let my days be lengthened: sharpen my thought as 'twere a blade of iron Approve whatever words I speak, dependent on thee, and grant me thy divine protection.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रा॒तार॒मिन्द्र॑मवि॒तार॒मिन्द्रं॒ हवे॑हवे सु॒हवं॒ शूर॒मिन्द्र॑म् ह्वया॑मि श॒क्रं पु॑रुहू॒तमिन्द्रं॑ स्व॒स्ति नो॑ म॒घवा॑ धा॒त्विन्द्रः॑
verses.transliteration: trātā́ram índram avitā́ram índraṃ  háve-have suhávaṃ śū́ram índram  hváyāmi śakrám puruhūtám índraṃ  svastí no maghávā dhātv índraḥ

translation.text: Indra the Rescuer, Indra the Helper, Hero who listens at each invocation, Ṣakra I call, Indra invoked of many. May Indra Maghavan prosper and bless us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रः॑ सु॒त्रामा॒ स्ववाँ॒ अवो॑भिः सुमृळी॒को भ॑वतु वि॒श्ववे॑दाः बाध॑तां॒ द्वेषो॒ अभ॑यं कृणोतु सु॒वीर्य॑स्य॒ पत॑यः स्याम
verses.transliteration: índraḥ sutrā́mā svávām̐ ávobhiḥ  sumr̥ḷīkó bhavatu viśvávedāḥ  bā́dhatāṃ dvéṣo ábhayaṃ kr̥ṇotu  suvī́ryasya pátayaḥ syāma

translation.text: May helpful Indra as our good Protector, Lord of all treasures, favour us with succour, Baffle our foes, and give us rest and safety, and may we be the lords of hero vigour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तस्य॑ व॒यं सु॑म॒तौ य॒ज्ञिय॒स्यापि॑ भ॒द्रे सौ॑मन॒से स्या॑म स सु॒त्रामा॒ स्ववाँ॒ इन्द्रो॑ अ॒स्मे आ॒राच्चि॒द्द्वेषः॑ सनु॒तर्यु॑योतु
verses.transliteration: tásya vayáṃ sumataú yajñíyasya-  -ápi bhadré saumanasé syāma  sá sutrā́mā svávām̐ índro asmé  ārā́c cid dvéṣaḥ sanutár yuyotu

translation.text: May we enjoy the grace of him the Holy, yea, may we dwell in his auspicious favour. May helpful Indra as our good Preserver drive from us, even from afar, our foemen.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अव॒ त्वे इ॑न्द्र प्र॒वतो॒ नोर्मिर्गिरो॒ ब्रह्मा॑णि नि॒युतो॑ धवन्ते उ॒रू न राधः॒ सव॑ना पु॒रूण्य॒पो गा व॑ज्रिन्युवसे॒ समिन्दू॑न्
verses.transliteration: áva tvé indra praváto nórmír  gíro bráhmāṇi niyúto dhavante  urū́ ná rā́dhaḥ sávanā purū́ṇi-  apó gā́ vajrin yuvase sám índūn

translation.text: Like rivers rushing down a slope, O Indra, to thee haste songs and prayers and linked verses. Thou gatherest, Thunderer! like widespread bounty, kine, water, drops, and manifold libations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क ईं॑ स्तव॒त्कः पृ॑णा॒त्को य॑जाते॒ यदु॒ग्रमिन्म॒घवा॑ वि॒श्वहावे॑त् पादा॑विव प्र॒हर॑न्न॒न्यम॑न्यं कृ॒णोति॒ पूर्व॒मप॑रं॒ शची॑भिः
verses.transliteration: ká īṃ stavat káḥ pr̥ṇāt kó yajāte  yád ugrám ín maghávā viśváhā́vet  pā́dāv iva prahárann anyám-anyaṃ  kr̥ṇóti pū́rvam áparaṃ śácībhiḥ

translation.text: Who lauds him, satisfies him, pays him worship? E'en the rich noble still hath found him mighty. With power, as when one moves his feet alternate, he makes the last precede, the foremost follow.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शृ॒ण्वे वी॒र उ॒ग्रमु॑ग्रं दमा॒यन्न॒न्यम॑न्यमतिनेनी॒यमा॑नः ए॒ध॒मा॒न॒द्विळु॒भय॑स्य॒ राजा॑ चोष्कू॒यते॒ विश॒ इन्द्रो॑ मनु॒ष्या॑न्
verses.transliteration: śr̥ṇvé vīrá ugrám-ugraṃ damāyánn  anyám-anyam atinenīyámānaḥ  edhamānadvíḷ ubháyasya rā́jā  coṣkūyáte víśa índro manuṣyā̀n

translation.text: Famed is the Hero as each strong man's tamer, ever advancing one and then another. King of both worlds, hating the high and haughty, Indra protects the men who are his people.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परा॒ पूर्वे॑षां स॒ख्या वृ॑णक्ति वि॒तर्तु॑राणो॒ अप॑रेभिरेति अना॑नुभूतीरवधून्वा॒नः पू॒र्वीरिन्द्रः॑ श॒रद॑स्तर्तरीति
verses.transliteration: párā pū́rveṣāṃ sakhyā́ vr̥ṇakti  vitárturāṇo áparebhir eti  ánānubhūtīr avadhūnvānáḥ  pūrvī́r índraḥ śarádas tartarīti

translation.text: He loves no more the men he loved aforetime: he turns and moves away allied with others. Rejecting those who disregard his worship, Indra victorious lives through many autumns.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रू॒पंरू॑पं॒ प्रति॑रूपो बभूव॒ तद॑स्य रू॒पं प्र॑ति॒चक्ष॑णाय इन्द्रो॑ मा॒याभिः॑ पुरु॒रूप॑ ईयते यु॒क्ता ह्य॑स्य॒ हर॑यः श॒ता दश॑
verses.transliteration: rūpáṃ-rūpam prátirūpo babhūva  tád asya rūpám praticákṣaṇāya  índro māyā́bhiḥ pururū́pa īyate  yuktā́ hy àsya hárayaḥ śatā́ dáśa

translation.text: In every figure he hath been the mode: this is his only form for us to look on. Indra moves multiform by his illusions; for his Bay Steeds are yoked, ten times a hundred.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒जा॒नो ह॒रिता॒ रथे॒ भूरि॒ त्वष्टे॒ह रा॑जति को वि॒श्वाहा॑ द्विष॒तः पक्ष॑ आसत उ॒तासी॑नेषु सू॒रिषु॑
verses.transliteration: yujānó harítā ráthe  bhū́ri tváṣṭehá rājati  kó viśvā́hā dviṣatáḥ pákṣa āsate-  utā́sīneṣu sūríṣu

translation.text: Here Tvashṭar, yoking to the car the Bay Steeds, hath extended sway. Who will for ever stand upon the foeman's side, even when our princes sit at ease?

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग॒व्यू॒ति क्षेत्र॒माग॑न्म देवा उ॒र्वी स॒ती भूमि॑रंहूर॒णाभू॑त् बृह॑स्पते॒ प्र चि॑कित्सा॒ गवि॑ष्टावि॒त्था स॒ते ज॑रि॒त्र इ॑न्द्र॒ पन्था॑म्
verses.transliteration: agavyūtí kṣétram ā́ganma devāḥ-  urvī́ satī́ bhū́mir aṃhūraṇā́bhūt  bŕ̥haspate prá cikitsā gáviṣṭāv  itthā́ saté jaritrá indra pánthām

translation.text: Gods, we have reached a country void of pasture the land, though spacious, was too small to hold us. Br̥ihaspati, provide in war for cattle; find a path, Indra, for this faithful singer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒वेदि॑वे स॒दृशी॑र॒न्यमर्धं॑ कृ॒ष्णा अ॑सेध॒दप॒ सद्म॑नो॒ जाः अह॑न्दा॒सा वृ॑ष॒भो व॑स्न॒यन्तो॒दव्र॑जे व॒र्चिनं॒ शम्ब॑रं च
verses.transliteration: divé-dive sadŕ̥śīr anyám árdhaṃ  kr̥ṣṇā́ asedhad ápa sádmano jā́ḥ  áhan dāsā́ vr̥ṣabhó vasnayántā-  -udávraje varcínaṃ śámbaraṃ ca

translation.text: Day after day far from their seat he drove them, alike, from place to place, those darksome creatures. The Hero slew the meanly-huckstering Dâsas, Varcin and Ṣambara, where the waters gather.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र॒स्तो॒क इन्नु राध॑सस्त इन्द्र॒ दश॒ कोश॑यी॒र्दश॑ वा॒जिनो॑ऽदात् दिवो॑दासादतिथि॒ग्वस्य॒ राधः॑ शाम्ब॒रं वसु॒ प्रत्य॑ग्रभीष्म
verses.transliteration: prastoká ín nú rā́dhasas ta indra  dáśa kóśayīr dáśa vājíno 'dāt  dívodāsād atithigvásya rā́dhaḥ  śāmbaráṃ vásu práty agrabhīṣma

translation.text: Out of thy bounty, Indra, hath Prastoka bestowed ten coffers and ten mettled horses. We have received in turn from Divodâsa Ṣambara's wealth, the gift of Âtithigva.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दशाश्वा॒न्दश॒ कोशा॒न्दश॒ वस्त्राधि॑भोजना दशो॑ हिरण्यपि॒ण्डान्दिवो॑दासादसानिषम्
verses.transliteration: dáśā́śvān dáśa kóśān  dáśa vástrā́dhibhojanā  dáśo hiraṇyapiṇḍā́n  dívodāsād asāniṣam

translation.text: Ten horses and ten treasure-chests, ten garments as an added gift, These and ten lumps of gold have I received from Divodâsa's hand.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दश॒ रथा॒न्प्रष्टि॑मतः श॒तं गा अथ॑र्वभ्यः अ॒श्व॒थः पा॒यवे॑ऽदात्
verses.transliteration: dáśa ráthān práṣṭimataḥ  śatáṃ gā́ átharvabhyaḥ  aśvatháḥ pāyáve 'dāt

translation.text: Ten cars with extra steed to each, for the Atharvans hundred cows, Hath Aṣvatha to Pâyu given.

verses.sanskrit_deva: महि॒ राधो॑ वि॒श्वज॑न्यं॒ दधा॑नान्भ॒रद्वा॑जान्त्सार्ञ्ज॒यो अ॒भ्य॑यष्ट
verses.transliteration: máhi rā́dho viśvájanyaṃ dádhānān  bharádvājān sārñjayó abhy àyaṣṭa

translation.text: Thus Sr̥injaya's son honoured the Bharadvâjas, recipients of all noble gifts and bounty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वन॑स्पते वी॒ड्व॑ङ्गो॒ हि भू॒या अ॒स्मत्स॑खा प्र॒तर॑णः सु॒वीरः॑ गोभिः॒ संन॑द्धो असि वी॒ळय॑स्वास्था॒ता ते॑ जयतु॒ जेत्वा॑नि
verses.transliteration: vánaspate vīḍvàṅgo hí bhūyā́ḥ-  asmátsakhā pratáraṇaḥ suvī́raḥ  góbhiḥ sáṃnaddho asi vīḷáyasva-  -āsthātā́ te jayatu jétvāni

translation.text: Lord of the wood, be firm and strong in body: be, bearing us, a brave victorious hero Show forth thy strength, compact with straps of leather, and let thy rider win all spoils of battle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒वस्पृ॑थि॒व्याः पर्योज॒ उद्भृ॑तं॒ वन॒स्पति॑भ्यः॒ पर्याभृ॑तं॒ सहः॑ अ॒पामो॒ज्मानं॒ परि॒ गोभि॒रावृ॑त॒मिन्द्र॑स्य॒ वज्रं॑ ह॒विषा॒ रथं॑ यज
verses.transliteration: divás pr̥thivyā́ḥ páry ója údbhr̥taṃ  vánaspátibhyaḥ páry ā́bhr̥taṃ sáhaḥ  apā́m ojmā́nam pári góbhir ā́vr̥tam  índrasya vájraṃ havíṣā ráthaṃ yaja

translation.text: Its mighty strength was borrowed from the heaven and earth: its conquering force was brought from sovrans of the wood. Honour with holy gifts the Car like Indra's bolt, the Car bound round with straps, the vigour of the floods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑स्य॒ वज्रो॑ म॒रुता॒मनी॑कं मि॒त्रस्य॒ गर्भो॒ वरु॑णस्य॒ नाभिः॑ सेमां नो॑ ह॒व्यदा॑तिं जुषा॒णो देव॑ रथ॒ प्रति॑ ह॒व्या गृ॑भाय
verses.transliteration: índrasya vájro marútām ánīkam  mitrásya gárbho váruṇasya nā́bhiḥ  sémā́ṃ no havyádātiṃ juṣāṇó  déva ratha práti havyā́ gr̥bhāya

translation.text: Thou Bolt of Indra, Vanguard of the Maruts, close knit to Varuṇa and Child of Mitra,– As such, accepting gifts which here we offer, receive, O Godlike Chariot, these oblations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॑ श्वासय पृथि॒वीमु॒त द्यां पु॑रु॒त्रा ते॑ मनुतां॒ विष्ठि॑तं॒ जग॑त् स दु॑न्दुभे स॒जूरिन्द्रे॑ण दे॒वैर्दू॒राद्दवी॑यो॒ अप॑ सेध॒ शत्रू॑न्
verses.transliteration: úpa śvāsaya pr̥thivī́m utá dyā́m  purutrā́ te manutāṃ víṣṭhitaṃ jágat  sá dundubhe sajū́r índreṇa devaír  dūrā́d dávīyo ápa sedha śátrūn

translation.text: Send forth thy voice aloud through earth and heaven, and let the world in all its breadth regard thee; O Drum, accordant with the Gods and Indra, drive thou afar, yea, very far, our foemen.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ क्र॑न्दय॒ बल॒मोजो॑ न॒ आ धा॒ निः ष्ट॑निहि दुरि॒ता बाध॑मानः अप॑ प्रोथ दुन्दुभे दु॒च्छुना॑ इ॒त इन्द्र॑स्य मु॒ष्टिर॑सि वी॒ळय॑स्व
verses.transliteration: ā́ krandaya bálam ójo na ā́ dhāḥ-  ní ṣṭanihi duritā́ bā́dhamānaḥ  ápa protha dundubhe duchúnā itáḥ-  índrasya muṣṭír asi vīḷáyasva

translation.text: Thunder out strength and fill us full of vigour: yea, thunder forth and drive away all dangers. Drive hence, O War-drum, drive away misfortune: thou art the Fist of Indra: show thy firmness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आमूर॑ज प्र॒त्याव॑र्तये॒माः के॑तु॒मद्दु॑न्दु॒भिर्वा॑वदीति समश्व॑पर्णा॒श्चर॑न्ति नो॒ नरो॒ऽस्माक॑मिन्द्र र॒थिनो॑ जयन्तु
verses.transliteration: ā́mū́r aja pratyā́vartayemā́ḥ  ketumád dundubhír vāvadīti  sám áśvaparṇāś cáranti no náro  -asmā́kam indra rathíno jayantu

translation.text: Drive hither those, and these again bring hither: the War-drum speaks aloud as battle's signal. Our heroes, winged with horses, come together. Let our car-warriors, Indra, be triumphant.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒ज्ञाय॑ज्ञा वो अ॒ग्नये॑ गि॒रागि॑रा च॒ दक्ष॑से प्रप्र॑ व॒यम॒मृतं॑ जा॒तवे॑दसं प्रि॒यं मि॒त्रं न शं॑सिषम्
verses.transliteration: yajñā́-yajñā vo agnáye  girā́-girā ca dákṣase  prá-pra vayám amŕ̥taṃ jātávedasam  priyám mitráṃ ná śaṃsiṣam

translation.text: SING to your Agni with each song, at every sacrifice, for strength. Come, let us praise the Wise and Everlasting God, even as a well-beloved Friend,

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऊ॒र्जो नपा॑तं॒ स हि॒नायम॑स्म॒युर्दाशे॑म ह॒व्यदा॑तये भुव॒द्वाजे॑ष्ववि॒ता भुव॑द्वृ॒ध उ॒त त्रा॒ता त॒नूना॑म्
verses.transliteration: ūrjó nápātaṃ sá hinā́yám asmayúr  dā́śema havyádātaye  bhúvad vā́jeṣv avitā́ bhúvad vr̥dháḥ-  utá trātā́ tanū́nām

translation.text: The Son of Strength; for is he not our gracious Lord? Let us serve him who bears our gifts. In battle may he be our help and strengthener, yea, be the saviour of our lives.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वृषा॒ ह्य॑ग्ने अ॒जरो॑ म॒हान्वि॒भास्य॒र्चिषा॑ अज॑स्रेण शो॒चिषा॒ शोशु॑चच्छुचे सुदी॒तिभिः॒ सु दी॑दिहि
verses.transliteration: vŕ̥ṣā hy àgne ajáro  mahā́n vibhā́sy arcíṣā  ájasreṇa śocíṣā śóśucac chuce  sudītíbhiḥ sú dīdihi

translation.text: Agni, thou beamest forth with light, great Hero, never changed by time. Shining, pure Agni! with a light that never fades, beam with thy fair beams brilliantly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हो दे॒वान्यज॑सि॒ यक्ष्या॑नु॒षक्तव॒ क्रत्वो॒त दं॒सना॑ अ॒र्वाचः॑ सीं कृणुह्य॒ग्नेऽव॑से॒ रास्व॒ वाजो॒त वं॑स्व
verses.transliteration: mahó devā́n yájasi yákṣy ānuṣák  táva krátvotá daṃsánā  arvā́caḥ sīṃ kr̥ṇuhy agné 'vase  rā́sva vā́jotá vaṃsva

translation.text: Thou worshippest great Gods: bring them without delay by wisdom and thy wondrous power. O Agni, make them turn hither to succour us. Give strength, and win it for thyself.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यमापो॒ अद्र॑यो॒ वना॒ गर्भ॑मृ॒तस्य॒ पिप्र॑ति सह॑सा॒ यो म॑थि॒तो जाय॑ते॒ नृभिः॑ पृथि॒व्या अधि॒ सान॑वि
verses.transliteration: yám ā́po ádrayo vánā  gárbham r̥tásya píprati  sáhasā yó mathitó jā́yate nŕ̥bhiḥ  pr̥thivyā́ ádhi sā́navi

translation.text: He whom floods, stones, and trees support, the offspring of eternal Law; He who when rubbed with force is brought to life by men upon the lofty height of earth;

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ यः प॒प्रौ भा॒नुना॒ रोद॑सी उ॒भे धू॒मेन॑ धावते दि॒वि ति॒रस्तमो॑ ददृश॒ ऊर्म्या॒स्वा श्या॒वास्व॑रु॒षो वृषा श्या॒वा अ॑रु॒षो वृषा॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ yáḥ papraú bhānúnā ródasī ubhé  dhūména dhāvate diví  tirás támo dadr̥śa ū́rmyāsv~ā́  śyāvā́sv aruṣó vŕ̥ṣā-  -ā́ śyāvā́ aruṣó vŕ̥ṣā

translation.text: He who hath filled both worlds fult with his brilliant shine, who hastens with his smoke to heaven; He made himself apparent through the gloom by night, the Red Bull in the darksome nights, the Red Bull in the darksome nights.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बृ॒हद्भि॑रग्ने अ॒र्चिभिः॑ शु॒क्रेण॑ देव शो॒चिषा॑ भ॒रद्वा॑जे समिधा॒नो य॑विष्ठ्य रे॒वन्नः॑ शुक्र दीदिहि द्यु॒मत्पा॑वक दीदिहि
verses.transliteration: br̥hádbhir agne arcíbhiḥ  śukréṇa deva śocíṣā  bharádvāje samidhānó yaviṣṭhya  reván naḥ śukra dīdihi  dyumát pāvaka dīdihi

translation.text: O Agni, with thy lofty beams, with thy pure brilliancy, O God, Kindled, Most Youthful One! by Bharadvâja's hand, shine on us, O pure God, with wealth, shine, Purifier! splendidly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वा॑सां गृ॒हप॑तिर्वि॒शाम॑सि॒ त्वम॑ग्ने॒ मानु॑षीणाम् श॒तं पू॒र्भिर्य॑विष्ठ पा॒ह्यंह॑सः समे॒द्धारं॑ श॒तं हिमाः॑ स्तो॒तृभ्यो॒ ये च॒ दद॑ति
verses.transliteration: víśvāsāṃ gr̥hápatir viśā́m asi  tvám agne mā́nuṣīṇām  śatám pūrbhír yaviṣṭha pāhy áṃhasaḥ  sameddhā́raṃ śatáṃ hímāḥ-  stotŕ̥bhyo yé ca dádati

translation.text: Thou art the Lord of house and home of all the tribes, O Agni, of all tribes of men. Guard with a hundred forts thy kindler from distress, through hundred winters, Youngest God! and those who make thy singers rich.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं न॑श्चि॒त्र ऊ॒त्या वसो॒ राधां॑सि चोदय अ॒स्य रा॒यस्त्वम॑ग्ने र॒थीर॑सि वि॒दा गा॒धं तु॒चे तु नः॑
verses.transliteration: tváṃ naś citrá ūtyā́  váso rā́dhāṃsi codaya  asyá rāyás tvám agne rathī́r asi  vidā́ gādháṃ tucé tú naḥ

translation.text: Wonderful, with thy favouring help, send us thy bounties, gracious Lord. Thou art the Charioteer, Agni, of earthly wealth: find rest and safety for our seed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पर्षि॑ तो॒कं तन॑यं प॒र्तृभि॒ष्ट्वमद॑ब्धै॒रप्र॑युत्वभिः अग्ने॒ हेळां॑सि॒ दैव्या॑ युयोधि॒ नोऽदे॑वानि॒ ह्वरां॑सि च
verses.transliteration: párṣi tokáṃ tánayam partŕ̥bhiṣ ṭvám  ádabdhair áprayutvabhiḥ  ágne héḷāṃsi daívyā yuyodhi naḥ-  -ádevāni hvárāṃsi ca

translation.text: With guards unfailing never negligent speed thou our children and our progeny. Keep far from us, O Agni, all celestial wrath and wickedness of godless men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ स॑खायः सब॒र्दुघां॑ धे॒नुम॑जध्व॒मुप॒ नव्य॑सा॒ वचः॑ सृ॒जध्व॒मन॑पस्फुराम्
verses.transliteration: ā́ sakhāyaḥ sabardúghāṃ  dhenúm ajadhvam úpa návyasā vácaḥ  sr̥jádhvam ánapasphurām

translation.text: Hither, O friends, with newest song drive her who freely pours her milk; Loose her who never turns away;

verses.sanskrit_deva: या शर्धा॑य॒ मारु॑ताय॒ स्वभा॑नवे॒ श्रवोऽमृ॑त्यु॒ धुक्ष॑त या मृ॑ळी॒के म॒रुतां॑ तु॒राणां॒ या सु॒म्नैरे॑व॒याव॑री
verses.transliteration: yā́ śárdhāya mā́rutāya svábhānave  śrávó 'mr̥tyu dhúkṣata  yā́ mr̥ḷīké marútāṃ turā́ṇāṃ  yā́ sumnaír evayā́varī

translation.text: Who, for the host of Maruts bright with native sheen, hath shed immortal fame like milk; Whom the impetuous Maruts look upon with love, who moves in splendour on their ways.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भ॒रद्वा॑जा॒याव॑ धुक्षत द्वि॒ता धे॒नुं च॑ वि॒श्वदो॑हस॒मिषं॑ च वि॒श्वभो॑जसम्
verses.transliteration: bharádvājāyā́va dhukṣata dvitā́  dhenúṃ ca viśvádohasam  íṣaṃ ca viśvábhojasam

translation.text: For Bharadvâja she poured down in days of old The milch-cow yielding milk for all, and food that gives all nourishment.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं व॒ इन्द्रं॒ न सु॒क्रतुं॒ वरु॑णमिव मा॒यिन॑म् अ॒र्य॒मणं॒ न म॒न्द्रं सृ॒प्रभो॑जसं॒ विष्णुं॒ न स्तु॑ष आ॒दिशे॑
verses.transliteration: táṃ va índraṃ ná sukrátuṃ  váruṇam iva māyínam  aryamáṇaṃ ná mandráṃ sr̥prábhojasaṃ  víṣṇuṃ ná stuṣa ādíśe

translation.text: Your friend like Indra passing wise, with magic power like Varuṇa. Like Aryaman joy-giving, bringing plenteous food like ViSnxu for my wish, I praise,

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वे॒षं शर्धो॒ न मारु॑तं तुवि॒ष्वण्य॑न॒र्वाणं॑ पू॒षणं॒ सं यथा॑ श॒ता सं स॒हस्रा॒ कारि॑षच्चर्ष॒णिभ्य॒ आँ आ॒विर्गू॒ळ्हा वसू॑ करत्सु॒वेदा॑ नो॒ वसू॑ करत्
verses.transliteration: tveṣáṃ śárdho ná mā́rutaṃ tuviṣváṇi-  anarvā́ṇam pūṣáṇaṃ sáṃ yáthā śatā́  sáṃ sahásrā kā́riṣac carṣaṇíbhya ā́m̐  āvír gūḷhā́ vásū karat  suvédā no vásū karat

translation.text: Bright as the host of Maruts mighty in their roar. May they bring Pûshan free from foes; May they bring hither hundreds, thousands for our men: may they bring hidden stores to light, and make wealth easy to be found.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ मा॑ पूष॒न्नुप॑ द्रव॒ शंसि॑षं॒ नु ते॑ अपिक॒र्ण आ॑घृणे अ॒घा अ॒र्यो अरा॑तयः
verses.transliteration: ā́ mā pūṣann úpa drava  śáṃsiṣaṃ nú te apikarṇá āghr̥ṇe  aghā́ aryó árātayaḥ

translation.text: Haste to me, Pûshan, in thine car, bright Deity: I fain would speak: Most sinful is our foeman's hate.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा का॑क॒म्बीर॒मुद्वृ॑हो॒ वन॒स्पति॒मश॑स्ती॒र्वि हि नीन॑शः मोत सूरो॒ अह॑ ए॒वा च॒न ग्री॒वा आ॒दध॑ते॒ वेः
verses.transliteration: mā́ kākambī́ram úd vr̥ho vánaspátim  áśastīr ví hí nī́naśaḥ  mótá sū́ro áha evā́ caná  grīvā́ ādádhate véḥ

translation.text: Tear not up by the roots the Kâkambîra tree: destroy thou all malignity. Let them not snare by day the neck of that Celestial Bird the Sun.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दृते॑रिव तेऽवृ॒कम॑स्तु स॒ख्यम् अच्छि॑द्रस्य दध॒न्वतः॒ सुपू॑र्णस्य दध॒न्वतः॑
verses.transliteration: dŕ̥ter iva te 'vr̥kám astu sakhyám  áchidrasya dadhanvátaḥ  súpūrṇasya dadhanvátaḥ

translation.text: Uninjured let thy friendship be, like the smooth surface of a skin, A flawless skin, containing curds, full to the mouth, containing curds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प॒रो हि मर्त्यै॒रसि॑ स॒मो दे॒वैरु॒त श्रि॒या अ॒भि ख्यः॑ पूष॒न्पृत॑नासु न॒स्त्वमवा॑ नू॒नं यथा॑ पु॒रा
verses.transliteration: paró hí mártyair ási  samó devaír utá śriyā́  abhí khyaḥ pūṣan pŕ̥tanāsu nas tvám  ávā nūnáṃ yáthā purā́

translation.text: For thou art high above mankind, in glory equal to the Gods. Therefore, O Pûshan, look upon us in the fight: now help us as in days of old.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वा॒मी वा॒मस्य॑ धूतयः॒ प्रणी॑तिरस्तु सू॒नृता॑ दे॒वस्य॑ वा मरुतो॒ मर्त्य॑स्य वेजा॒नस्य॑ प्रयज्यवः
verses.transliteration: vāmī́ vāmásya dhūtayaḥ  práṇītir astu sūnŕ̥tā  devásya vā maruto mártyasya vā-  -ījānásya prayajyavaḥ

translation.text: May the kind excellence of him the Kind, loud Roarers! be our guide, Be it the God's, O Maruts, or a mortal man's who worships, ye impetuous Ones!

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒द्यश्चि॒द्यस्य॑ चर्कृ॒तिः परि॒ द्यां दे॒वो नैति॒ सूर्यः॑ त्वे॒षं शवो॑ दधिरे॒ नाम॑ य॒ज्ञियं॑ म॒रुतो॑ वृत्र॒हं शवो॒ ज्येष्ठं॑ वृत्र॒हं शवः॑
verses.transliteration: sadyáś cid yásya carkr̥tíḥ  pári dyā́ṃ devó naíti sū́ryaḥ  tveṣáṃ śávo dadhire nā́ma yajñíyam  marúto vr̥traháṃ śávo  jyéṣṭhaṃ vr̥traháṃ śávaḥ

translation.text: They whose high glory in a moment like the God, the Sun, goes round the space of heaven, The Maruts have obtained bright strength, a sacred name, strength that destroys the Vr̥itras, strength Vr̥itra-destroying excellent.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒कृद्ध॒ द्यौर॑जायत स॒कृद्भूमि॑रजायत पृश्न्या॑ दु॒ग्धं स॒कृत्पय॒स्तद॒न्यो नानु॑ जायते
verses.transliteration: sakŕ̥d dha dyaúr ajāyata  sakŕ̥d bhū́mir ajāyata  pŕ̥śnyā dugdháṃ sakŕ̥t páyas  tád anyó nā́nu jāyate

translation.text: Once, only once, the heaven was made, once only once, the earth was formed- Once, only Pr̥iṣni's milk was shed: no second, after this, is born.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्तु॒षे जनं॑ सुव्र॒तं नव्य॑सीभिर्गी॒र्भिर्मि॒त्रावरु॑णा सुम्न॒यन्ता॑ त आ ग॑मन्तु॒ त इ॒ह श्रु॑वन्तु सुक्ष॒त्रासो॒ वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॒ग्निः
verses.transliteration: stuṣé jánaṃ suvratáṃ návyasībhir  gīrbhír mitrā́váruṇā sumnayántā  tá ā́ gamantu tá ihá śruvantu  sukṣatrā́so váruṇo mitró agníḥ

translation.text: I LAUD with newest songs the Righteous People, Mitra and Varuṇa who make us happy. Let them approach, here let them listen,Agni, Varuṇa, Mitra, Lords of fair dominion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒शोवि॑श॒ ईड्य॑मध्व॒रेष्वदृ॑प्तक्रतुमर॒तिं यु॑व॒त्योः दि॒वः शिशुं॒ सह॑सः सू॒नुम॒ग्निं य॒ज्ञस्य॑ के॒तुम॑रु॒षं यज॑ध्यै
verses.transliteration: viśó-viśa ī́ḍyam adhvaréṣu-  ádr̥ptakratum aratíṃ yuvatyóḥ  diváḥ śíśuṃ sáhasaḥ sūnúm agníṃ  yajñásya ketúm aruṣáṃ yájadhyai

translation.text: Him, to be praised at each tribe's sacrifices, the Two young Matrons' sober-minded Herald, The Son of Strength, the Child of Heaven, the signal of sacrifice, red Agni will I worship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒रु॒षस्य॑ दुहि॒तरा॒ विरू॑पे॒ स्तृभि॑र॒न्या पि॑पि॒शे सूरो॑ अ॒न्या मि॒थ॒स्तुरा॑ वि॒चर॑न्ती पाव॒के मन्म॑ श्रु॒तं न॑क्षत ऋ॒च्यमा॑ने
verses.transliteration: aruṣásya duhitárā vírūpe  stŕ̥bhir anyā́ pipiśé sū́ro anyā́  mithastúrā vicárantī pāvaké  mánma śrutáṃ nakṣata r̥cyámāne

translation.text: Unlike in form are the Red God's two Daughters: one is the Sun's, and stars bedeck the other. Apart, the Sanctifiers, in succession, come to the famed hymn, praised in holy verses.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वा॒युमच्छा॑ बृह॒ती म॑नी॒षा बृ॒हद्र॑यिं वि॒श्ववा॑रं रथ॒प्राम् द्यु॒तद्या॑मा नि॒युतः॒ पत्य॑मानः क॒विः क॒विमि॑यक्षसि प्रयज्यो
verses.transliteration: prá vāyúm áchā br̥hatī́ manīṣā́  br̥hádrayiṃ viśvávāraṃ rathaprā́m  dyutádyāmā niyútaḥ pátyamānaḥ  kavíḥ kavím iyakṣasi prayajyo

translation.text: I with a lofty song call hither Vâyu, all-bounteous, filler of his car, most wealthy. Thou, Sage, with bright path, Lord of harnessed horses, impetuous, promptly honourest the prudent.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स मे॒ वपु॑श्छदयद॒श्विनो॒र्यो रथो॑ वि॒रुक्मा॒न्मन॑सा युजा॒नः येन॑ नरा नासत्येष॒यध्यै॑ व॒र्तिर्या॒थस्तन॑याय॒ त्मने॑ च
verses.transliteration: sá me vápuś chadayad aśvínor yó  rátho virúkmān mánasā yujānáḥ  yéna narā nāsatyeṣayádhyai  vartír yāthás tánayāya tmáne ca

translation.text: That chariot of the Aṣvins, fair to look on, pleaseth me well, yoked with a thought, refulgent, Wherewith, Nâsatyas, Chiefs, ye seek our dwelling, to give new strength to us and to our children.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पर्ज॑न्यवाता वृषभा पृथि॒व्याः पुरी॑षाणि जिन्वत॒मप्या॑नि सत्य॑श्रुतः कवयो॒ यस्य॑ गी॒र्भिर्जग॑तः स्थात॒र्जग॒दा कृ॑णुध्वम्
verses.transliteration: párjanyavātā vr̥ṣabhā pr̥thivyā́ḥ  púrīṣāṇi jinvatam ápyāni  sátyaśrutaḥ kavayo yásya gīrbhír  jágata sthātar jágad ā́ kr̥ṇudhvam

translation.text: Bulls of the Earth, O Vâta and Parjanya, stir up for us the regions of the water. Hearers of truth, ye, Sages, World-Supporters, increase his living wealth whose songs delight you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पावी॑रवी क॒न्या॑ चि॒त्रायुः॒ सर॑स्वती वी॒रप॑त्नी॒ धियं॑ धात् ग्नाभि॒रच्छि॑द्रं शर॒णं स॒जोषा॑ दुरा॒धर्षं॑ गृण॒ते शर्म॑ यंसत्
verses.transliteration: pā́vīravī kanyā̀ citrā́yuḥ  sárasvatī vīrápatnī dhíyaṃ dhāt  gnā́bhir áchidraṃ śaraṇáṃ sajóṣāḥ-  durādhárṣaṃ gr̥ṇaté śárma yaṃsat

translation.text: So may Sarasvatî, the Hero's Consort, brisk with rare life, the lightning's Child, inspire us, And, with the Dames accordant, give the singer a refuge unassailable and flawless.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प॒थस्प॑थः॒ परि॑पतिं वच॒स्या कामे॑न कृ॒तो अ॒भ्या॑नळ॒र्कम् स नो॑ रासच्छु॒रुध॑श्च॒न्द्राग्रा॒ धियं॑धियं सीषधाति॒ प्र पू॒षा
verses.transliteration: pathás-pathaḥ páripatiṃ vacasyā́  kā́mena kr̥tó abhy ā̀naḷ arkám  sá no rāsac churúdhaś candrā́grāḥ-  dhíyaṃ-dhiyaṃ sīṣadhāti prá pūṣā́

translation.text: I praise with eloquence him who guards all pathways. He, when his love impelled him, went to Arka. May he vouchsafe us gear with gold to grace it: may Pûshan make each prayer of ours efective.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र॒थ॒म॒भाजं॑ य॒शसं॑ वयो॒धां सु॑पा॒णिं दे॒वं सु॒गभ॑स्ति॒मृभ्व॑म् होता॑ यक्षद्यज॒तं प॒स्त्या॑नाम॒ग्निस्त्वष्टा॑रं सु॒हवं॑ वि॒भावा॑
verses.transliteration: prathamabhā́jaṃ yaśásaṃ vayodhā́ṃ  supāṇíṃ deváṃ sugábhastim ŕ̥bhvam  hótā yakṣad yajatám pastyā̀nām  agnís tváṣṭāraṃ suhávaṃ vibhā́vā

translation.text: May Herald Agni, fulgent, bring for worship Tvashṭar adored, in homes and swift to listen, Glorious, first to share, the life-bestower, the ever active God, fair-armed, fair-handed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भुव॑नस्य पि॒तरं॑ गी॒र्भिरा॒भी रु॒द्रं दिवा॑ व॒र्धया॑ रु॒द्रम॒क्तौ बृ॒हन्त॑मृ॒ष्वम॒जरं॑ सुषु॒म्नमृध॑ग्घुवेम क॒विने॑षि॒तासः॑
verses.transliteration: bhúvanasya pitáraṃ gīrbhír ābhíḥ-  rudráṃ dívā vardháyā rudrám aktaú  br̥hántam r̥ṣvám ajáraṃ suṣumnám  ŕ̥dhag ghuvema kavíneṣitā́saḥ

translation.text: Rudra by day, Rudra at night we honour with these our songs, the Universe's Father. Him great and lofty, blissful, undecaying let us call specially as the Sage impels us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ यु॑वानः कवयो यज्ञियासो॒ मरु॑तो ग॒न्त गृ॑ण॒तो व॑र॒स्याम् अ॒चि॒त्रं चि॒द्धि जिन्व॑था वृ॒धन्त॑ इ॒त्था नक्ष॑न्तो नरो अङ्गिर॒स्वत्
verses.transliteration: ā́ yuvānaḥ kavayo yajñiyāso  máruto gantá gr̥ṇató varasyā́m  acitráṃ cid dhí jínvathā vr̥dhántaḥ-  itthā́ nákṣanto naro aṅgirasvát

translation.text: Ye who are youthful, wise, and meet for worship, come, Martits, to the longing of the singer. Coming, as erst to Angiras, O Heroes, ye animate and quicken e'en the desert.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वी॒राय॒ प्र त॒वसे॑ तु॒रायाजा॑ यू॒थेव॑ पशु॒रक्षि॒रस्त॑म् स पि॑स्पृशति त॒न्वि॑ श्रु॒तस्य॒ स्तृभि॒र्न नाकं॑ वच॒नस्य॒ विपः॑
verses.transliteration: prá vīrā́ya prá taváse turā́ya-  -ájā yūthéva paśurákṣir ástam  sá pispr̥śati tanvì śrutásya  stŕ̥bhir ná nā́kaṃ vacanásya vípaḥ

translation.text: Even as the herdsman driveth home his cattle, I urge my songs to him the strong swift Hero May he, the glorious, lay upon his body the singer's hymns, as stars bedeck the heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो रजां॑सि विम॒मे पार्थि॑वानि॒ त्रिश्चि॒द्विष्णु॒र्मन॑वे बाधि॒ताय॑ तस्य॑ ते॒ शर्म॑न्नुपद॒द्यमा॑ने रा॒या म॑देम त॒न्वा॒३॒॑ तना॑ च
verses.transliteration: yó rájāṃsi vimamé pā́rthivāni  tríś cid víṣṇur mánave bādhitā́ya  tásya te śármann upadadyámāne  rāyā́ madema tanvā̀ tánā ca

translation.text: He who for man's behoof in his afiliction thrice measured out the earthly regions, Vishṇu- When one so great as thou affordeth shelter, may we with wealth and with ourselves be happy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तन्नोऽहि॑र्बु॒ध्न्यो॑ अ॒द्भिर॒र्कैस्तत्पर्व॑त॒स्तत्स॑वि॒ता चनो॑ धात् तदोष॑धीभिर॒भि रा॑ति॒षाचो॒ भगः॒ पुरं॑धिर्जिन्वतु॒ प्र रा॒ये
verses.transliteration: tán nó 'hir budhnyò adbhír arkaís  tát párvatas tát savitā́ cáno dhāt  tád óṣadhībhir abhí rātiṣā́co  bhágaḥ púraṃdhir jinvatu prá rāyé

translation.text: Sweet be this song of mine to Ahibudhnya, Parvata, Savitar, with Floods and Lightnings; Sweet, with the Plants, to Gods who seek oblations. May liberal Bhaga speed us on to riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नु नो॑ र॒यिं र॒थ्यं॑ चर्षणि॒प्रां पु॑रु॒वीरं॑ म॒ह ऋ॒तस्य॑ गो॒पाम् क्षयं॑ दाता॒जरं॒ येन॒ जना॒न्त्स्पृधो॒ अदे॑वीर॒भि च॒ क्रमा॑म॒ विश॒ आदे॑वीर॒भ्य१॒॑श्नवा॑म
