verses.transliteration: nú no rayíṃ rathyàṃ carṣaṇiprā́m  puruvī́ram mahá r̥tásya gopā́m  kṣáyaṃ dātājáraṃ yéna jánān  spŕ̥dho ádevīr abhí ca krámāma  víśa ā́devīr abhy àśnávāma

translation.text: Give riches borne on cars, with many heroes, contenting men, the guard of mighty Order. Give us a lasting home that we may battle with godless bands of men who fight against us, and meet with tribes to whom the Gods are gracious.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हु॒वे वो॑ दे॒वीमदि॑तिं॒ नमो॑भिर्मृळी॒काय॒ वरु॑णं मि॒त्रम॒ग्निम् अ॒भि॒क्ष॒दाम॑र्य॒मणं॑ सु॒शेवं॑ त्रा॒तॄन्दे॒वान्त्स॑वि॒तारं॒ भगं॑ च
verses.transliteration: huvé vo devī́m áditiṃ námobhir  mr̥ḷīkā́ya váruṇam mitrám agním  abhikṣadā́m aryamáṇaṃ suśévaṃ  trātr̥̄́n devā́n savitā́ram bhágaṃ ca

translation.text: I CALL with prayers on Aditi your Goddess, on Agni, Mitra, Varuṇa for favour, On Aryaman who gives unasked, the gracious, on Gods who save, on Savitar and Bhaga.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒ज्योति॑षः सूर्य॒ दक्ष॑पितॄननागा॒स्त्वे सु॑महो वीहि दे॒वान् द्वि॒जन्मा॑नो॒ य ऋ॑त॒सापः॑ स॒त्याः स्व॑र्वन्तो यज॒ता अ॑ग्निजि॒ह्वाः
verses.transliteration: sujyótiṣaḥ sūrya dákṣapitr̥̄n  anāgāstvé sumaho vīhi devā́n  dvijánmāno yá r̥tasā́paḥ satyā́ḥ  svàrvanto yajatā́ agnijihvā́ḥ

translation.text: Visit, to prove us free from sin, O Sûrya Lord of great might, the bright Gods sprung from Daksha, Twice-born and true, observing sacred duties, Holy and full of light, whose tongue is Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त द्या॑वापृथिवी क्ष॒त्रमु॒रु बृ॒हद्रो॑दसी शर॒णं सु॑षुम्ने म॒हस्क॑रथो॒ वरि॑वो॒ यथा॑ नो॒ऽस्मे क्षया॑य धिषणे अने॒हः
verses.transliteration: utá dyāvāpr̥thivī kṣatrám urú  br̥hád rodasī śaraṇáṃ suṣumne  mahás karatho várivo yáthā naḥ-  -asmé kṣáyāya dhiṣaṇe aneháḥ

translation.text: And, O ye Heaven and Earth, a wide dominion, O ye most blissful Worlds, our lofty shelter, Give ample room and freedom for our dwelling, a home, ye Hemispheres, which none may rival.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ रु॒द्रस्य॑ सू॒नवो॑ नमन्ताम॒द्या हू॒तासो॒ वस॒वोऽधृ॑ष्टाः यदी॒मर्भे॑ मह॒ति वा॑ हि॒तासो॑ बा॒धे म॒रुतो॒ अह्वा॑म दे॒वान्
verses.transliteration: ā́ no rudrásya sūnávo namantām  adyā́ hūtā́so vásavó 'dhr̥ṣṭāḥ  yád īm árbhe mahatí vā hitā́so  bādhé marúto áhvāma devā́n

translation.text: This day invited may the Sons of Rudra, resistless, excellent, stoop down to meet us; For, when beset with slight or sore affliction, we ever call upon the Gods, the Maruts;

verses.sanskrit_deva: मि॒म्यक्ष॒ येषु॑ रोद॒सी नु दे॒वी सिष॑क्ति पू॒षा अ॑भ्यर्ध॒यज्वा॑ श्रु॒त्वा हवं॑ मरुतो॒ यद्ध॑ या॒थ भूमा॑ रेजन्ते॒ अध्व॑नि॒ प्रवि॑क्ते
verses.transliteration: mimyákṣa yéṣu rodasī́ nú devī́  síṣakti pūṣā́ abhyardhayájvā  śrutvā́ hávam maruto yád dha yāthá  bhū́mā rejante ádhvani právikte

translation.text: To whom the Goddess Rodasî clings closely, whom Pûshan follows bringing ample bounty. What time ye hear our call and come, O Maruts, upon your separate path all creatures tremble.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि त्यं वी॒रं गिर्व॑णसम॒र्चेन्द्रं॒ ब्रह्म॑णा जरित॒र्नवे॑न श्रव॒दिद्धव॒मुप॑ च॒ स्तवा॑नो॒ रास॒द्वाजाँ॒ उप॑ म॒हो गृ॑णा॒नः
verses.transliteration: abhí tyáṃ vīráṃ gírvaṇasam arca-  -índram bráhmaṇā jaritar návena  śrávad íd dhávam úpa ca stávāno  rā́sad vā́jām̐ úpa mahó gr̥ṇānáḥ

translation.text: With a new hymn extol, O thou who singest, the Lover of the Song, the Hero Indra. May he, exalted, hear our invocation, and grant us mighty wealth and strength when lauded.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ओ॒मान॑मापो मानुषी॒रमृ॑क्तं॒ धात॑ तो॒काय॒ तन॑याय॒ शं योः यू॒यं हि ष्ठा भि॒षजो॑ मा॒तृत॑मा॒ विश्व॑स्य स्था॒तुर्जग॑तो॒ जनि॑त्रीः
verses.transliteration: omā́nam āpo mānuṣīr ámr̥ktaṃ  dhā́ta tokā́ya tánayāya śáṃ yóḥ  yūyáṃ hí ṣṭhā́ bhiṣájo mātŕ̥tamāḥ-  víśvasya sthātúr jágato jánitrīḥ

translation.text: Give full protection, Friends of man, ye Waters, in peace and trouble, to our sons and grandsons. For ye are our most motherly physicians, parents of all that standeth, all that moveth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ दे॒वः स॑वि॒ता त्राय॑माणो॒ हिर॑ण्यपाणिर्यज॒तो ज॑गम्यात् यो दत्र॑वाँ उ॒षसो॒ न प्रती॑कं व्यूर्णु॒ते दा॒शुषे॒ वार्या॑णि
verses.transliteration: ā́ no deváḥ savitā́ trā́yamāṇo  híraṇyapāṇir yajató jagamyāt  yó dátravām̐ uṣáso ná prátīkaṃ  vyūrṇuté dāśúṣe vā́ryāṇi

translation.text: May Savitar come hither and approach us, the God who rescues, Holy, goldenhanded, The God who, bounteous as the face of Morning, discloses precious gifts for him who worships.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त त्वं सू॑नो सहसो नो अ॒द्या दे॒वाँ अ॒स्मिन्न॑ध्व॒रे व॑वृत्याः स्याम॒हं ते॒ सद॒मिद्रा॒तौ तव॑ स्याम॒ग्नेऽव॑सा सु॒वीरः॑
verses.transliteration: utá tváṃ sūno sahaso no adyá-  -ā́ devā́m̐ asmínn adhvaré vavr̥tyāḥ  syā́m aháṃ te sádam íd rātaú  táva syām agné 'vasā suvī́raḥ

translation.text: And thou, O Son of Strength, do thou turn hither the Gods to-day to this our holy service. May I for evermore enjoy thy bounty and, Agni, by thy grace be rich in heroes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त त्या मे॒ हव॒मा ज॑ग्म्यातं॒ नास॑त्या धी॒भिर्यु॒वम॒ङ्ग वि॑प्रा अत्रिं॒ न म॒हस्तम॑सोऽमुमुक्तं॒ तूर्व॑तं नरा दुरि॒ताद॒भीके॑
verses.transliteration: utá tyā́ me hávam ā́ jagmyātaṃ  nā́satyā dhībhír yuvám aṅgá viprā  átriṃ ná mahás támaso 'mumuktaṃ  tū́rvataṃ narā duritā́d abhī́ke

translation.text: Come also to my call, O ye Nâsatyas, yea, verily, through my prayers, ye Holy Sages. As from great darkness ye delivered Atri, protect us, Chiefs, from danger in the conflict.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते नो॑ रा॒यो द्यु॒मतो॒ वाज॑वतो दा॒तारो॑ भूत नृ॒वतः॑ पुरु॒क्षोः द॒श॒स्यन्तो॑ दि॒व्याः पार्थि॑वासो॒ गोजा॑ता॒ अप्या॑ मृ॒ळता॑ च देवाः
verses.transliteration: té no rāyó dyumáto vā́javato  dātā́ro bhūta nr̥vátaḥ purukṣóḥ  daśasyánto divyā́ḥ pā́rthivāso  gójātā ápyā mr̥ḷátā ca devāḥ

translation.text: O Gods, bestow upon us riches, splendid with strength and heroes, bringing food in plenty. Be gracious, helpful Gods of earth, of heaven, born of the Cow, and dwellers in the waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते नो॑ रु॒द्रः सर॑स्वती स॒जोषा॑ मी॒ळ्हुष्म॑न्तो॒ विष्णु॑र्मृळन्तु वा॒युः ऋ॒भु॒क्षा वाजो॒ दैव्यो॑ विधा॒ता प॒र्जन्या॒वाता॑ पिप्यता॒मिषं॑ नः
verses.transliteration: té no rudráḥ sárasvatī sajóṣāḥ-  mīḷhúṣmanto víṣṇur mr̥ḷantu vāyúḥ  r̥bhukṣā́ vā́jo daívyo vidhātā́  parjányāvā́tā pipyatām íṣaṃ naḥ

translation.text: May Rudra and Sarasvatî, accordant, Vishṇu and Vâyu, pour down gifts and bless us; R̥ibhukshan, Vâja, and divine Vidhâtar, Parjanya, Vâta make our food abundant.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त स्य दे॒वः स॑वि॒ता भगो॑ नो॒ऽपां नपा॑दवतु॒ दानु॒ पप्रिः॑ त्वष्टा॑ दे॒वेभि॒र्जनि॑भिः स॒जोषा॒ द्यौर्दे॒वेभिः॑ पृथि॒वी स॑मु॒द्रैः
verses.transliteration: utá syá deváḥ savitā́ bhágo no  -apā́ṃ nápād avatu dā́nu pápriḥ  tváṣṭā devébhir jánibhiḥ sajóṣāḥ-  dyaúr devébhiḥ pr̥thivī́ samudraíḥ

translation.text: May this God Savitar, the Lord, the Offspring of Waters, pouring down his dew be gracious, And, with the Gods and Dames accordant, Tvashṭar; Dyaus with the Gods and Pr̥ithivî with oceans.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त नोऽहि॑र्बु॒ध्न्यः॑ शृणोत्व॒ज एक॑पात्पृथि॒वी स॑मु॒द्रः विश्वे॑ दे॒वा ऋ॑ता॒वृधो॑ हुवा॒नाः स्तु॒ता मन्त्राः॑ कविश॒स्ता अ॑वन्तु
verses.transliteration: utá nó 'hir budhnyàḥ śr̥ṇotu-  ajá ékapāt pr̥thivī́ samudráḥ  víśve devā́ r̥tāvŕ̥dho huvānā́ḥ-  stutā́ mántrāḥ kaviśastā́ avantu

translation.text: May Aja-Ekapad and Ahibudhnya, and Earth and Ocean hear our invocation; All Gods who strengthen Law, invoked and lauded, and holy texts uttered by sages, help us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा नपा॑तो॒ मम॒ तस्य॑ धी॒भिर्भ॒रद्वा॑जा अ॒भ्य॑र्चन्त्य॒र्कैः ग्ना हु॒तासो॒ वस॒वोऽधृ॑ष्टा॒ विश्वे॑ स्तु॒तासो॑ भूता यजत्राः
verses.transliteration: evā́ nápāto máma tásya dhībhír  bharádvājā abhy àrcanty arkaíḥ  gnā́ hutā́so vásavó 'dhr̥ṣṭāḥ-  víśve stutā́so bhūtā yajatrāḥ

translation.text: So with my thoughts and hymns of praise the children of Bharadvâja sing aloud to please you. The Dames invoked, and the resistless Vasus, and all ye Holy Ones have been exalted.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उदु॒ त्यच्चक्षु॒र्महि॑ मि॒त्रयो॒राँ एति॑ प्रि॒यं वरु॑णयो॒रद॑ब्धम् ऋ॒तस्य॒ शुचि॑ दर्श॒तमनी॑कं रु॒क्मो न दि॒व उदि॑ता॒ व्य॑द्यौत्
verses.transliteration: úd u tyác cákṣur máhi mitráyor ā́m̐  éti priyáṃ váruṇayor ádabdham  r̥tásya śúci darśatám ánīkaṃ  rukmó ná divá úditā vy àdyaut

translation.text: THAT mighty eye of Varuṇa and Mitra, infallible and dear, is moving upward. The pure and lovely face of holy Order hath shone like gold of heaven in its arising.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वेद॒ यस्त्रीणि॑ वि॒दथा॑न्येषां दे॒वानां॒ जन्म॑ सनु॒तरा च॒ विप्रः॑ ऋ॒जु मर्ते॑षु वृजि॒ना च॒ पश्य॑न्न॒भि च॑ष्टे॒ सूरो॑ अ॒र्य एवा॑न्
verses.transliteration: véda yás trī́ṇi vidáthāny eṣāṃ  devā́nāṃ jánma sanutár ā́ ca vípraḥ  r̥jú márteṣu vr̥jinā́ ca páśyan  abhí caṣṭe sū́ro aryá évān

translation.text: The Sage who knows these Gods' three ranks and orders, and all their generations near and distant, Beholding good and evil acts of mortals, Sura marks well the doing of the pious.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्तु॒ष उ॑ वो म॒ह ऋ॒तस्य॑ गो॒पानदि॑तिं मि॒त्रं वरु॑णं सुजा॒तान् अ॒र्य॒मणं॒ भग॒मद॑ब्धधीती॒नच्छा॑ वोचे सध॒न्यः॑ पाव॒कान्
verses.transliteration: stuṣá u vo mahá r̥tásya gopā́n  áditim mitráṃ váruṇaṃ sujātā́n  aryamáṇam bhágam ádabdhadhītīn  áchā voce sadhanyàḥ pāvakā́n

translation.text: I praise you Guards of mighty Law eternal, Aditi, Mitra, Varuṇa, the noble, Aryaman, Bhaga, all whose thoughts are faithful: hither I call the Bright who share in common.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रि॒शाद॑सः॒ सत्प॑तीँ॒रद॑ब्धान्म॒हो राज्ञः॑ सुवस॒नस्य॑ दा॒तॄन् यूनः॑ सुक्ष॒त्रान्क्षय॑तो दि॒वो नॄना॑दि॒त्यान्या॒म्यदि॑तिं दुवो॒यु
verses.transliteration: riśā́dasaḥ sátpatīm̐r ádabdhān  mahó rā́jñaḥ suvasanásya dātr̥̄́n  yū́naḥ sukṣatrā́n kṣáyato divó nr̥̄́n  ādityā́n yāmy áditiṃ duvoyú

translation.text: Lords of the brave, infallible, foe-destroyers, great Kings, bestowers of fair homes to dwell in, Young, Heroes, ruling heaven with strong dominion, Âdityas, Aditi I seek with worship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्यौ॒३॒॑ष्पितः॒ पृथि॑वि॒ मात॒रध्रु॒गग्ने॑ भ्रातर्वसवो मृ॒ळता॑ नः विश्व॑ आदित्या अदिते स॒जोषा॑ अ॒स्मभ्यं॒ शर्म॑ बहु॒लं वि य॑न्त
verses.transliteration: dyaùṣ pítaḥ pŕ̥thivi mā́tar ádhrug  ágne bhrātar vasavo mr̥ḷátā naḥ  víśva ādityā adite sajóṣāḥ-  asmábhyaṃ śárma bahuláṃ ví yanta

translation.text: O Heaven our Father, Earth our guileless Mother, O Brother Agni, and ye Vasus, bless us. Grant us, O Aditi and ye Âdityas, all of one mind, your manifold protection.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा नो॒ वृका॑य वृ॒क्ये॑ समस्मा अघाय॒ते री॑रधता यजत्राः यू॒यं हि ष्ठा र॒थ्यो॑ नस्त॒नूनां॑ यू॒यं दक्ष॑स्य॒ वच॑सो बभू॒व
verses.transliteration: mā́ no vŕ̥kāya vr̥kyè samasmai-  aghāyaté rīradhatā yajatrāḥ  yūyáṃ hí ṣṭhā́ rathyò nas tanū́nāṃ  yūyáṃ dákṣasya vácaso babhūvá

translation.text: Give us not up to any evil creature, as spoil to wolf or she-wolf, O ye Holy. For ye are they who guide aright our bodies, ye are the rulers of our speech and vigour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा व॒ एनो॑ अ॒न्यकृ॑तं भुजेम॒ मा तत्क॑र्म वसवो॒ यच्चय॑ध्वे विश्व॑स्य॒ हि क्षय॑थ विश्वदेवाः स्व॒यं रि॒पुस्त॒न्वं॑ रीरिषीष्ट
verses.transliteration: mā́ va éno anyákr̥tam bhujema  mā́ tát karma vasavo yác cáyadhve  víśvasya hí kṣáyatha viśvadevāḥ  svayáṃ ripús tanvàṃ rīriṣīṣṭa

translation.text: Let us not suffer for the sin of others, nor do the deed which ye, O Vasus, punish. Ye, Universal Gods! are all-controllers: may he do harm unto himself who hates Me.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नम॒ इदु॒ग्रं नम॒ आ वि॑वासे॒ नमो॑ दाधार पृथि॒वीमु॒त द्याम् नमो॑ दे॒वेभ्यो॒ नम॑ ईश एषां कृ॒तं चि॒देनो॒ नम॒सा वि॑वासे
verses.transliteration: náma íd ugráṃ náma ā́ vivāse  námo dādhāra pr̥thivī́m utá dyā́m  námo devébhyo náma īśa eṣāṃ  kr̥táṃ cid éno námasā́ vivāse

translation.text: Mighty is homage: I adopt and use it. Homage hath held in place the earth and heaven. Homage to Gods! Homage commands and rules them. I banish even committed sin by homage

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒तस्य॑ वो र॒थ्यः॑ पू॒तद॑क्षानृ॒तस्य॑ पस्त्य॒सदो॒ अद॑ब्धान् ताँ आ नमो॑भिरुरु॒चक्ष॑सो॒ नॄन्विश्वा॑न्व॒ आ न॑मे म॒हो य॑जत्राः
verses.transliteration: r̥tásya vo rathyàḥ pūtádakṣān  r̥tásya pastyasádo ádabdhān  tā́m̐ ā́ námobhir urucákṣaso nr̥̄́n  víśvān va ā́ name mahó yajatrāḥ

translation.text: You Furtherers of Law, pure in your spirit, infallible, dwellers in the home of Order, To you all Heroes mighty and far-seeing I bow me down, O Holy Ones, with homage.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते हि श्रेष्ठ॑वर्चस॒स्त उ॑ नस्ति॒रो विश्वा॑नि दुरि॒ता नय॑न्ति सु॒क्ष॒त्रासो॒ वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॒ग्निर्ऋ॒तधी॑तयो वक्म॒राज॑सत्याः
verses.transliteration: té hí śréṣṭhavarcasas tá u nas  tiró víśvāni duritā́ náyanti  sukṣatrā́so váruṇo mitró agníḥ  r̥tádhītayo vakmarā́jasatyāḥ

translation.text: For these are they who shine with noblest splendour; through all our troubles these conduct us safely- Varuṇa, Mitra, Agni, mighty Rulers, trueminded, faithful to the hymn's controllers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते न॒ इन्द्रः॑ पृथि॒वी क्षाम॑ वर्धन्पू॒षा भगो॒ अदि॑तिः॒ पञ्च॒ जनाः॑ सु॒शर्मा॑णः॒ स्वव॑सः सुनी॒था भव॑न्तु नः सुत्रा॒त्रासः॑ सुगो॒पाः
verses.transliteration: té na índraḥ pr̥thivī́ kṣā́ma vardhan  pūṣā́ bhágo áditiḥ páñca jánāḥ  suśármāṇaḥ svávasaḥ sunīthā́ḥ-  bhávantu naḥ sutrātrā́saḥ sugopā́ḥ

translation.text: May they, Earth, Aditi, Indra, Bhaga, Pûshan increase our laud, increase the Fivefold people. Giving good help, good refuge, goodly guidance, be they our good deliverers, good protectors.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू स॒द्मानं॑ दि॒व्यं नंशि॑ देवा॒ भार॑द्वाजः सुम॒तिं या॑ति॒ होता॑ आ॒सा॒नेभि॒र्यज॑मानो मि॒येधै॑र्दे॒वानां॒ जन्म॑ वसू॒युर्व॑वन्द
verses.transliteration: nū́ sadmā́naṃ divyáṃ náṃśi devāḥ-  bhā́radvājaḥ sumatíṃ yāti hótā  āsānébhir yájamāno miyédhair  devā́nāṃ jánma vasūyúr vavanda

translation.text: Come now, O Gods, to your celestial station: the Bharadvâjas' priest entreats your favour. He, sacrificing, fain for wealth, hath honoured the Gods vath those who sit and share oblations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अप॒ त्यं वृ॑जि॒नं रि॒पुं स्ते॒नम॑ग्ने दुरा॒ध्य॑म् द॒वि॒ष्ठम॑स्य सत्पते कृ॒धी सु॒गम्
verses.transliteration: ápa tyáṃ vr̥jináṃ ripúṃ  stenám agne durādhyàm  daviṣṭhám asya satpate  kr̥dhī́ sugám

translation.text: Agni, drive thou the wicked foe, the evil-hearted thief away, Far, far, Lord of the brave I and give us easy paths.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ग्रावा॑णः सोम नो॒ हि कं॑ सखित्व॒नाय॑ वाव॒शुः ज॒ही न्य१॒॑त्रिणं॑ प॒णिं वृको॒ हि षः
verses.transliteration: grā́vāṇaḥ soma no hí kaṃ  sakhitvanā́ya vāvaśúḥ  jahī́ ny àtríṇam paṇíṃ  vŕ̥ko hí ṣáḥ

translation.text: Soma, these pressing-stones have called aloud to win thee for our Friend. Destroy the greedy Paṇi, for a wolf is he.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यू॒यं हि ष्ठा सु॑दानव॒ इन्द्र॑ज्येष्ठा अ॒भिद्य॑वः कर्ता॑ नो॒ अध्व॒न्ना सु॒गं गो॒पा अ॒मा
verses.transliteration: yūyáṃ hí ṣṭhā́ sudānavaḥ  índrajyeṣṭhā abhídyavaḥ  kártā no ádhvann ā́ sugáṃ  gopā́ amā́

translation.text: Ye, O most bountiful, are they who, led by Indra, seek the sky. Give us good paths for travel: guard us ivell at home.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अपि॒ पन्था॑मगन्महि स्वस्ति॒गाम॑ने॒हस॑म् येन॒ विश्वाः॒ परि॒ द्विषो॑ वृ॒णक्ति॑ वि॒न्दते॒ वसु॑
verses.transliteration: ápi pánthām aganmahi  svastigā́m anehásam  yéna víśvāḥ pári dvíṣo  vr̥ṇákti vindáte vásu

translation.text: Now have we entered on the road that leads to bliss, without a foe, The road whereon a man escapes all enemies and gathers wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न तद्दि॒वा न पृ॑थि॒व्यानु॑ मन्ये॒ न य॒ज्ञेन॒ नोत शमी॑भिरा॒भिः उ॒ब्जन्तु॒ तं सु॒भ्व१॒॑ः पर्व॑तासो॒ नि ही॑यतामतिया॒जस्य॑ य॒ष्टा
verses.transliteration: ná tád divā́ ná pr̥thivyā́nu manye  ná yajñéna nótá śámībhir ābhíḥ  ubjántu táṃ subhvàḥ párvatāso  ní hīyatām atiyājásya yaṣṭā́

translation.text: THIS I allow not in the earth or heaven, at sacrifice or in these holy duties. May the huge mountains crush him down: degraded be Atiyaja's sacrificing patron.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अति॑ वा॒ यो म॑रुतो॒ मन्य॑ते नो॒ ब्रह्म॑ वा॒ यः क्रि॒यमा॑णं॒ निनि॑त्सात् तपूं॑षि॒ तस्मै॑ वृजि॒नानि॑ सन्तु ब्रह्म॒द्विष॑म॒भि तं शो॑चतु॒ द्यौः
verses.transliteration: áti vā yó maruto mányate no  bráhma vā yáḥ kriyámāṇaṃ nínitsāt  tápūṃṣi tásmai vr̥jinā́ni santu  brahmadvíṣam abhí táṃ śocatu dyaúḥ

translation.text: Or he who holds us in contempt, O Maruts, or seeks to blame the prayer that we are making, May agonies of burning be his portion. May the sky scorch the man who hates devotion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: किम॒ङ्ग त्वा॒ ब्रह्म॑णः सोम गो॒पां किम॒ङ्ग त्वा॑हुरभिशस्ति॒पां नः॑ किम॒ङ्ग नः॑ पश्यसि नि॒द्यमा॑नान्ब्रह्म॒द्विषे॒ तपु॑षिं हे॒तिम॑स्य
verses.transliteration: kím aṅgá tvā bráhmaṇaḥ soma gopā́ṃ  kím aṅgá tvāhur abhiśastipā́ṃ naḥ  kím aṅgá naḥ paśyasi nidyámānān  brahmadvíṣe tápuṣiṃ hetím asya

translation.text: Why then, O Soma, do they call thee keeper of prayer? Why then our guardian from reproaches? Why then beholdest thou how men revile us? Cast thy hot dart at him who hates devotion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अव॑न्तु॒ मामु॒षसो॒ जाय॑माना॒ अव॑न्तु मा॒ सिन्ध॑वः॒ पिन्व॑मानाः अव॑न्तु मा॒ पर्व॑तासो ध्रु॒वासोऽव॑न्तु मा पि॒तरो॑ दे॒वहू॑तौ
verses.transliteration: ávantu mā́m uṣáso jā́yamānāḥ-  ávantu mā síndhavaḥ pínvamānāḥ  ávantu mā párvatāso dhruvā́saḥ-  -ávantu mā pitáro deváhūtau

translation.text: May Mornings as they spring to life, protect me, and may the Rivers as they swell preserve me. My guardians be the firmly-seated mountains: the Fathers, when I call on Gods, defend me!

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒श्व॒दानीं॑ सु॒मन॑सः स्याम॒ पश्ये॑म॒ नु सूर्य॑मु॒च्चर॑न्तम् तथा॑ कर॒द्वसु॑पति॒र्वसू॑नां दे॒वाँ ओहा॒नोऽव॒साग॑मिष्ठः
verses.transliteration: viśvadā́nīṃ sumánasaḥ syāma  páśyema nú sū́ryam uccárantam  táthā karad vásupatir vásūnāṃ  devā́m̐ óhānó 'vasā́gamiṣṭhaḥ

translation.text: Through all our days may we be healthy. minded, and look upon the Sun when he arises. Grant this the Treasure-Lord of treasures, coming, observant, oftenest of Gods, with succour!

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रो॒ नेदि॑ष्ठ॒मव॒साग॑मिष्ठः॒ सर॑स्वती॒ सिन्धु॑भिः॒ पिन्व॑माना प॒र्जन्यो॑ न॒ ओष॑धीभिर्मयो॒भुर॒ग्निः सु॒शंसः॑ सु॒हवः॑ पि॒तेव॑
verses.transliteration: índro nédiṣṭham ávasā́gamiṣṭhaḥ  sárasvatī síndhubhiḥ pínvamānā  parjányo na óṣadhībhir mayobhúr  agníḥ suśáṃsaḥ suhávaḥ pitéva

translation.text: Most near, most oft comes Indra with protection, and she Sarasvatî, who swells with rivers – Parjanya, bringing health with herbs, and Agni, well lauded swift to listen, like a father.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वे॑ देवास॒ आ ग॑त शृणु॒ता म॑ इ॒मं हव॑म् एदं ब॒र्हिर्नि षी॑दत
verses.transliteration: víśve devāsa ā́ gata  śr̥ṇutā́ ma imáṃ hávam  édám barhír ní ṣīdata

translation.text: Hear this mine invocation; come hither, O Universal Gods, Be seated on this holy grass.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो वो॑ देवा घृ॒तस्नु॑ना ह॒व्येन॑ प्रति॒भूष॑ति तं विश्व॒ उप॑ गच्छथ
verses.transliteration: yó vo devā ghr̥tásnunā  havyéna pratibhū́ṣati  táṃ víśva úpa gachatha

translation.text: To him who comes to meet you, Gods, with offerings bathed in holy oil- Approach ye, one and all, to him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॑ नः सू॒नवो॒ गिरः॑ शृ॒ण्वन्त्व॒मृत॑स्य॒ ये सु॒मृ॒ळी॒का भ॑वन्तु नः
verses.transliteration: úpa naḥ sūnávo gíraḥ  śr̥ṇvántv amŕ̥tasya yé  sumr̥ḷīkā́ bhavantu naḥ

translation.text: All Sons of Immortality shall listen to the songs we sing, And be exceeding good to us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वे॑ दे॒वा ऋ॑ता॒वृध॑ ऋ॒तुभि॑र्हवन॒श्रुतः॑ जु॒षन्तां॒ युज्यं॒ पयः॑
verses.transliteration: víśve devā́ r̥tāvŕ̥dhaḥ-  r̥túbhir havanaśrútaḥ  juṣántāṃ yújyam páyaḥ

translation.text: May all the Gods who strengthen Law, with Rtus, listening to our call, Be pleased with theit appropriate draught.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्तो॒त्रमिन्द्रो॑ म॒रुद्ग॑ण॒स्त्वष्टृ॑मान्मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मा इ॒मा ह॒व्या जु॑षन्त नः
verses.transliteration: stotrám índro marúdgaṇas  tváṣṭr̥mān mitró aryamā́  imā́ havyā́ juṣanta naḥ

translation.text: May Indra, with the Marut host, with Tvashṭar, Mitra, Aryaman, Accept the laud and these our gifts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मं नो॑ अग्ने अध्व॒रं होत॑र्वयुन॒शो य॑ज चि॒कि॒त्वान्दैव्यं॒ जन॑म्
verses.transliteration: imáṃ no agne adhvaráṃ  hótar vayunaśó yaja  cikitvā́n daívyaṃ jánam

translation.text: O Agni, Priest, as rules ordain, offer this sacrifice of ours, Remembering the Heavenly Folk.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वे॑ देवाः शृणु॒तेमं हवं॑ मे॒ ये अ॒न्तरि॑क्षे॒ य उप॒ द्यवि॒ ष्ठ ये अ॑ग्निजि॒ह्वा उ॒त वा॒ यज॑त्रा आ॒सद्या॒स्मिन्ब॒र्हिषि॑ मादयध्वम्
verses.transliteration: víśve devāḥ śr̥ṇutémáṃ hávam me  yé antárikṣe yá úpa dyávi ṣṭhá  yé agnijihvā́ utá vā yájatrāḥ-  āsádyāsmín barhíṣi mādayadhvam

translation.text: Listen, All-Gods, to this mine invocation, Ye who inhabit heaven, and air's midregions, All ye, O Holy Ones, whose tongue is Agni, seated upon this sacred grass, be joyful.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वे॑ दे॒वा मम॑ शृण्वन्तु य॒ज्ञिया॑ उ॒भे रोद॑सी अ॒पां नपा॑च्च॒ मन्म॑ मा वो॒ वचां॑सि परि॒चक्ष्या॑णि वोचं सु॒म्नेष्विद्वो॒ अन्त॑मा मदेम
verses.transliteration: víśve devā́ máma śr̥ṇvantu yajñíyāḥ-  ubhé ródasī apā́ṃ nápāc ca mánma  mā́ vo vácāṃsi paricákṣyāṇi vocaṃ  sumnéṣv íd vo ántamā madema

translation.text: May the All-Gods who claim our worship hear my thought; may the two World-halves hear it, and the Waters' Child. Let me not utter words that ye may disregard. Closely allied with you may we rejoice in bliss.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये के च॒ ज्मा म॒हिनो॒ अहि॑माया दि॒वो ज॑ज्ञि॒रे अ॒पां स॒धस्थे॑ ते अ॒स्मभ्य॑मि॒षये॒ विश्व॒मायुः॒ क्षप॑ उ॒स्रा व॑रिवस्यन्तु दे॒वाः
verses.transliteration: yé ké ca jmā́ mahíno áhimāyāḥ-  divó jajñiré apā́ṃ sadhásthe  té asmábhyam iṣáye víśvam ā́yuḥ  kṣápa usrā́ varivasyantu devā́ḥ

translation.text: And those who, Mighty, with the wiles of serpents, were born on earth, in heaven, where waters gather- May they vouchsafe us life of full duration. May the Gods kindly give us nights and mornings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्नी॑पर्जन्या॒वव॑तं॒ धियं॑ मे॒ऽस्मिन्हवे॑ सुहवा सुष्टु॒तिं नः॑ इळा॑म॒न्यो ज॒नय॒द्गर्भ॑म॒न्यः प्र॒जाव॑ती॒रिष॒ आ ध॑त्तम॒स्मे
verses.transliteration: ágnīparjanyāv ávataṃ dhíyam me  -asmín háve suhavā suṣṭutíṃ naḥ  íḷām anyó janáyad gárbham anyáḥ  prajā́vatīr íṣa ā́ dhattam asmé

translation.text: At this my call, O Agni and Parjanya, help, swift to hear, my thought and our laudation. One generates holy food, the other offspring, so grant us food enough with store of children.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्ती॒र्णे ब॒र्हिषि॑ समिधा॒ने अ॒ग्नौ सू॒क्तेन॑ म॒हा नम॒सा वि॑वासे अ॒स्मिन्नो॑ अ॒द्य वि॒दथे॑ यजत्रा॒ विश्वे॑ देवा ह॒विषि॑ मादयध्वम्
verses.transliteration: stīrṇé barhíṣi samidhāné agnaú-  sūkténa mahā́ námasā́ vivāse  asmín no adyá vidáthe yajatrāḥ-  víśve devā havíṣi mādayadhvam

translation.text: When holy grass is strewn and fire enkindled, with hymn and lowly homage I invite you. All-Gods, to day in this our great assembly rejoice, ye Holy, in the gifts we offer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒यमु॑ त्वा पथस्पते॒ रथं॒ न वाज॑सातये धि॒ये पू॑षन्नयुज्महि
verses.transliteration: vayám u tvā pathas pate  ráthaṃ ná vā́jasātaye  dhiyé pūṣann ayujmahi

translation.text: LORD of the path, O Pûshan, we have yoked and bound thee to our hymn, Even as a car, to win the prize.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि नो॒ नर्यं॒ वसु॑ वी॒रं प्रय॑तदक्षिणम् वा॒मं गृ॒हप॑तिं नय
verses.transliteration: abhí no náryaṃ vásu  vīrám práyatadakṣiṇam  vāmáṃ gr̥hápatiṃ naya

translation.text: Bring us the wealth that men require, a manly master of a house, Free-handed with the liberal meed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अदि॑त्सन्तं चिदाघृणे॒ पूष॒न्दाना॑य चोदय प॒णेश्चि॒द्वि म्र॑दा॒ मनः॑
verses.transliteration: áditsantaṃ cid āghr̥ṇe  pū́ṣan dā́nāya codaya  paṇéś cid ví mradā mánaḥ

translation.text: Even him who would not give, do thou, O glowing Pûshan, urge to give, And make the niggard's soul grow soft.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि प॒थो वाज॑सातये चिनु॒हि वि मृधो॑ जहि साध॑न्तामुग्र नो॒ धियः॑
verses.transliteration: ví pathó vā́jasātaye  cinuhí ví mŕ̥dho jahi  sā́dhantām ugra no dhíyaḥ

translation.text: Clear paths that we may win the prize; scatter our enemies afar. Strong God, be all our thoughts fulfilled.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॑ तृन्धि पणी॒नामार॑या॒ हृद॑या कवे अथे॑म॒स्मभ्यं॑ रन्धय
verses.transliteration: pári tr̥ndhi paṇīnā́m  ā́rayā hŕ̥dayā kave  áthem asmábhyaṃ randhaya

translation.text: Penetrate with an awl, O Sage, the hearts of avaricious churls, And make them subject to our will.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि पू॑ष॒न्नार॑या तुद प॒णेरि॑च्छ हृ॒दि प्रि॒यम् अथे॑म॒स्मभ्यं॑ रन्धय
verses.transliteration: ví pūṣann ā́rayā tuda  paṇér icha hr̥dí priyám  áthem asmábhyaṃ randhaya

translation.text: Thrust with thine awl, O Pûshan: seek that which the niggard's heart holds dear, And make him subject to our will.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ रि॑ख किकि॒रा कृ॑णु पणी॒नां हृद॑या कवे अथे॑म॒स्मभ्यं॑ रन्धय
verses.transliteration: ā́ rikha kikirā́ kr̥ṇu  paṇīnā́ṃ hŕ̥dayā kave  áthem asmábhyaṃ randhaya

translation.text: Tear up and read in pieces, Sage, the hearts of avaricious churls, And make them subject to our will.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यां पू॑षन्ब्रह्म॒चोद॑नी॒मारां॒ बिभ॑र्ष्याघृणे तया॑ समस्य॒ हृद॑य॒मा रि॑ख किकि॒रा कृ॑णु
verses.transliteration: yā́m pūṣan brahmacódanīm  ā́rām bíbharṣy āghr̥ṇe  táyā samasya hŕ̥dayam  ā́ rikha kikirā́ kr̥ṇu

translation.text: Thou, glowing Pûshan, carriest an awl that urges men to prayer; Therewith do thou tear up and rend to shreds the heart of every one.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या ते॒ अष्ट्रा॒ गोओ॑प॒शाघृ॑णे पशु॒साध॑नी तस्या॑स्ते सु॒म्नमी॑महे
verses.transliteration: yā́ te áṣṭrā góopaśā-  -ā́ghr̥ṇe paśusā́dhanī  tásyās te sumnám īmahe

translation.text: Thou bearest, glowing Lord! a goad with horny point that guides the cows Thence do we seek thy gift of bliss.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त नो॑ गो॒षणिं॒ धिय॑मश्व॒सां वा॑ज॒सामु॒त नृ॒वत्कृ॑णुहि वी॒तये॑
verses.transliteration: utá no goṣáṇiṃ dhíyam  aśvasā́ṃ vājasā́m utá  nr̥vát kr̥ṇuhi vītáye

translation.text: And make this hymn of ours produce kine, horses, and a store of wealth For our delight and use as men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं पू॑षन्वि॒दुषा॑ नय॒ यो अञ्ज॑सानु॒शास॑ति य ए॒वेदमिति॒ ब्रव॑त्
verses.transliteration: sám pūṣan vidúṣā naya  yó áñjasānuśā́sati  yá evédám íti brávat

translation.text: O Pûshan, bring us to the man who knows, who shall direct us straight, And say unto us, It is here.

verses.sanskrit_deva: समु॑ पू॒ष्णा ग॑मेमहि॒ यो गृ॒हाँ अ॑भि॒शास॑ति इ॒म ए॒वेति॑ च॒ ब्रव॑त्
verses.transliteration: sám u pūṣṇā́ gamemahi  yó gr̥hā́m̐ abhiśā́sati  imá evéti ca brávat

translation.text: May we go forth with Pûshan who shall point the houses out to us, And say to us, These same are they.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पू॒ष्णश्च॒क्रं न रि॑ष्यति॒ न कोशोऽव॑ पद्यते नो अ॑स्य व्यथते प॒विः
verses.transliteration: pūṣṇáś cakráṃ ná riṣyati  ná kóśó 'va padyate  nó asya vyathate pavíḥ

translation.text: Unharmed is Pûshan's chariot wheel; the box ne'er falleth to the ground, Nor doth the loosened felIy shake.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो अ॑स्मै ह॒विषावि॑ध॒न्न तं पू॒षापि॑ मृष्यते प्र॒थ॒मो वि॑न्दते॒ वसु॑
verses.transliteration: yó asmai havíṣā́vidhat-  ná tám pūṣā́pi mr̥ṣyate  prathamó vindate vásu

translation.text: Pûshan forgetteth not the man who serveth him with offered gift: That man is first to gather wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पू॒षा गा अन्वे॑तु नः पू॒षा र॑क्ष॒त्वर्व॑तः पू॒षा वाजं॑ सनोतु नः
verses.transliteration: pūṣā́ gā́ ánv etu naḥ  pūṣā́ rakṣatv árvataḥ  pūṣā́ vā́jaṃ sanotu naḥ

translation.text: May Pûshan follow near our kine; may Pûshan keep our horses safe: May Pûshan gather gear for us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पूष॒न्ननु॒ प्र गा इ॑हि॒ यज॑मानस्य सुन्व॒तः अ॒स्माकं॑ स्तुव॒तामु॒त
verses.transliteration: pū́ṣann ánu prá gā́ ihi  yájamānasya sunvatáḥ  asmā́kaṃ stuvatā́m utá

translation.text: Follow the kine of him who pours libations out and worships thee; And ours who sing thee songs of praise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: माकि॑र्नेश॒न्माकीं॑ रिष॒न्माकीं॒ सं शा॑रि॒ केव॑टे अथारि॑ष्टाभि॒रा ग॑हि
verses.transliteration: mā́kir neśan mā́kīṃ riṣat-  mā́kīṃ sáṃ śāri kévaṭe  áthā́riṣṭābhir ā́ gahi

translation.text: Let none be lost, none injured, none sink in a pit and break a limb. Return with these all safe and sound.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शृ॒ण्वन्तं॑ पू॒षणं॑ व॒यमिर्य॒मन॑ष्टवेदसम् ईशा॑नं रा॒य ई॑महे
verses.transliteration: śr̥ṇvántam pūṣáṇaṃ vayám  íryam ánaṣṭavedasam  ī́śānaṃ rāyá īmahe

translation.text: Pûshan who listens to our prayers, the Strong whose wealth is never lost, The Lord of riches, we implore.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पूष॒न्तव॑ व्र॒ते व॒यं न रि॑ष्येम॒ कदा॑ च॒न स्तो॒तार॑स्त इ॒ह स्म॑सि
verses.transliteration: pū́ṣan táva vraté vayáṃ  ná riṣyema kádā caná  stotā́ras ta ihá smasi

translation.text: Secure in thy protecting care, O Pûshan, never may we fail. We here are they who sing thy praise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॑ पू॒षा प॒रस्ता॒द्धस्तं॑ दधातु॒ दक्षि॑णम् पुन॑र्नो न॒ष्टमाज॑तु
verses.transliteration: pári pūṣā́ parástād  -hástaṃ dadhātu dákṣiṇam  púnar no naṣṭám ā́jatu

translation.text: From out the distance, far and wide, may Pûshan stretch his right hand forth, And drive our lost again to us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: एहि॒ वां वि॑मुचो नपा॒दाघृ॑णे॒ सं स॑चावहै र॒थीर्ऋ॒तस्य॑ नो भव
verses.transliteration: éhi vā́ṃ vimuco napād  ā́ghr̥ṇe sáṃ sacāvahai  rathī́r r̥tásya no bhava

translation.text: SON of Deliverance, come, bright God! Let us twain go together: be our charioteer of sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: र॒थीत॑मं कप॒र्दिन॒मीशा॑नं॒ राध॑सो म॒हः रा॒यः सखा॑यमीमहे
verses.transliteration: rathī́tamaṃ kapardínam  ī́śānaṃ rā́dhaso maháḥ  rāyáḥ sákhāyam īmahe

translation.text: We pray for wealth to thee most skilled of charioteers, with braided hair, Lord of great riches, and our Friend.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रा॒यो धारा॑स्याघृणे॒ वसो॑ रा॒शिर॑जाश्व धीव॑तोधीवतः॒ सखा॑
verses.transliteration: rāyó dhā́rāsy āghr̥ṇe  váso rāśír ajāśva  dhī́vato-dhīvataḥ sákhā

translation.text: Bright God whose steeds are goats, thou art a stream of wealth, a treasure-heap, The Friend of every pious man.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पू॒षणं॒ न्व१॒॑जाश्व॒मुप॑ स्तोषाम वा॒जिन॑म् स्वसु॒र्यो जा॒र उ॒च्यते॑
verses.transliteration: pūṣáṇaṃ nv àjā́śvam  úpa stoṣāma vājínam  svásur yó jārá ucyáte

translation.text: Pûshan, who driveth goats for steeds, the strong and Mighty, who is called His Sister's lover, will we laud.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा॒तुर्दि॑धि॒षुम॑ब्रवं॒ स्वसु॑र्जा॒रः शृ॑णोतु नः भ्रातेन्द्र॑स्य॒ सखा॒ मम॑
verses.transliteration: mātúr didhiṣúm abravaṃ  svásur jāráḥ śr̥ṇotu naḥ  bhrā́téndrasya sákhā máma

translation.text: His Mother's suitor I address. May he who loves his Sister hear, Brother of Indra, and my Friend.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आजासः॑ पू॒षणं॒ रथे॑ निशृ॒म्भास्ते ज॑न॒श्रिय॑म् दे॒वं व॑हन्तु॒ बिभ्र॑तः
verses.transliteration: ā́jā́saḥ pūṣáṇaṃ ráthe  niśr̥mbhā́s té janaśríyam  deváṃ vahantu bíbhrataḥ

translation.text: May the sure-footed goats come nigh, conveying Pûshan on his car, The God who visiteth mankind.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य ए॑नमा॒दिदे॑शति कर॒म्भादिति॑ पू॒षण॑म् न तेन॑ दे॒व आ॒दिशे॑
verses.transliteration: yá enam ādídeśati  karambhā́d íti pūṣáṇam  ná téna devá ādíśe

translation.text: WHOSO remembers Pûshan as cater of mingled curd and meal Need think no more upon the God.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त घा॒ स र॒थीत॑मः॒ सख्या॒ सत्प॑तिर्यु॒जा इन्द्रो॑ वृ॒त्राणि॑ जिघ्नते
verses.transliteration: utá ghā sá rathī́tamaḥ  sákhyā sátpatir yujā́  índro vr̥trā́ṇi jighnate

translation.text: And he is best of charioteers. Indra, the hero's Lord, allied With him as Friend, destroys the foes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒तादः प॑रु॒षे गवि॒ सूर॑श्च॒क्रं हि॑र॒ण्यय॑म् न्यै॑रयद्र॒थीत॑मः
verses.transliteration: utā́dáḥ paruṣé gávi  sū́raś cakráṃ hiraṇyáyam  ny aìrayad rathī́tamaḥ

translation.text: And there the best of charioteers hath guided through the speckled cloud The golden wheel of Sura's car.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद॒द्य त्वा॑ पुरुष्टुत॒ ब्रवा॑म दस्र मन्तुमः तत्सु नो॒ मन्म॑ साधय
verses.transliteration: yád adyá tvā puruṣṭuta  brávāma dasra mantumaḥ  tát sú no mánma sādhaya

translation.text: Whate'er we speak this day to thee, Wise, Wondrous God whom many praise, Give thou fulfilment of our thought.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मं च॑ नो ग॒वेष॑णं सा॒तये॑ सीषधो ग॒णम् आ॒रात्पू॑षन्नसि श्रु॒तः
verses.transliteration: imáṃ ca no gavéṣaṇaṃ  sātáye sīṣadho gaṇám  ārā́t pūṣann asi śrutáḥ

translation.text: Lead on this company of ours, that longs for kine, to win the spoil: Thou, Pûshan, art renowned afar.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ ते॑ स्व॒स्तिमी॑मह आ॒रेअ॑घा॒मुपा॑वसुम् अ॒द्या च॑ स॒र्वता॑तये॒ श्वश्च॑ स॒र्वता॑तये
verses.transliteration: ā́ te svastím īmahe-  āréaghām úpāvasum  adyā́ ca sarvátātaye  śváś ca sarvátātaye

translation.text: Prosperity we crave from thee, afar from sin and near to wealth, Tending to perfect happiness both for to. morrow and to-day.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॒ नु पू॒षणा॑ व॒यं स॒ख्याय॑ स्व॒स्तये॑ हु॒वेम॒ वाज॑सातये
verses.transliteration: índrā nú pūṣáṇā vayáṃ  sakhyā́ya svastáye  huvéma vā́jasātaye

translation.text: INDRA and Pûshan will we call for friend ship and prosperity And for the winning of the spoil.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोम॑म॒न्य उपा॑सद॒त्पात॑वे च॒म्वोः॑ सु॒तम् क॒र॒म्भम॒न्य इ॑च्छति
verses.transliteration: sómam anyá úpāsadat  pā́tave camvòḥ sutám  karambhám anyá ichati

translation.text: One by the Soma sits to drink juice which the mortar hath expressed: The other longs for curd and meal.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒जा अ॒न्यस्य॒ वह्न॑यो॒ हरी॑ अ॒न्यस्य॒ सम्भृ॑ता ताभ्यां॑ वृ॒त्राणि॑ जिघ्नते
verses.transliteration: ajā́ anyásya váhnayo  hárī anyásya sámbhr̥tā  tā́bhyāṃ vr̥trā́ṇi jighnate

translation.text: Goats are the team that draws the one: the other hath Bay Steeds at hand; With both of these he slays the fiends.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदिन्द्रो॒ अन॑य॒द्रितो॑ म॒हीर॒पो वृष॑न्तमः तत्र॑ पू॒षाभ॑व॒त्सचा॑
verses.transliteration: yád índro ánayad ríto  mahī́r apó vŕ̥ṣantamaḥ  tátra pūṣā́bhavat sácā

translation.text: When Indra, wondrous strong, brought down the streams, the mighty waterfloods, Pûshan was standing by his side.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तां पू॒ष्णः सु॑म॒तिं व॒यं वृ॒क्षस्य॒ प्र व॒यामि॑व इन्द्र॑स्य॒ चा र॑भामहे
verses.transliteration: tā́m pūṣṇáḥ sumatíṃ vayáṃ  vr̥kṣásya prá vayā́m iva  índrasya cā́ rabhāmahe

translation.text: To this, to Pûshan's favouring love, and Indra's, may we closely cling, As to a tree's extended bough.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उत्पू॒षणं॑ युवामहे॒ऽभीशूँ॑रिव॒ सार॑थिः म॒ह्या इन्द्रं॑ स्व॒स्तये॑
verses.transliteration: út pūṣáṇaṃ yuvāmahe  -abhī́śūm̐r iva sā́rathiḥ  mahyā́ índraṃ svastáye

translation.text: As one who drives a car draws in his reins, may we draw Pûshan near, And Indra, for our great success.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शु॒क्रं ते॑ अ॒न्यद्य॑ज॒तं ते॑ अ॒न्यद्विषु॑रूपे॒ अह॑नी॒ द्यौरि॑वासि विश्वा॒ हि मा॒या अव॑सि स्वधावो भ॒द्रा ते॑ पूषन्नि॒ह रा॒तिर॑स्तु
verses.transliteration: śukráṃ te anyád yajatáṃ te anyád  víṣurūpe áhanī dyaúr ivāsi  víśvā hí māyā́ ávasi svadhāvo  bhadrā́ te pūṣann ihá rātír astu

translation.text: LIKE heaven art thou: one form is bright, one holy, like Day and Night dissimilar in colour. All magic powers thou aidest, self-depen. dent! Auspicious be thy bounty here, O Pûshan.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒जाश्वः॑ पशु॒पा वाज॑पस्त्यो धियंजि॒न्वो भुव॑ने॒ विश्वे॒ अर्पि॑तः अष्ट्रां॑ पू॒षा शि॑थि॒रामु॒द्वरी॑वृजत्सं॒चक्षा॑णो॒ भुव॑ना दे॒व ई॑यते
verses.transliteration: ajā́śvaḥ paśupā́ vā́japastyo  dhiyaṃjinvó bhúvane víśve árpitaḥ  áṣṭrām pūṣā́ śithirā́m udvárīvr̥jat  saṃcákṣāṇo bhúvanā devá īyate

translation.text: Goat-borne, the guard of cattle, he whose home is strength, inspirer of the hymn, set over all the world; Brandishing here and there his lightly. moving goad, beholding every creature, Pûshan, God, goes forth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यास्ते॑ पूष॒न्नावो॑ अ॒न्तः स॑मु॒द्रे हि॑र॒ण्ययी॑र॒न्तरि॑क्षे॒ चर॑न्ति ताभि॑र्यासि दू॒त्यां सूर्य॑स्य॒ कामे॑न कृत॒ श्रव॑ इ॒च्छमा॑नः
verses.transliteration: yā́s te pūṣan nā́vo antáḥ samudré  hiraṇyáyīr antárikṣe cáranti  tā́bhir yāsi dūtyā́ṃ sū́ryasya  kā́mena kr̥ta śráva ichámānaḥ

translation.text: O Pûshan, with thy golden ships that travel across the ocean, in the air's mid-region, Thou goest on an embassy to Sûrya, subdued by love, desirous of the glory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पू॒षा सु॒बन्धु॑र्दि॒व आ पृ॑थि॒व्या इ॒ळस्पति॑र्म॒घवा॑ द॒स्मव॑र्चाः यं दे॒वासो॒ अद॑दुः सू॒र्यायै॒ कामे॑न कृ॒तं त॒वसं॒ स्वञ्च॑म्
verses.transliteration: pūṣā́ subándhur divá ā́ pr̥thivyā́ḥ-  iḷás pátir maghávā dasmávarcāḥ  yáṃa devā́so ádaduḥ sūryā́yai  kā́mena kr̥táṃ tavásaṃ sváñcam

translation.text: Near kinsman of the heaven and earth is Pûshan, liberal, Lord of food, of wondrous lustre, Whom strong and vigorous and swiftlymoving, subdued by love, the Deities gave to Sûryâ.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र नु वो॑चा सु॒तेषु॑ वां वी॒र्या॒३॒॑ यानि॑ च॒क्रथुः॑ ह॒तासो॑ वां पि॒तरो॑ दे॒वश॑त्रव॒ इन्द्रा॑ग्नी॒ जीव॑थो यु॒वम्
verses.transliteration: prá nú vocā sutéṣu vāṃ  vīryā̀ yā́ni cakráthuḥ  hatā́so vām pitáro deváśatravaḥ-  índrāgnī jī́vatho yuvám

translation.text: I WILL declare, while juices flow, the manly deeds that ye have done: Your Fathers, enemies of Gods, were smitten down, and, Indra-Agni, ye survive.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बळि॒त्था म॑हि॒मा वा॒मिन्द्रा॑ग्नी॒ पनि॑ष्ठ॒ आ स॒मा॒नो वां॑ जनि॒ता भ्रात॑रा यु॒वं य॒मावि॒हेह॑मातरा
verses.transliteration: báḷ itthā́ mahimā́ vām  índrāgnī pániṣṭha ā́  samānó vāṃ janitā́ bhrā́tarā yuváṃ  yamā́v ihéhamātarā

translation.text: Thus, Indra-Agnip verily your greatness merits loftiest praise, Sprung from one common Father, brothers, twins are ye; your Mother is in every place.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ओ॒कि॒वांसा॑ सु॒ते सचाँ॒ अश्वा॒ सप्ती॑ इ॒वाद॑ने इन्द्रा॒ न्व१॒॑ग्नी अव॑से॒ह व॒ज्रिणा॑ व॒यं दे॒वा ह॑वामहे
verses.transliteration: okivā́ṃsā suté sácām̐  áśvā sáptī ivā́dane  índrā nv àgnī́ ávasehá vajríṇā  vayáṃ devā́ havāmahe

translation.text: These who delight in flowing juice, like fellow horses at their food, Indra and Agni, Gods armed with the thunderbolt, we call this day to come with help.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य इ॑न्द्राग्नी सु॒तेषु॑ वां॒ स्तव॒त्तेष्वृ॑तावृधा जो॒ष॒वा॒कं वद॑तः पज्रहोषिणा॒ न दे॑वा भ॒सथ॑श्च॒न
verses.transliteration: yá indrāgnī sutéṣu vāṃ  stávat téṣv r̥tāvr̥dhā  joṣavākáṃ vádataḥ pajrahoṣiṇā  ná devā bhasáthaś caná

translation.text: Indra and Agni, Friends of Law, served with rich gifts, your speech is kind To him who praises you while these libations flow: that man, O Gods, ye ne'er consume.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑ग्नी॒ को अ॒स्य वां॒ देवौ॒ मर्त॑श्चिकेतति विषू॑चो॒ अश्वा॑न्युयुजा॒न ई॑यत॒ एकः॑ समा॒न आ रथे॑
verses.transliteration: índrāgnī kó asyá vāṃ  dévau mártaś ciketati  víṣūco áśvān yuyujāná īyate-  ékaḥ samāná ā́ ráthe

translation.text: What mortal understands, O Gods, Indra and Agni, this your way? One of you, yoking Steeds that move to every side, advances in your common car.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑ग्नी अ॒पादि॒यं पूर्वागा॑त्प॒द्वती॑भ्यः हि॒त्वी शिरो॑ जि॒ह्वया॒ वाव॑द॒च्चर॑त्त्रिं॒शत्प॒दा न्य॑क्रमीत्
verses.transliteration: índrāgnī apā́d iyám  pū́rvā́gāt padvátībhyaḥ  hitvī́ śíro jihváyā vā́vadac cárat  triṃśát padā́ ny àkramīt

translation.text: First, Indra-Agni, hath this Maid come footless unto those with feet. Stretching her head and speaking loudly with her tongue, she hath gone downward thirty steps.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑ग्नी॒ आ हि त॑न्व॒ते नरो॒ धन्वा॑नि बा॒ह्वोः मा नो॑ अ॒स्मिन्म॑हाध॒ने परा॑ वर्क्तं॒ गवि॑ष्टिषु
verses.transliteration: índrāgnī ā́ hí tanvaté  náro dhánvāni bāhvóḥ  mā́ no asmín mahādhané  párā varktaṃ gáviṣṭiṣu

translation.text: E'en now, O Indra-Agni, men hold in their arms and stretch their bows. Desert us not in this great fray, in battles for the sake of kine.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑ग्नी॒ तप॑न्ति मा॒घा अ॒र्यो अरा॑तयः अप॒ द्वेषां॒स्या कृ॑तं युयु॒तं सूर्या॒दधि॑
verses.transliteration: índrāgnī tápanti mā-  aghā́ aryó árātayaḥ  ápa dvéṣāṃsy ā́ kr̥taṃ  yuyutáṃ sū́ryād ádhi

translation.text: The foeman's sinful enmities, Indra and Agni, vex me sore. Drive those who hate me far away, and keep them distant from the Sun.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑ग्नी यु॒वोरपि॒ वसु॑ दि॒व्यानि॒ पार्थि॑वा आ न॑ इ॒ह प्र य॑च्छतं र॒यिं वि॒श्वायु॑पोषसम्
verses.transliteration: índrāgnī yuvór ápi  vásu divyā́ni pā́rthivā  ā́ na ihá prá yachataṃ  rayíṃ viśvā́yupoṣasam

translation.text: Indra and Agni, yours are all the treasures of the heavens and earth. Here give ye us the opulence that prospers every living man.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑ग्नी उक्थवाहसा॒ स्तोमे॑भिर्हवनश्रुता विश्वा॑भिर्गी॒र्भिरा ग॑तम॒स्य सोम॑स्य पी॒तये॑
verses.transliteration: índrāgnī ukthavāhasā  stómebhir havanaśrutā  víśvābhir gīrbhír ā́ gatam  asyá sómasya pītáye

translation.text: O Indra-Agni, who accept the laud, and hear us for our praise, Come near us, drawn by all our songs, to drink of this our Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्नथ॑द्वृ॒त्रमु॒त स॑नोति॒ वाज॒मिन्द्रा॒ यो अ॒ग्नी सहु॑री सप॒र्यात् इ॒र॒ज्यन्ता॑ वस॒व्य॑स्य॒ भूरेः॒ सह॑स्तमा॒ सह॑सा वाज॒यन्ता॑
verses.transliteration: śnáthad vr̥trám utá sanoti vā́jam  índrā yó agnī́ sáhurī saparyā́t  irajyántā vasavyàsya bhū́reḥ  sáhastamā sáhasā vājayántā

translation.text: HE slays the foe and wins the spoil who worships Indra and Agni, strong and mighty Heroes, Who rule as Sovrans over ample riches, victorious, showing forth their power in conquest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता यो॑धिष्टम॒भि गा इ॑न्द्र नू॒नम॒पः स्व॑रु॒षसो॑ अग्न ऊ॒ळ्हाः दिशः॒ स्व॑रु॒षस॑ इन्द्र चि॒त्रा अ॒पो गा अ॑ग्ने युवसे नि॒युत्वा॑न्
verses.transliteration: tā́ yodhiṣṭam abhí gā́ indra nūnám  apáḥ svàr uṣáso agna ūḷhā́ḥ  díśaḥ svàr uṣása indra citrā́ḥ-  apó gā́ agne yuvase niyútvān

translation.text: So battle now, O Indra and thou, Agni, for cows and waters, sunlight, stolen Mornings. Team-borne, thou makest kine thine own, O Agni: thou, Indra, light, Dawns, regions, wondrous waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वृ॑त्रहणा वृत्र॒हभिः॒ शुष्मै॒रिन्द्र॑ या॒तं नमो॑भिरग्ने अ॒र्वाक् यु॒वं राधो॑भि॒रक॑वेभिरि॒न्द्राग्ने॑ अ॒स्मे भ॑वतमुत्त॒मेभिः॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ vr̥trahaṇā vr̥trahábhiḥ śúṣmair  índra yātáṃ námobhir agne arvā́k  yuváṃ rā́dhobhir ákavebhir indra-  -ágne asmé bhavatam uttamébhiḥ

translation.text: With Vr̥itra-slaying might, Indra and Agni, come, drawn by homage, O ye Vr̥itra-slayers. Indra and Agni, show yourselves among us with your supreme and unrestricted bounties.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता हु॑वे॒ ययो॑रि॒दं प॒प्ने विश्वं॑ पु॒रा कृ॒तम् इ॒न्द्रा॒ग्नी न म॑र्धतः
verses.transliteration: tā́ huve yáyor idám  papné víśvam purā́ kr̥tám  indrāgnī́ ná mardhataḥ

translation.text: I call the Twain whose deeds of old have all been famed in ancient days O Indra-Agni, harm us not.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒ग्रा वि॑घ॒निना॒ मृध॑ इन्द्रा॒ग्नी ह॑वामहे ता नो॑ मृळात ई॒दृशे॑
verses.transliteration: ugrā́ vighanínā mŕ̥dhaḥ-  indrāgnī́ havāmahe  tā́ no mr̥ḷāta īdŕ̥śe

translation.text: The Strong, the scatterers of the foe, Indra and Agni, we invoke; May they be kind to one like me.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ह॒तो वृ॒त्राण्यार्या॑ ह॒तो दासा॑नि॒ सत्प॑ती ह॒तो विश्वा॒ अप॒ द्विषः॑
verses.transliteration: ható vr̥trā́ṇy ā́ryā  ható dā́sāni sátpatī  ható víśvā ápa dvíṣaḥ

translation.text: They slay our Ârya foes, these Lords of heroes, slay our Dasyu foes And drive our enemies away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑ग्नी यु॒वामि॒मे॒३॒॑ऽभि स्तोमा॑ अनूषत पिब॑तं शम्भुवा सु॒तम्
verses.transliteration: índrāgnī yuvā́m imé-  -abhí stómā anūṣata  píbataṃ śambhuvā sutám

translation.text: Indra and Agni, these our songs of praise have sounded forth to you: Ye who bring blessings! drink the juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या वां॒ सन्ति॑ पुरु॒स्पृहो॑ नि॒युतो॑ दा॒शुषे॑ नरा इन्द्रा॑ग्नी॒ ताभि॒रा ग॑तम्
verses.transliteration: yā́ vāṃ sánti puruspŕ̥ho  niyúto dāśúṣe narā  índrāgnī tā́bhir ā́ gatam

translation.text: Come, Indra-Agni, with those teams, desired of many, which ye have, O Heroes, for the worshipper.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ताभि॒रा ग॑च्छतं न॒रोपे॒दं सव॑नं सु॒तम् इन्द्रा॑ग्नी॒ सोम॑पीतये
verses.transliteration: tā́bhir ā́ gachataṃ narā-  úpedáṃ sávanaṃ sutám  índrāgnī sómapītaye

translation.text: With those to this libation poured, ye Heroes, Indra-Agni, come: Come ye to drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमी॑ळिष्व॒ यो अ॒र्चिषा॒ वना॒ विश्वा॑ परि॒ष्वज॑त् कृ॒ष्णा कृ॒णोति॑ जि॒ह्वया॑
verses.transliteration: tám īḷiṣva yó arcíṣā  vánā víśvā pariṣvájat  kr̥ṣṇā́ kr̥ṇóti jihváyā

translation.text: Glorify him who compasses all forests with his glowing flame, And leaves them blackened with his tongue.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य इ॒द्ध आ॒विवा॑सति सु॒म्नमिन्द्र॑स्य॒ मर्त्यः॑ द्यु॒म्नाय॑ सु॒तरा॑ अ॒पः
verses.transliteration: yá iddhá āvívāsati  sumnám índrasya mártyaḥ  dyumnā́ya sutárā apáḥ

translation.text: He who gains Indra's bliss with fire enkindled finds an easy way Over the floods to happiness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता नो॒ वाज॑वती॒रिष॑ आ॒शून्पि॑पृत॒मर्व॑तः इन्द्र॑म॒ग्निं च॒ वोळ्ह॑वे
verses.transliteration: tā́ no vā́javatīr íṣaḥ-  āśū́n pipr̥tam árvataḥ  índram agníṃ ca vóḷhave

translation.text: Give us fleet coursers to convey Indra and Agni, and bestow Abundant strengthening food on us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒भा वा॑मिन्द्राग्नी आहु॒वध्या॑ उ॒भा राध॑सः स॒ह मा॑द॒यध्यै॑ उ॒भा दा॒तारा॑वि॒षां र॑यी॒णामु॒भा वाज॑स्य सा॒तये॑ हुवे वाम्
verses.transliteration: ubhā́ vām indrāgnī āhuvádhyai-  ubhā́ rā́dhasaḥ sahá mādayádhyai  ubhā́ dātā́rāv iṣā́ṃ rayīṇā́m  ubhā́ vā́jasya sātáye huve vām

translation.text: Indra and Agni, I will call you hither and make you joyful with the gifts I offer. Ye Twain are givers both of food and riches: to win me strength and vigour I invoke you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॒ गव्ये॑भि॒रश्व्यै॑र्वस॒व्यै॒३॒॑रुप॑ गच्छतम् सखा॑यौ दे॒वौ स॒ख्याय॑ श॒म्भुवे॑न्द्रा॒ग्नी ता ह॑वामहे
verses.transliteration: ā́ no gávyebhir áśvyair  vasavyaìr úpa gachatam  sákhāyau devaú sakhyā́ya śambhúvā-  indrāgnī́ tā́ havāmahe

translation.text: Come unto us with riches, come with wealth in horses and in kine. Indra and Agni, we invoke you both, the Gods, as Friends for friendship, bringing bliss.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑ग्नी शृणु॒तं हवं॒ यज॑मानस्य सुन्व॒तः वी॒तं ह॒व्यान्या ग॑तं॒ पिब॑तं सो॒म्यं मधु॑
verses.transliteration: índrāgnī śr̥ṇutáṃ hávaṃ  yájamānasya sunvatáḥ  vītáṃ havyā́ny ā́ gatam  píbataṃ somyám mádhu

translation.text: Indra and Agni, hear his call who worships. with libations poured. Come and enjoy the offerings, drink the sweetly-flavoured Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒यम॑ददाद्रभ॒समृ॑ण॒च्युतं॒ दिवो॑दासं वध्र्य॒श्वाय॑ दा॒शुषे॑ या शश्व॑न्तमाच॒खादा॑व॒सं प॒णिं ता ते॑ दा॒त्राणि॑ तवि॒षा स॑रस्वति
verses.transliteration: iyám adadād rabhasám r̥ṇacyútaṃ  dívodāsaṃ vadhryaśvā́ya dāśúṣe  yā́ śáśvantam ācakhā́dāvasám paṇíṃ  tā́ te dātrā́ṇi taviṣā́ sarasvati

translation.text: To Vadhryaṣva when. be worshipped her with gifts she gave fierce Divodâsa, canceller of debts. Consumer of the churlish niggard, one and all, thine, O Sarasvatî, are these effectual boons.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒यं शुष्मे॑भिर्बिस॒खा इ॑वारुज॒त्सानु॑ गिरी॒णां त॑वि॒षेभि॑रू॒र्मिभिः॑ पा॒रा॒व॒त॒घ्नीमव॑से सुवृ॒क्तिभिः॒ सर॑स्वती॒मा वि॑वासेम धी॒तिभिः॑
verses.transliteration: iyáṃ śúṣmebhir bisakhā́ ivārujat  sā́nu girīṇā́ṃ taviṣébhir ūrmíbhiḥ  pārāvataghnī́m ávase suvr̥ktíbhiḥ  sárasvatīm ā́ vivāsema dhītíbhiḥ

translation.text: She with her might, like one who digs for lotus-stems, hath burst with her strong waves the ridges of the hills. Let us invite with songs and holy hymns for help Sarasvatî who slayeth the Pârâvatas.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सर॑स्वति देव॒निदो॒ नि ब॑र्हय प्र॒जां विश्व॑स्य॒ बृस॑यस्य मा॒यिनः॑ उ॒त क्षि॒तिभ्यो॒ऽवनी॑रविन्दो वि॒षमे॑भ्यो अस्रवो वाजिनीवति
verses.transliteration: sárasvati devanído ní barhaya  prajā́ṃ víśvasya bŕ̥sayasya māyínaḥ  utá kṣitíbhyo 'vánīr avindo  viṣám ebhyo asravo vājinīvati

translation.text: Thou castest down, Sarasvatî, those who scorned the Gods, the brood of every Br̥isaya skilled in magic arts. Thou hast discovered rivers for the tribes of men, and, rich in wealth! made poison flow away from them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र णो॑ दे॒वी सर॑स्वती॒ वाजे॑भिर्वा॒जिनी॑वती धी॒नाम॑वि॒त्र्य॑वतु
verses.transliteration: prá ṇo devī́ sárasvatī  vā́jebhir vājínīvatī  dhīnā́m avitry àvatu

translation.text: May the divine Sarasvatî, rich in her wealth, protect us well, Furthering all our thoughts with might

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्त्वा॑ देवि सरस्वत्युपब्रू॒ते धने॑ हि॒ते इन्द्रं॒ न वृ॑त्र॒तूर्ये॑
verses.transliteration: yás tvā devi sarasvati-  upabrūté dháne hité  índraṃ ná vr̥tratū́rye

translation.text: Whoso, divine Sarasvatî, invokes thee where the prize is set, Like Indra when he smites the foe.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं दे॑वि सरस्व॒त्यवा॒ वाजे॑षु वाजिनि रदा॑ पू॒षेव॑ नः स॒निम्
verses.transliteration: tváṃ devi sarasvati-  ávā vā́jeṣu vājini  rádā pūṣéva naḥ saním

translation.text: Aid us, divine Sarasvad, thou who art strong in wealth and power Like Pûshan, give us opulence.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त स्या नः॒ सर॑स्वती घो॒रा हिर॑ण्यवर्तनिः वृ॒त्र॒घ्नी व॑ष्टि सुष्टु॒तिम्
verses.transliteration: utá syā́ naḥ sárasvatī  ghorā́ híraṇyavartaniḥ  vr̥traghnī́ vaṣṭi suṣṭutím

translation.text: Yea, this divine Sarasvatî, terrible with her golden path, Foe-slayer, claims our eulogy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्या॑ अन॒न्तो अह्रु॑तस्त्वे॒षश्च॑रि॒ष्णुर॑र्ण॒वः अम॒श्चर॑ति॒ रोरु॑वत्
verses.transliteration: yásyā anantó áhrutas  tveṣáś cariṣṇúr arṇaváḥ  ámaś cárati róruvat

translation.text: Whose limitless unbroken flood, swift-moving with a rapid rush, Comes onward with tempestuous roar.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सा नो॒ विश्वा॒ अति॒ द्विषः॒ स्वसॄ॑र॒न्या ऋ॒ताव॑री अत॒न्नहे॑व॒ सूर्यः॑
verses.transliteration: sā́ no víśvā áti dvíṣaḥ  svásr̥̄r anyā́ r̥tā́varī  átann áheva sū́ryaḥ

translation.text: She hath spread us beyond all foes, beyond her Sisters, Holy One, As Sûrya spreadeth out the days.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त नः॑ प्रि॒या प्रि॒यासु॑ स॒प्तस्व॑सा॒ सुजु॑ष्टा सर॑स्वती॒ स्तोम्या॑ भूत्
verses.transliteration: utá naḥ priyā́ priyā́su  saptásvasā sújuṣṭā  sárasvatī stómyā bhūt

translation.text: Yea, she most dear amid dear stream, Seven-sistered, graciously inclined, Sarasvatî hath earned our praise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒प॒प्रुषी॒ पार्थि॑वान्यु॒रु रजो॑ अ॒न्तरि॑क्षम् सर॑स्वती नि॒दस्पा॑तु
verses.transliteration: āpaprúṣī pā́rthivāni-  urú rájo antárikṣam  sárasvatī nidás pātu

translation.text: Guard us from hate Sarasvatî, she who hath filled the realms of earth, And that wide tract, the firmament!

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्रि॒ष॒धस्था॑ स॒प्तधा॑तुः॒ पञ्च॑ जा॒ता व॒र्धय॑न्ती वाजे॑वाजे॒ हव्या॑ भूत्
verses.transliteration: triṣadhásthā saptádhātuḥ  páñca jātā́ vardháyantī  vā́je-vāje hávyā bhūt

translation.text: Seven-sistered, sprung from threefold source, the Five Tribes' prosperer, she must be Invoked in every deed of might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र या म॑हि॒म्ना म॒हिना॑सु॒ चेकि॑ते द्यु॒म्नेभि॑र॒न्या अ॒पसा॑म॒पस्त॑मा रथ॑ इव बृह॒ती वि॒भ्वने॑ कृ॒तोप॒स्तुत्या॑ चिकि॒तुषा॒ सर॑स्वती
verses.transliteration: prá yā́ mahimnā́ mahínāsu cékite  dyumnébhir anyā́ apásām apástamā  rátha iva br̥hatī́ vibhváne kr̥tā́-  -upastútyā cikitúṣā sárasvatī

translation.text: Marked out by majesty among the Mighty Ones, in glory swifter than the other rapid Streams, Created vast for victory like a chariot, Sarasvatî must be extolled by every sage.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सर॑स्वत्य॒भि नो॑ नेषि॒ वस्यो॒ माप॑ स्फरीः॒ पय॑सा॒ मा न॒ आ ध॑क् जु॒षस्व॑ नः स॒ख्या वे॒श्या॑ च॒ मा त्वत्क्षेत्रा॒ण्यर॑णानि गन्म
verses.transliteration: sárasvaty abhí no neṣi vásyo  mā́pa spharīḥ páyasā mā́ na ā́ dhak  juṣásva naḥ sakhyā́ veśyā̀ ca  mā́ tvát kṣétrāṇy áraṇāni ganma

translation.text: Guide us, Sarasvatî, to glorious treasure: refuse us not thy milk, nor spurn us from thee. Gladly accept our friendship and obedience: let us not go from thee to distant countries.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्तु॒षे नरा॑ दि॒वो अ॒स्य प्र॒सन्ता॒श्विना॑ हुवे॒ जर॑माणो अ॒र्कैः या स॒द्य उ॒स्रा व्युषि॒ ज्मो अन्ता॒न्युयू॑षतः॒ पर्यु॒रू वरां॑सि
verses.transliteration: stuṣé nárā divó asyá prasántā-  -aśvínā huve járamāṇo arkaíḥ  yā́ sadyá usrā́ vyúṣi jmó ántān  yúyūṣataḥ páry urū́ várāṃsi

translation.text: I LAUD the Heroes Twain, this heaven's Controllers: singing with songs of praise I call the Aṣvins, Fain in a moment, when the morns are breaking, to part the earth's ends and the spacious regions.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता य॒ज्ञमा शुचि॑भिश्चक्रमा॒णा रथ॑स्य भा॒नुं रु॑रुचू॒ रजो॑भिः पु॒रू वरां॒स्यमि॑ता॒ मिमा॑ना॒पो धन्वा॒न्यति॑ याथो॒ अज्रा॑न्
verses.transliteration: tā́ yajñám ā́ śúcibhiś cakramāṇā́  ráthasya bhānúṃ rurucū rájobhiḥ  purū́ várāṃsy ámitā mímānā-  -apó dhánvāny áti yātho ájrān

translation.text: Moving to sacrifice through realms of lustre they light the radiance of the car that bears them. traversing many wide unmeasured spaces, over the wastes ye pass, and fields, and waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता ह॒ त्यद्व॒र्तिर्यदर॑ध्रमुग्रे॒त्था धिय॑ ऊहथुः॒ शश्व॒दश्वैः॑ मनो॑जवेभिरिषि॒रैः श॒यध्यै॒ परि॒ व्यथि॑र्दा॒शुषो॒ मर्त्य॑स्य
verses.transliteration: tā́ ha tyád vartír yád áradhram ugrā-  -itthā́ dhíya ūhathuḥ śáśvad áśvaiḥ  mánojavebhir iṣiraíḥ śayádhyai  pári vyáthir dāśúṣo mártyasya

translation.text: Ye to that bounteous path of yours, ye mighty, have ever borne away our thoughts with horses, Mind-swift and full of vigour, that the trouble of man who offers gifts might cease and slumber.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता नव्य॑सो॒ जर॑माणस्य॒ मन्मोप॑ भूषतो युयुजा॒नस॑प्ती शुभं॒ पृक्ष॒मिष॒मूर्जं॒ वह॑न्ता॒ होता॑ यक्षत्प्र॒त्नो अ॒ध्रुग्युवा॑ना
verses.transliteration: tā́ návyaso járamāṇasya mánma-  -úpa bhūṣato yuyujānásaptī  śúbham pŕ̥kṣam íṣam ū́rjaṃ váhantā  hótā yakṣat pratnó adhrúg yúvānā

translation.text: So ye, when ye have yoked your chariothorses, come to the hymn of the most recent singer. Our true and ancient Herald Priest shall bring you, the Youthful, bearing splendour, food, and vigour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता व॒ल्गू द॒स्रा पु॑रु॒शाक॑तमा प्र॒त्ना नव्य॑सा॒ वच॒सा वि॑वासे या शंस॑ते स्तुव॒ते शम्भ॑विष्ठा बभू॒वतु॑र्गृण॒ते चि॒त्ररा॑ती
verses.transliteration: tā́ valgū́ dasrā́ puruśā́katamā  pratnā́ návyasā vácasā́ vivāse  yā́ śáṃsate stuvaté śámbhaviṣṭhā  babhūvátur gr̥ṇaté citrárātī

translation.text: With newest hymn I call those Wonder-Workers, ancient and brilliant, and exceeding mighty, Bringers of bliss to him who lauds and praises, bestowing varied bounties on the singer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता भु॒ज्युं विभि॑र॒द्भ्यः स॑मु॒द्रात्तुग्र॑स्य सू॒नुमू॑हथू॒ रजो॑भिः अ॒रे॒णुभि॒र्योज॑नेभिर्भु॒जन्ता॑ पत॒त्रिभि॒रर्ण॑सो॒ निरु॒पस्था॑त्
verses.transliteration: tā́ bhujyúṃ víbhir adbhyáḥ samudrā́t  túgrasya sūnúm ūhathū rájobhiḥ  areṇúbhir yójanebhir bhujántā  patatríbhir árṇaso nír upásthāt

translation.text: So ye, with birds, out of the sea and waters bore Bhujyu, son of Tugra, through the regions. Speeding with winged steeds through dustless spaces, out of the bosom of the flood they bore him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि ज॒युषा॑ रथ्या यात॒मद्रिं॑ श्रु॒तं हवं॑ वृषणा वध्रिम॒त्याः द॒श॒स्यन्ता॑ श॒यवे॑ पिप्यथु॒र्गामिति॑ च्यवाना सुम॒तिं भु॑रण्यू
verses.transliteration: ví jayúṣā rathyā yātam ádriṃ  śrutáṃ hávaṃ vr̥ṣaṇā vadhrimatyā́ḥ  daśasyántā śayáve pipyathur gā́m  íti cyavānā sumatím bhuraṇyū

translation.text: Victors, car-borne, ye rent the rock asunder: Bulls, heard the calling of the eunuch's consort. Bounteous, ye filled the cow with milk for Ṣayu: thus, swift and zealous Ones, ye showed your favour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद्रो॑दसी प्र॒दिवो॒ अस्ति॒ भूमा॒ हेळो॑ दे॒वाना॑मु॒त म॑र्त्य॒त्रा तदा॑दित्या वसवो रुद्रियासो रक्षो॒युजे॒ तपु॑र॒घं द॑धात
verses.transliteration: yád rodasī pradívo ásti bhū́mā  héḷo devā́nām utá martyatrā́  tád ādityā vasavo rudriyāso  rakṣoyúje tápur agháṃ dadhāta

translation.text: Whate'er from olden time, Heaven, Earth! existeth great object of the wrath of Gods and mortals, Make that, Âdityas, Vasus, sons of Rudra, an evil brand to one allied with demons.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य ईं॒ राजा॑नावृतु॒था वि॒दध॒द्रज॑सो मि॒त्रो वरु॑ण॒श्चिके॑तत् ग॒म्भी॒राय॒ रक्ष॑से हे॒तिम॑स्य॒ द्रोघा॑य चि॒द्वच॑स॒ आन॑वाय
verses.transliteration: yá īṃ rā́jānāv r̥tuthā́ vidádhad  rájaso mitró váruṇaś cíketat  gambhīrā́ya rákṣase hetím asya  dróghāya cid vácasa ā́navāya

translation.text: May he who knows, as Varuṇa and Mitra, air's realm, appointing both the Kings in season, Against the secret fiend cast forth his weapon, against the lying words that strangers utter.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अन्त॑रैश्च॒क्रैस्तन॑याय व॒र्तिर्द्यु॒मता या॑तं नृ॒वता॒ रथे॑न सनु॑त्येन॒ त्यज॑सा॒ मर्त्य॑स्य वनुष्य॒तामपि॑ शी॒र्षा व॑वृक्तम्
verses.transliteration: ántaraiś cakraís tánayāya vartír  dyumátā́ yātaṃ nr̥vátā ráthena  sánutyena tyájasā mártyasya  vanuṣyatā́m ápi śīrṣā́ vavr̥ktam

translation.text: Come to our home with friendly wheels, for offspring; come on your radiant chariot rich in heroes. Strike off, ye Twain, the heads of our assailants who with man's treacherous attack approach us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ प॑र॒माभि॑रु॒त म॑ध्य॒माभि॑र्नि॒युद्भि॑र्यातमव॒माभि॑र॒र्वाक् दृ॒ळ्हस्य॑ चि॒द्गोम॑तो॒ वि व्र॒जस्य॒ दुरो॑ वर्तं गृण॒ते चि॑त्रराती
verses.transliteration: ā́ paramā́bhir utá madhyamā́bhir  niyúdbhir yātam avamā́bhir arvā́k  dr̥ḷhásya cid gómato ví vrajásya  dúro vartaṃ gr̥ṇaté citrarātī

translation.text: Come hitherward to us with teams of horses, the highest and the midmost and the lowest. Bountiful Lords, throw open to the singer doors e'en of the firm-closed stall of cattle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क्व१॒॑ त्या व॒ल्गू पु॑रुहू॒ताद्य दू॒तो न स्तोमो॑ऽविद॒न्नम॑स्वान् आ यो अ॒र्वाङ्नास॑त्या व॒वर्त॒ प्रेष्ठा॒ ह्यस॑थो अस्य॒ मन्म॑न्
verses.transliteration: kvà tyā́ valgū́ puruhūtā́dyá  dūtó ná stómo 'vidan námasvān  ā́ yó arvā́ṅ nā́satyā vavárta  préṣṭhā hy ásatho asya mánman

translation.text: WHERE hath the hymn with reverence, like an envoy, found both fair Gods to-day, invoked of many- Hymn that hath brought the two Nâsatyas hither? To this man's thought be ye, both Gods, most friendly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अरं॑ मे गन्तं॒ हव॑नाया॒स्मै गृ॑णा॒ना यथा॒ पिबा॑थो॒ अन्धः॑ परि॑ ह॒ त्यद्व॒र्तिर्या॑थो रि॒षो न यत्परो॒ नान्त॑रस्तुतु॒र्यात्
verses.transliteration: áram me gantaṃ hávanāyāsmaí  gr̥ṇānā́ yáthā píbātho ándhaḥ  pári ha tyád vartír yātho riṣó  ná yát páro nā́ntaras tuturyā́t

translation.text: Come readily to this mine invocation, lauded with songs, that ye may drink the juices. Compass this house to keep it from the foeman, that none may force it, either near or distant.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अका॑रि वा॒मन्ध॑सो॒ वरी॑म॒न्नस्ता॑रि ब॒र्हिः सु॑प्राय॒णत॑मम् उ॒त्ता॒नह॑स्तो युव॒युर्व॑व॒न्दा वां॒ नक्ष॑न्तो॒ अद्र॑य आञ्जन्
verses.transliteration: ákāri vām ándhaso várīmann  ástāri barhíḥ suprāyaṇátamam  uttānáhasto yuvayúr vavanda-  -ā́ vāṃ nákṣanto ádraya āñjan

translation.text: Juice in wide room hath been prepared to feast you: for you the grass is strewn, most soft to tread on. With lifted hands your servant hath adored you. Yearningfor you the press-stones shed the liquid.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऊ॒र्ध्वो वा॑म॒ग्निर॑ध्व॒रेष्व॑स्था॒त्प्र रा॒तिरे॑ति जू॒र्णिनी॑ घृ॒ताची॑ प्र होता॑ गू॒र्तम॑ना उरा॒णोऽयु॑क्त॒ यो नास॑त्या॒ हवी॑मन्
verses.transliteration: ūrdhvó vām agnír adhvaréṣv asthāt  prá rātír eti jūrṇínī ghr̥tā́cī  prá hótā gūrtámanā urāṇó  -áyukta yó nā́satyā hávīman

translation.text: Agni uplifts him at your sacrifices: forth goes the oblation dropping oil and glowing. Up stands the grateful-minded priest, elected, appointed to invoke the two Nâsatyas.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अधि॑ श्रि॒ये दु॑हि॒ता सूर्य॑स्य॒ रथं॑ तस्थौ पुरुभुजा श॒तोति॑म् प्र मा॒याभि॑र्मायिना भूत॒मत्र॒ नरा॑ नृतू॒ जनि॑मन्य॒ज्ञिया॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: ádhi śriyé duhitā́ sū́ryasya  ráthaṃ tasthau purubhujā śatótim  prá māyā́bhir māyinā bhūtam átra  nárā nr̥tū jániman yajñíyānām

translation.text: Lords of great wealth! for glory, Sûrya's Daughter mounted your car that brings a hundred succours. Famed for your magic arts were ye, magicians! amid the race of Gods, ye dancing Heroes!

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं श्री॒भिर्द॑र्श॒ताभि॑रा॒भिः शु॒भे पु॒ष्टिमू॑हथुः सू॒र्यायाः॑ प्र वां॒ वयो॒ वपु॒षेऽनु॑ पप्त॒न्नक्ष॒द्वाणी॒ सुष्टु॑ता धिष्ण्या वाम्
verses.transliteration: yuváṃ śrībhír darśatā́bhir ābhíḥ  śubhé puṣṭím ūhathuḥ sūryā́yāḥ  prá vāṃ váyo vápuṣé 'nu paptan  nákṣad vā́ṇī súṣṭutā dhiṣṇyā vām

translation.text: Ye Twain, with these your glories fair to look on, brought, to win victory, rich gifts for Sûryâ. After you flew your birds, marvels of beauty: dear to our hearts! the song, well lauded, reached you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वां॒ वयोऽश्वा॑सो॒ वहि॑ष्ठा अ॒भि प्रयो॑ नासत्या वहन्तु प्र वां॒ रथो॒ मनो॑जवा असर्जी॒षः पृ॒क्ष इ॒षिधो॒ अनु॑ पू॒र्वीः
verses.transliteration: ā́ vāṃ váyó 'śvāso váhiṣṭhāḥ-  abhí práyo nāsatyā vahantu  prá vāṃ rátho mánojavā asarji-  -iṣáḥ pr̥kṣá iṣídho ánu pūrvī́ḥ

translation.text: May your winged coursers, best to draw. Nâsatyas! convey you to the object of your wishes. Swift as the thought, your car hath been sent onward to food of many a sort and dainty viands.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒रु हि वां॑ पुरुभुजा दे॒ष्णं धे॒नुं न॒ इषं॑ पिन्वत॒मस॑क्राम् स्तुत॑श्च वां माध्वी सुष्टु॒तिश्च॒ रसा॑श्च॒ ये वा॒मनु॑ रा॒तिमग्म॑न्
verses.transliteration: purú hí vām purubhujā deṣṇáṃ  dhenúṃ na íṣam pinvatam ásakrām  stútaś ca vām mādhvī suṣṭutíś ca  rásāś ca yé vām ánu rātím ágman

translation.text: Lords of great wealth, manifold is your bounty: ye filled our cow with food that never faileth. Lovers of sweetness! yours are praise and singers, and poured libations which have sought your favour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त म॑ ऋ॒ज्रे पुर॑यस्य र॒घ्वी सु॑मी॒ळ्हे श॒तं पे॑रु॒के च॑ प॒क्वा शा॒ण्डो दा॑द्धिर॒णिनः॒ स्मद्दि॑ष्टी॒न्दश॑ व॒शासो॑ अभि॒षाच॑ ऋ॒ष्वान्
verses.transliteration: utá ma r̥jré púrayasya raghvī́  sumīḷhé śatám peruké ca pakvā́  śāṇḍó dād dhiraṇínaḥ smáddiṣṭīn  dáśa vaśā́so abhiṣā́ca r̥ṣvā́n

translation.text: Mine were two mares of Puraya, brown, swift-footed; a hundred with Sumîḍha, food with Peruk. Ṣâṇḍa gave ten gold-decked and well-trained horses, tame and obedient and of lofty stature.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं वां॑ श॒ता ना॑सत्या स॒हस्राश्वा॑नां पुरु॒पन्था॑ गि॒रे दा॑त् भ॒रद्वा॑जाय वीर॒ नू गि॒रे दा॑द्ध॒ता रक्षां॑सि पुरुदंससा स्युः
verses.transliteration: sáṃ vāṃ śatā́ nāsatyā sahásrā-  -áśvānām purupánthā giré dāt  bharádvājāya vīra nū́ giré dād  -hatā́ rákṣāṃsi purudaṃsasā syuḥ

translation.text: Nâsatyas! Purupanthas offered hundreds, thousands of steeds to him who sang your praises, Gave, Heroes! to the singer Bharadvâja. Ye-Wonder-Workers, let the fiends be slaughtered.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वां॑ सु॒म्ने वरि॑मन्त्सू॒रिभिः॑ ष्याम्
verses.transliteration: ā́ vāṃ sumné váriman sūríbhiḥ ṣyām

translation.text: May I with princes share your bliss in freedom.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उदु॑ श्रि॒य उ॒षसो॒ रोच॑माना॒ अस्थु॑र॒पां नोर्मयो॒ रुश॑न्तः कृ॒णोति॒ विश्वा॑ सु॒पथा॑ सु॒गान्यभू॑दु॒ वस्वी॒ दक्षि॑णा म॒घोनी॑
verses.transliteration: úd u śriyá uṣáso rócamānāḥ-  ásthur apā́ṃ nórmáyo rúśantaḥ  kr̥ṇóti víśvā supáthā sugā́ni-  ábhūd u vásvī dákṣiṇā maghónī

translation.text: THE radiant Dawns have risen up for glory, in their white splendour like the waves of waters. She maketh paths all easy, fair to travel, and, rich, hath shown herself benign and friendly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भ॒द्रा द॑दृक्ष उर्वि॒या वि भा॒स्युत्ते॑ शो॒चिर्भा॒नवो॒ द्याम॑पप्तन् आ॒विर्वक्षः॑ कृणुषे शु॒म्भमा॒नोषो॑ देवि॒ रोच॑माना॒ महो॑भिः
verses.transliteration: bhadrā́ dadr̥kṣa urviyā́ ví bhāsi-  út te śocír bhānávo dyā́m apaptan  āvír vákṣaḥ kr̥ṇuṣe śumbhámānā-  -úṣo devi rócamānā máhobhiḥ

translation.text: We see that thou art good: far shines thy lustre; thy beams, thy splendours have flown up to heaven. Decking thyself, thou makest bare thy bosom, shining in majesty, thou Goddess Morning.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वह॑न्ति सीमरु॒णासो॒ रुश॑न्तो॒ गावः॑ सु॒भगा॑मुर्वि॒या प्र॑था॒नाम् अपे॑जते॒ शूरो॒ अस्ते॑व॒ शत्रू॒न्बाध॑ते॒ तमो॑ अजि॒रो न वोळ्हा॑
verses.transliteration: váhanti sīm aruṇā́so rúśanto  gā́vaḥ subhágām urviyā́ prathānā́m  ápejate śū́ro ásteva śátrūn  bā́dhate támo ajiró ná vóḷhā

translation.text: Red are the kine and luminous that bear her the Blessed One who spreadeth through the distance. The foes she chaseth like a valiant archer, like a swift warrior she repelleth darkness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒गोत ते॑ सु॒पथा॒ पर्व॑तेष्ववा॒ते अ॒पस्त॑रसि स्वभानो सा न॒ आ व॑ह पृथुयामन्नृष्वे र॒यिं दि॑वो दुहितरिष॒यध्यै॑
verses.transliteration: sugótá te supáthā párvateṣu-  avāté apás tarasi svabhāno  sā́ na ā́ vaha pr̥thuyāmann r̥ṣve  rayíṃ divo duhitar iṣayádhyai

translation.text: Thy ways are easy on the hills: thou passest Invincible! Self-luminous! through waters. So lofty Goddess with thine ample pathway, Daughter of Heaven, bring wealth to give us comfort.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सा व॑ह॒ योक्षभि॒रवा॒तोषो॒ वरं॒ वह॑सि॒ जोष॒मनु॑ त्वं दि॑वो दुहित॒र्या ह॑ दे॒वी पू॒र्वहू॑तौ मं॒हना॑ दर्श॒ता भूः॑
verses.transliteration: sā́ vaha yókṣábhir ávātā-  -úṣo váraṃ váhasi jóṣam ánu  tváṃ divo duhitar yā́ ha devī́  pūrváhūtau maṃhánā darśatā́ bhūḥ

translation.text: Dawn, bring me wealth: untroubled, with thine oxen thou bearest riches at thy will and pleasure; Thou who, a Goddess, Child of Heaven, hast shown thee lovely through bounty when we called thee early.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उत्ते॒ वय॑श्चिद्वस॒तेर॑पप्त॒न्नर॑श्च॒ ये पि॑तु॒भाजो॒ व्यु॑ष्टौ अ॒मा स॒ते व॑हसि॒ भूरि॑ वा॒ममुषो॑ देवि दा॒शुषे॒ मर्त्या॑य
verses.transliteration: út te váyaś cid vasatér apaptan  náraś ca yé pitubhā́jo vyùṣṭau  amā́ saté vahasi bhū́ri vāmám  úṣo devi dāśúṣe mártyāya

translation.text: As the birds fly forth from their restingplaces, so men with store of food rise at thy dawning. Yea, to the liberal mortal who rernaineth at home, O Goddess Dawn, much good thou bringest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒षा स्या नो॑ दुहि॒ता दि॑वो॒जाः क्षि॒तीरु॒च्छन्ती॒ मानु॑षीरजीगः या भा॒नुना॒ रुश॑ता रा॒म्यास्वज्ञा॑यि ति॒रस्तम॑सश्चिद॒क्तून्
verses.transliteration: eṣā́ syā́ no duhitā́ divojā́ḥ  kṣitī́r uchántī mā́nuṣīr ajīgaḥ  yā́ bhānúnā rúśatā rāmyā́su-  ájñāyi tirás támasaś cid aktū́n

translation.text: SHEDDING her light on human habitations this Child of Heaven hath called us from our slumber; She who at night-time with her argent lustre hath shown herself e'en through the shades of darkness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि तद्य॑युररुण॒युग्भि॒रश्वै॑श्चि॒त्रं भा॑न्त्यु॒षस॑श्च॒न्द्रर॑थाः अग्रं॑ य॒ज्ञस्य॑ बृह॒तो नय॑न्ती॒र्वि ता बा॑धन्ते॒ तम॒ ऊर्म्या॑याः
verses.transliteration: ví tád yayur aruṇayúgbhir áśvaiś  citrám bhānty uṣásaś candrárathāḥ  ágraṃ yajñásya br̥ható náyantīr  ví tā́ bādhante táma ū́rmyāyāḥ

translation.text: All this with red-rayed steeds have they divided: the Dawns on bright cars shine in wondrous fashion. They, bringing near the stately rite's commencement, drive far away the night's surrounding shadows.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्रवो॒ वाज॒मिष॒मूर्जं॒ वह॑न्ती॒र्नि दा॒शुष॑ उषसो॒ मर्त्या॑य म॒घोनी॑र्वी॒रव॒त्पत्य॑माना॒ अवो॑ धात विध॒ते रत्न॑म॒द्य
verses.transliteration: śrávo vā́jam íṣam ū́rjaṃ váhantīr  ní dāśúṣa uṣaso mártyāya  maghónīr vīrávat pátyamānāḥ-  ávo dhāta vidhaté rátnam adyá

translation.text: Dawns, bringing hither, to the man who worships, glory and power and might and food and vigour, Opulent, with imperial sway like heroes, favour your servant and this day enrich him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒दा हि वो॑ विध॒ते रत्न॒मस्ती॒दा वी॒राय॑ दा॒शुष॑ उषासः इ॒दा विप्रा॑य॒ जर॑ते॒ यदु॒क्था नि ष्म॒ माव॑ते वहथा पु॒रा चि॑त्
verses.transliteration: idā́ hí vo vidhaté rátnam ásti-  -idā́ vīrā́ya dāśúṣa uṣāsaḥ  idā́ víprāya járate yád ukthā́  ní ṣma mā́vate vahathā purā́ cit

translation.text: Now is there treasure for the man who serves you, now for the hero, Dawns! who brings oblation; Now for the singer when he sings the praise-song. Even to one like me ye brought aforetime.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒दा हि त॑ उषो अद्रिसानो गो॒त्रा गवा॒मङ्गि॑रसो गृ॒णन्ति॑ व्य१॒॑र्केण॑ बिभिदु॒र्ब्रह्म॑णा च स॒त्या नृ॒णाम॑भवद्दे॒वहू॑तिः
verses.transliteration: idā́ hí ta uṣo adrisāno  gotrā́ gávām áṅgiraso gr̥ṇánti  vy àrkéṇa bibhidur bráhmaṇā ca  satyā́ nr̥ṇā́m abhavad deváhūtiḥ

translation.text: O Dawn who standest on the mountain ridges, Angirases now praise thy stalls of cattle. With prayer and holy hymn they burst them open: the heroes' calling on the Gods was fruitful.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒च्छा दि॑वो दुहितः प्रत्न॒वन्नो॑ भरद्वाज॒वद्वि॑ध॒ते म॑घोनि सु॒वीरं॑ र॒यिं गृ॑ण॒ते रि॑रीह्युरुगा॒यमधि॑ धेहि॒ श्रवो॑ नः
verses.transliteration: uchā́ divo duhitaḥ pratnaván no  bharadvājavád vidhaté maghoni  suvī́raṃ rayíṃ gr̥ṇaté rirīhi-  urugāyám ádhi dhehi śrávo naḥ

translation.text: Shine on us as of old, thou Child of Heaven,on him, rich Maid! who serves like Bharadvâja. Give to the singer wealth with noble heroes, and upon us bestow wide-spreading glory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वपु॒र्नु तच्चि॑कि॒तुषे॑ चिदस्तु समा॒नं नाम॑ धे॒नु पत्य॑मानम् मर्ते॑ष्व॒न्यद्दो॒हसे॑ पी॒पाय॑ स॒कृच्छु॒क्रं दु॑दुहे॒ पृश्नि॒रूधः॑
verses.transliteration: vápur nú tác cikitúṣe cid astu  samānáṃ nā́ma dhenú pátyamānam  márteṣv anyád doháse pīpā́ya  sakŕ̥c chukráṃ duduhe pŕ̥śnir ū́dhaḥ

translation.text: E'EN to the wise let that be still a wonder to which the general name of Cow is given. The one hath swelled among mankind for milking: Pr̥iṣni hath drained but once her fair bright udder.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये अ॒ग्नयो॒ न शोशु॑चन्निधा॒ना द्विर्यत्त्रिर्म॒रुतो॑ वावृ॒धन्त॑ अ॒रे॒णवो॑ हिर॒ण्यया॑स एषां सा॒कं नृ॒म्णैः पौंस्ये॑भिश्च भूवन्
verses.transliteration: yé agnáyo ná śóśucann idhānā́ḥ-  dvír yát trír marúto vāvr̥dhánta  areṇávo hiraṇyáyāsa eṣāṃ  sākáṃ nr̥mṇaíḥ paúṃsyebhiś ca bhūvan

translation.text: They who like kindled flames of fire are glowing,. the Maruts, twice and thrice have waxen mighty. Golden and dustless were their cars, invested with their great strength and their heroic vigour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रु॒द्रस्य॒ ये मी॒ळ्हुषः॒ सन्ति॑ पु॒त्रा याँश्चो॒ नु दाधृ॑वि॒र्भर॑ध्यै वि॒दे हि मा॒ता म॒हो म॒ही षा सेत्पृश्निः॑ सु॒भ्वे॒३॒॑ गर्भ॒माधा॑त्
verses.transliteration: rudrásya yé mīḷhúṣaḥ sánti putrā́ḥ-  yā́ṃś co nú dā́dhr̥vir bháradhyai  vidé hí mātā́ mahó mahī́ ṣā́  sét pŕ̥śniḥ subhvè gárbham ā́dhāt

translation.text: They who are Sons of the rain-pouring Rudra, whom the long-lasting One had power to foster: The Mighty Ones whose germ great Mother Pr̥iṣni is known to have received for man's advantage.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न य ईष॑न्ते ज॒नुषोऽया॒ न्व१॒॑न्तः सन्तो॑ऽव॒द्यानि॑ पुना॒नाः निर्यद्दु॒ह्रे शुच॒योऽनु॒ जोष॒मनु॑ श्रि॒या त॒न्व॑मु॒क्षमा॑णाः
verses.transliteration: ná yá ī́ṣante janúṣó 'yā nú-  -antáḥ sánto 'vadyā́ni punānā́ḥ  nír yád duhré śúcayó 'nu jóṣam  ánu śriyā́ tanvàm ukṣámāṇāḥ

translation.text: They shrink not from the birth; in this same manner still resting there they purge away reproaches. When they have streamed forth, brilliant, at their pleasure, with their own splendour they bedew their bodies.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒क्षू न येषु॑ दो॒हसे॑ चिद॒या आ नाम॑ धृ॒ष्णु मारु॑तं॒ दधा॑नाः न ये स्तौ॒ना अ॒यासो॑ म॒ह्ना नू चि॑त्सु॒दानु॒रव॑ यासदु॒ग्रान्
verses.transliteration: makṣū́ ná yéṣu doháse cid ayā́ḥ-  ā́ nā́ma dhr̥ṣṇú mā́rutaṃ dádhānāḥ  ná yé staunā́ ayā́so mahnā́  nū́ cit sudā́nur áva yāsad ugrā́n

translation.text: Even those who bear the brave bold name of Maruts, whom not the active quickly wins for milking. Even the liberal wards not off those fierce ones, those who are light and agile in their greatness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त इदु॒ग्राः शव॑सा धृ॒ष्णुषे॑णा उ॒भे यु॑जन्त॒ रोद॑सी सु॒मेके॑ अध॑ स्मैषु रोद॒सी स्वशो॑चि॒राम॑वत्सु तस्थौ॒ न रोकः॑
verses.transliteration: tá íd ugrā́ḥ śávasā dhr̥ṣṇúṣeṇāḥ-  ubhé yujanta ródasī suméke  ádha smaiṣu rodasī́ sváśocir  ā́mavatsu tasthau ná rókaḥ

translation.text: When, strong in strength and armed with potent weapons, they had united wellformed earth and heaven, Rodasl stood among these furious Heroes like splendour shining with her native brightness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ने॒नो वो॑ मरुतो॒ यामो॑ अस्त्वन॒श्वश्चि॒द्यमज॒त्यर॑थीः अ॒न॒व॒सो अ॑नभी॒शू र॑ज॒स्तूर्वि रोद॑सी प॒थ्या॑ याति॒ साध॑न्
verses.transliteration: anenó vo maruto yā́mo astu-  anaśváś cid yám ájaty árathīḥ  anavasó anabhīśū́ rajastū́r  ví ródasī pathyā̀ yāti sā́dhan

translation.text: No team of goats shall draw your car, O Maruts, no horse no charioteer be he who drives it. Halting not, reinless, through the air it travels, speeding alone its paths through earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नास्य॑ व॒र्ता न त॑रु॒ता न्व॑स्ति॒ मरु॑तो॒ यमव॑थ॒ वाज॑सातौ तो॒के वा॒ गोषु॒ तन॑ये॒ यम॒प्सु स व्र॒जं दर्ता॒ पार्ये॒ अध॒ द्योः
verses.transliteration: nā́sya vartā́ ná tarutā́ nv àsti  máruto yám ávatha vā́jasātau  toké vā góṣu tánaye yám apsú  sá vrajáṃ dártā pā́rye ádha dyóḥ

translation.text: None may obstruct, none overtake, O Maruts, him whom ye succour in the strife of battle For sons and progeny, for kine and waters: he bursts the cow-stall on the day of trial.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र चि॒त्रम॒र्कं गृ॑ण॒ते तु॒राय॒ मारु॑ताय॒ स्वत॑वसे भरध्वम् ये सहां॑सि॒ सह॑सा॒ सह॑न्ते॒ रेज॑ते अग्ने पृथि॒वी म॒खेभ्यः॑
verses.transliteration: prá citrám arkáṃ gr̥ṇaté turā́ya  mā́rutāya svátavase bharadhvam  yé sáhāṃsi sáhasā sáhante  réjate agne pr̥thivī́ makhébhyaḥ

translation.text: Bring a bright hymn to praise the band of Maruts, the Singers, rapid, strong in native vigour, Who conquer mighty strength with strength more mighty: earth shakes in terror at their wars, O Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्विषी॑मन्तो अध्व॒रस्ये॑व दि॒द्युत्तृ॑षु॒च्यव॑सो जु॒ह्वो॒३॒॑ नाग्नेः अ॒र्चत्र॑यो॒ धुन॑यो॒ न वी॒रा भ्राज॑ज्जन्मानो म॒रुतो॒ अधृ॑ष्टाः
verses.transliteration: tvíṣīmanto adhvarásyeva didyút  tr̥ṣucyávaso juhvò nā́gnéḥ  arcátrayo dhúnayo ná vīrā́ḥ-  bhrā́jajjanmāno marúto ádhr̥ṣṭāḥ

translation.text: Bright like the flashing flames of sacrifices, like tongues of fire impetuous in their onset, Chanting their psalm, singing aloud, like heroes, splendid from birth, invincible, the Maruts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं वृ॒धन्तं॒ मारु॑तं॒ भ्राज॑दृष्टिं रु॒द्रस्य॑ सू॒नुं ह॒वसा वि॑वासे दि॒वः शर्धा॑य॒ शुच॑यो मनी॒षा गि॒रयो॒ नाप॑ उ॒ग्रा अ॑स्पृध्रन्
verses.transliteration: táṃ vr̥dhántam mā́rutam bhrā́jadr̥ṣṭiṃ  rudrásya sūnúṃ havásā́ vivāse  diváḥ śárdhāya śúcayo manīṣā́ḥ-  giráyo nā́pa ugrā́ aspr̥dhran

translation.text: That swelling band I call with invocation, the brood of Rudra, armed with glittering lances. Pure hymns are meet for that celestial army: like floods and mountains have the Strong Ones battled.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वे॑षां वः स॒तां ज्येष्ठ॑तमा गी॒र्भिर्मि॒त्रावरु॑णा वावृ॒धध्यै॑ सं या र॒श्मेव॑ य॒मतु॒र्यमि॑ष्ठा॒ द्वा जनाँ॒ अस॑मा बा॒हुभिः॒ स्वैः
verses.transliteration: víśveṣāṃ vaḥ satā́ṃ jyéṣṭhatamā  gīrbhír mitrā́váruṇā vāvr̥dhádhyai  sáṃ yā́ raśméva yamátur yámiṣṭhā  dvā́ jánām̐ ásamā bāhúbhiḥ svaíḥ

translation.text: NOW Mitra-Varuṇa shall be exalted high by your songs, noblest of all existing; They who, as 'twere with reins are best Controllers, unequalled with their arms to check the people.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒यं मद्वां॒ प्र स्तृ॑णीते मनी॒षोप॑ प्रि॒या नम॑सा ब॒र्हिरच्छ॑ य॒न्तं नो॑ मित्रावरुणा॒वधृ॑ष्टं छ॒र्दिर्यद्वां॑ वरू॒थ्यं॑ सुदानू
verses.transliteration: iyám mád vām prá str̥ṇīte manīṣā́-  -úpa priyā́ námasā barhír ácha  yantáṃ no mitrāvaruṇāv ádhr̥ṣṭaṃ  chardír yád vāṃ varūthyàṃ sudānū

translation.text: To you Two Gods is this my thought extended, turned to the sacred grass with loving homage. Give us, O Mitra-Varuṇa, a dwelling safe from attack, which ye shall guard, Boon-Givers!

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ या॑तं मित्रावरुणा सुश॒स्त्युप॑ प्रि॒या नम॑सा हू॒यमा॑ना सं याव॑प्नः॒स्थो अ॒पसे॑व॒ जना॑ञ्छ्रुधीय॒तश्चि॑द्यतथो महि॒त्वा
verses.transliteration: ā́ yātam mitrāvaruṇā suśastí-  úpa priyā́ námasā hūyámānā  sáṃ yā́v apnasthó apáseva jánāñ  -śrudhīyatáś cid yatatho mahitvā́

translation.text: Come hither, Mitra-Varuṇa, invited with eulogies and loving adoration, Ye who with your might, as Work-Controllers, urge even men who quickly hear to labour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अश्वा॒ न या वा॒जिना॑ पू॒तब॑न्धू ऋ॒ता यद्गर्भ॒मदि॑ति॒र्भर॑ध्यै प्र या महि॑ म॒हान्ता॒ जाय॑माना घो॒रा मर्ता॑य रि॒पवे॒ नि दी॑धः
verses.transliteration: áśvā ná yā́ vājínā pūtábandhū  r̥tā́ yád gárbham áditir bháradhyai  prá yā́ máhi mahā́ntā jā́yamānā  ghorā́ mártāya ripáve ní dīdhaḥ

translation.text: Whom, of pure origin, like two strong horses, Aditi bore as babes in proper season, Whom, Mighty at your birth, the Mighty Goddess brought forth as terrors to the mortal foeman.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वे॒ यद्वां॑ मं॒हना॒ मन्द॑मानाः क्ष॒त्रं दे॒वासो॒ अद॑धुः स॒जोषाः॑ परि॒ यद्भू॒थो रोद॑सी चिदु॒र्वी सन्ति॒ स्पशो॒ अद॑ब्धासो॒ अमू॑राः
verses.transliteration: víśve yád vām maṃhánā mándamānāḥ  kṣatráṃ devā́so ádadhuḥ sajóṣāḥ  pári yád bhūthó ródasī cid urvī́  sánti spáśo ádabdhāso ámūrāḥ

translation.text: As all the Gods in their great joy and gladness gave you with one accord your high dominion, As ye surround both worlds, though wide and spacious your spies are ever true and never bewildered.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता हि क्ष॒त्रं धा॒रये॑थे॒ अनु॒ द्यून्दृं॒हेथे॒ सानु॑मुप॒मादि॑व॒ द्योः दृ॒ळ्हो नक्ष॑त्र उ॒त वि॒श्वदे॑वो॒ भूमि॒माता॒न्द्यां धा॒सिना॒योः
verses.transliteration: tā́ hí kṣatráṃ dhāráyethe ánu dyū́n  dr̥ṃhéthe sā́num upamā́d iva dyóḥ  dr̥ḷhó nákṣatra utá viśvádevo  bhū́mim ā́tān dyā́ṃ dhāsínāyóḥ

translation.text: So, through the days maintaining princely power. ye prop the height as 'twere from loftiest heaven. The Star of all the Gods, established, filleth the heaven and earth with food of man who liveth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता वि॒ग्रं धै॑थे ज॒ठरं॑ पृ॒णध्या॒ आ यत्सद्म॒ सभृ॑तयः पृ॒णन्ति॑ न मृ॑ष्यन्ते युव॒तयोऽवा॑ता॒ वि यत्पयो॑ विश्वजिन्वा॒ भर॑न्ते
verses.transliteration: tā́ vigráṃ dhaithe jaṭháram pr̥ṇádhyai-  ā́ yát sádma sábhr̥tayaḥ pr̥ṇánti  ná mr̥ṣyante yuvatáyó 'vātāḥ-  ví yát páyo viśvajinvā bhárante

translation.text: Take the strong drink, to quaff till ye are sated, when he and his attendants fill the chamber. The young Maids brook not that none seeks to win them, when, Quickeners of all! they scatter moisture.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता जि॒ह्वया॒ सद॒मेदं सु॑मे॒धा आ यद्वां॑ स॒त्यो अ॑र॒तिर्ऋ॒ते भूत् तद्वां॑ महि॒त्वं घृ॑तान्नावस्तु यु॒वं दा॒शुषे॒ वि च॑यिष्ट॒मंहः॑
verses.transliteration: tā́ jihváyā sádam édáṃ sumedhā́ḥ-  ā́ yád vāṃ satyó aratír r̥té bhū́t  tád vām mahitváṃ ghr̥tānnāv astu  yuváṃ dāśúṣe ví cayiṣṭam áṃhaḥ

translation.text: So with your tongue come ever, when your envoy, faithful and very wise, attends our worship. Nourished by holy oil! he this yGur glory: annihilate the sacrificer's trouble.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र यद्वां॑ मित्रावरुणा स्पू॒र्धन्प्रि॒या धाम॑ यु॒वधि॑ता मि॒नन्ति॑ न ये दे॒वास॒ ओह॑सा॒ न मर्ता॒ अय॑ज्ञसाचो॒ अप्यो॒ न पु॒त्राः
verses.transliteration: prá yád vām mitrāvaruṇā spūrdhán  priyā́ dhā́ma yuvádhitā minánti  ná yé devā́sa óhasā ná mártāḥ-  áyajñasāco ápyo ná putrā́ḥ

translation.text: When, Mitra-Varuṇa, they strive against you and break tlie friendly laws ye have established, They, neither Gods nor men in estimation, like Api's sons have godless sacrifices.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि यद्वाचं॑ की॒स्तासो॒ भर॑न्ते॒ शंस॑न्ति॒ के चि॑न्नि॒विदो॑ मना॒नाः आद्वां॑ ब्रवाम स॒त्यान्यु॒क्था नकि॑र्दे॒वेभि॑र्यतथो महि॒त्वा
verses.transliteration: ví yád vā́caṃ kīstā́so bhárante  śáṃsanti ké cin nivído manānā́ḥ  ā́d vām bravāma satyā́ny ukthā́  nákir devébhir yatatho mahitvā́

translation.text: When singers in their song uplift their voices, some chant the Nivid texts with steady purpose. Then may we sing you lauds that shall be fruitful: dp ye not rival all the Gods in greatness?

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒वोरि॒त्था वां॑ छ॒र्दिषो॑ अ॒भिष्टौ॑ यु॒वोर्मि॑त्रावरुणा॒वस्कृ॑धोयु अनु॒ यद्गावः॑ स्फु॒रानृ॑जि॒प्यं धृ॒ष्णुं यद्रणे॒ वृष॑णं यु॒नज॑न्
verses.transliteration: avór itthā́ vāṃ chardíṣo abhíṣṭau  yuvór mitrāvaruṇāv áskr̥dhoyu  ánu yád gā́va sphurā́n r̥jipyáṃ  dhr̥ṣṇúṃ yád ráṇe vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ yunájan

translation.text: O Mitra-Varuṇa, may your large bounty come to us hither, near to this our dwelling, When the kine haste to us, and when they harness the fleet-foot mettled stallion for the battle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्रु॒ष्टी वां॑ य॒ज्ञ उद्य॑तः स॒जोषा॑ मनु॒ष्वद्वृ॒क्तब॑र्हिषो॒ यज॑ध्यै आ य इन्द्रा॒वरु॑णावि॒षे अ॒द्य म॒हे सु॒म्नाय॑ म॒ह आ॑व॒वर्त॑त्
verses.transliteration: śruṣṭī́ vāṃ yajñá údyataḥ sajóṣāḥ-  manuṣvád vr̥ktábarhiṣo yájadhyai  ā́ yá índrāváruṇāv iṣé adyá  mahé sumnā́ya mahá āvavártat

translation.text: HIS honouring rite whose grass is trimmed is offered swiftly to you, in Manu's wise, accordant, The rite which Indra-Varuṇa shall carry this day to high success and glorious issue.
