verses.sanskrit_deva: ता हि श्रेष्ठा॑ दे॒वता॑ता तु॒जा शूरा॑णां॒ शवि॑ष्ठा॒ ता हि भू॒तम् म॒घोनां॒ मंहि॑ष्ठा तुवि॒शुष्म॑ ऋ॒तेन॑ वृत्र॒तुरा॒ सर्व॑सेना
verses.transliteration: tā́ hí śréṣṭhā devátātā tujā́  śū́rāṇāṃ śáviṣṭhā tā́ hí bhūtám  maghónām máṃhiṣṭhā tuviśúṣmā-  r̥téna vr̥tratúrā sárvasenā

translation.text: For at Gods' worship they are best through vigour; they have become the strongest of the Heroes; With mighty strength, most liberal of the Princes, Chiefs of the host, by Law made Vr̥itra's slayers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता गृ॑णीहि नम॒स्ये॑भिः शू॒षैः सु॒म्नेभि॒रिन्द्रा॒वरु॑णा चका॒ना वज्रे॑णा॒न्यः शव॑सा॒ हन्ति॑ वृ॒त्रं सिष॑क्त्य॒न्यो वृ॒जने॑षु॒ विप्रः॑
verses.transliteration: tā́ gr̥ṇīhi namasyèbhiḥ śūṣaíḥ  sumnébhir índrāváruṇā cakānā́  vájreṇānyáḥ śávasā hánti vr̥tráṃ  síṣakty anyó vr̥jáneṣu vípraḥ

translation.text: Praise those Twain Gods for powers that merit worship, Indra and Varuṇa, for bliss, the joyous. One with his might and thunderbolt slays Vr̥itra; the other as a Sage stands near in troubles.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ग्नाश्च॒ यन्नर॑श्च वावृ॒धन्त॒ विश्वे॑ दे॒वासो॑ न॒रां स्वगू॑र्ताः प्रैभ्य॑ इन्द्रावरुणा महि॒त्वा द्यौश्च॑ पृथिवि भूतमु॒र्वी
verses.transliteration: gnā́ś ca yán náraś ca vāvr̥dhánta  víśve devā́so narā́ṃ svágūrtāḥ  praíbhya indrāvaruṇā mahitvā́  dyaúś ca pr̥thivi bhūtam urvī́

translation.text: Though dames and men have waxen strong and mighty, and all the Gods selfpraised among the Heroes, Ye, Indra-Varuṇa, have in might surpassed them, and thus were ye spread wide, O Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स इत्सु॒दानुः॒ स्ववाँ॑ ऋ॒तावेन्द्रा॒ यो वां॑ वरुण॒ दाश॑ति॒ त्मन् इ॒षा स द्वि॒षस्त॑रे॒द्दास्वा॒न्वंस॑द्र॒यिं र॑यि॒वत॑श्च॒ जना॑न्
verses.transliteration: sá ít sudā́nuḥ svávām̐ r̥tā́vā-  -índrā yó vāṃ varuṇa dā́śati tmán  iṣā́ sá dviṣás tared dā́svān  váṃsad rayíṃ rayivátaś ca jánān

translation.text: Righteous is he, and liberal and helpful who, Indra-Varuṇa, brings you gifts with gladness. That bounteous man through food shall conquer faemen, and win him opulence and wealthy people.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यं यु॒वं दा॒श्व॑ध्वराय देवा र॒यिं ध॒त्थो वसु॑मन्तं पुरु॒क्षुम् अ॒स्मे स इ॑न्द्रावरुणा॒वपि॑ ष्या॒त्प्र यो भ॒नक्ति॑ व॒नुषा॒मश॑स्तीः
verses.transliteration: yáṃ yuváṃ dāśvàdhvarāya devā  rayíṃ dhatthó vásumantam purukṣúm  asmé sá indrāvaruṇāv ápi ṣyāt  prá yó bhanákti vanúṣām áśastīḥ

translation.text: May wealth which ye bestow in food and treasure on him who brings you gifts and sacrifices, Wealth, Gods! which breaks the curse of those who vex us, be, Indra-Varuṇa, e'en our own possession.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त नः॑ सुत्रा॒त्रो दे॒वगो॑पाः सू॒रिभ्य॑ इन्द्रावरुणा र॒यिः ष्या॑त् येषां॒ शुष्मः॒ पृत॑नासु सा॒ह्वान्प्र स॒द्यो द्यु॒म्ना ति॒रते॒ ततु॑रिः
verses.transliteration: utá naḥ sutrātró devágopāḥ  sūríbhya indrāvaruṇā rayíḥ ṣyāt  yéṣāṃ śúṣmaḥ pŕ̥tanāsu sāhvā́n  prá sadyó dyumnā́ tiráte táturiḥ

translation.text: So also, Indra-Varuṇa, may our princes have riches swift to save, with Gods to guard them- They whose great might gives victory in battles, and their triumphant glory spreads with swiftness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू न॑ इन्द्रावरुणा गृणा॒ना पृ॒ङ्क्तं र॒यिं सौ॑श्रव॒साय॑ देवा इ॒त्था गृ॒णन्तो॑ म॒हिन॑स्य॒ शर्धो॒ऽपो न ना॒वा दु॑रि॒ता त॑रेम
verses.transliteration: nū́ na indrāvaruṇā gr̥ṇānā́  pr̥ṅktáṃ rayíṃ sauśravasā́ya devā  itthā́ gr̥ṇánto mahínasya śárdho  -apó ná nāvā́ duritā́ tarema

translation.text: Indra. and Varuṇa, Gods whom we are lauding, mingle ye wealth with our heroic glory. May we, who praise the strength of what is mighty, pass dangers, as with boats we cross the waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र स॒म्राजे॑ बृह॒ते मन्म॒ नु प्रि॒यमर्च॑ दे॒वाय॒ वरु॑णाय स॒प्रथः॑ अ॒यं य उ॒र्वी म॑हि॒ना महि॑व्रतः॒ क्रत्वा॑ वि॒भात्य॒जरो॒ न शो॒चिषा॑
verses.transliteration: prá samrā́je br̥haté mánma nú priyám  árca devā́ya váruṇāya sapráthaḥ  ayáṃ yá urvī́ mahinā́ máhivrataḥ  krátvā vibhā́ty ajáro ná śocíṣā

translation.text: Now will I sing a dear and far-extending hymn to Varuṇa the God, sublime, imperial Lord, Who, mighty Governor, Eternal, as with flame, illumines both wide worlds with majesty and power.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑वरुणा सुतपावि॒मं सु॒तं सोमं॑ पिबतं॒ मद्यं॑ धृतव्रता यु॒वो रथो॑ अध्व॒रं दे॒ववी॑तये॒ प्रति॒ स्वस॑र॒मुप॑ याति पी॒तये॑
verses.transliteration: índrāvaruṇā sutapāv imáṃ sutáṃ  sómam pibatam mádyaṃ dhr̥tavratā  yuvó rátho adhvaráṃ devávītaye  práti svásaram úpa yāti pītáye

translation.text: True to Law, Indra-Varuṇa, drinkers of the juice, drink this pressed Soma which shall give you rapturous joy. Your chariot cometh to the banquet of the Gods, to sacrifice, as it were home, that ye may drink.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑वरुणा॒ मधु॑मत्तमस्य॒ वृष्णः॒ सोम॑स्य वृष॒णा वृ॑षेथाम् इ॒दं वा॒मन्धः॒ परि॑षिक्तम॒स्मे आ॒सद्या॒स्मिन्ब॒र्हिषि॑ मादयेथाम्
verses.transliteration: índrāvaruṇā mádhumattamasya  vŕ̥ṣṇaḥ sómasya vr̥ṣaṇā́ vr̥ṣethām  idáṃ vām ándhaḥ páriṣiktam asmé  āsádyāsmín barhíṣi mādayethām

translation.text: Indra and Varuṇa, drink your fill, ye Heroes, of this invigorating sweetest Soma. This juice is shed by us that ye may quaff it: on this trimmed grass be seated, and rejoice you

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं वां॒ कर्म॑णा॒ समि॒षा हि॑नो॒मीन्द्रा॑विष्णू॒ अप॑सस्पा॒रे अ॒स्य जु॒षेथां॑ य॒ज्ञं द्रवि॑णं च धत्त॒मरि॑ष्टैर्नः प॒थिभिः॑ पा॒रय॑न्ता
verses.transliteration: sáṃ vāṃ kármaṇā sám iṣā́ hinomi-  -índrāviṣṇū ápasas pāré asyá  juṣéthāṃ yajñáṃ dráviṇaṃ ca dhattam  áriṣṭair naḥ pathíbhiḥ pāráyantā

translation.text: INDRA and Vishṇu, at my task's completion I urge you on with food and sacred service. Accept the sacrifice and grant us riches, leading us on by unobstructed pathways.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या विश्वा॑सां जनि॒तारा॑ मती॒नामिन्द्रा॒विष्णू॑ क॒लशा॑ सोम॒धाना॑ प्र वां॒ गिरः॑ श॒स्यमा॑ना अवन्तु॒ प्र स्तोमा॑सो गी॒यमा॑नासो अ॒र्कैः
verses.transliteration: yā́ víśvāsāṃ janitā́rā matīnā́m  índrāvíṣṇū kaláśā somadhā́nā  prá vāṃ gíraḥ śasyámānā avantu  prá stómāso gīyámānāso arkaíḥ

translation.text: Ye who inspire all hymns, Indra and Vishṇu, ye vessels who contain the Soma juices, May hymns of praise that now are sung address you, the lauds that are recited by the singers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑विष्णू मदपती मदाना॒मा सोमं॑ यातं॒ द्रवि॑णो॒ दधा॑ना सं वा॑मञ्जन्त्व॒क्तुभि॑र्मती॒नां सं स्तोमा॑सः श॒स्यमा॑नास उ॒क्थैः
verses.transliteration: índrāviṣṇū madapatī madānām  ā́ sómaṃ yātaṃ dráviṇo dádhānā  sáṃ vām añjantv aktúbhir matīnā́ṃ  sáṃ stómāsaḥ śasyámānāsa ukthaíḥ

translation.text: Lords of joy-giving draughts, Indra and Vishṇu, come, giving gifts of treasure, to the Soma. With brilliant rays of hymns let chanted praises, repeated with the lauds, adorn and deck you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वा॒मश्वा॑सो अभिमाति॒षाह॒ इन्द्रा॑विष्णू सध॒मादो॑ वहन्तु जु॒षेथां॒ विश्वा॒ हव॑ना मती॒नामुप॒ ब्रह्मा॑णि शृणुतं॒ गिरो॑ मे
verses.transliteration: ā́ vām áśvāso abhimātiṣā́haḥ-  índrāviṣṇū sadhamā́do vahantu  juṣéthāṃ víśvā hávanā matīnā́m  úpa bráhmāṇi śr̥ṇutaṃ gíro me

translation.text: May your foe-conquering horses bring you hither, Indra and Vishṇu, sharers of the banquet. Of all our hymns accept the invocations list to my prayers and hear the songs I sing you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑विष्णू॒ तत्प॑न॒याय्यं॑ वां॒ सोम॑स्य॒ मद॑ उ॒रु च॑क्रमाथे अकृ॑णुतम॒न्तरि॑क्षं॒ वरी॒योऽप्र॑थतं जी॒वसे॑ नो॒ रजां॑सि
verses.transliteration: índrāviṣṇū tát panayā́yyaṃ vāṃ  sómasya máda urú cakramāthe  ákr̥ṇutam antárikṣaṃ várīyaḥ-  -áprathataṃ jīváse no rájāṃsi

translation.text: This your deed, Indra-Vishṇu, must be lauded: widely ye strode in the wild joy of Soma. Ye made the firmament of larger compass, and made the regions broad for our existence.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑विष्णू ह॒विषा॑ वावृधा॒नाग्रा॑द्वाना॒ नम॑सा रातहव्या घृता॑सुती॒ द्रवि॑णं धत्तम॒स्मे स॑मु॒द्रः स्थः॑ क॒लशः॑ सोम॒धानः॑
verses.transliteration: índrāviṣṇū havíṣā vāvr̥dhānā́-  -ágrādvānā námasā rātahavyā  ghŕ̥tāsutī dráviṇaṃ dhattam asmé  samudrá sthaḥ kaláśaḥ somadhā́naḥ

translation.text: Strengthened with sacred offerings, IndraVishṇu, first eaters, served with worship ana oblation, Fed with the holy oil, vouchsafe us riches ye are the lake, the vat that holds the Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑विष्णू॒ पिब॑तं॒ मध्वो॑ अ॒स्य सोम॑स्य दस्रा ज॒ठरं॑ पृणेथाम् आ वा॒मन्धां॑सि मदि॒राण्य॑ग्म॒न्नुप॒ ब्रह्मा॑णि शृणुतं॒ हवं॑ मे
verses.transliteration: índrāviṣṇū píbatam mádhvo asyá  sómasya dasrā jaṭháram pr̥ṇethām  ā́ vām ándhāṃsi madirā́ṇy agmann  úpa bráhmāṇi śr̥ṇutaṃ hávam me

translation.text: Drink of this meath, O Indra, thou, and Vishṇu; drink ye your fill of Soma, Wonder-Workers. The sweet exhilarating juice hath reached you. Hear ye my prayers, give ear unto my calling.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒भा जि॑ग्यथु॒र्न परा॑ जयेथे॒ न परा॑ जिग्ये कत॒रश्च॒नैनोः॑ इन्द्र॑श्च विष्णो॒ यदप॑स्पृधेथां त्रे॒धा स॒हस्रं॒ वि तदै॑रयेथाम्
verses.transliteration: ubhā́ jigyathur ná párā jayethe  ná párā jigye kataráś canaínoḥ  índraś ca viṣṇo yád ápaspr̥dhethāṃ  tredhā́ sahásraṃ ví tád airayethām

translation.text: Ye Twain have conquered, ne'er have yc been conquered: never hath either of the Twain been vanquished. Ye, Indra-Vishṇu, when ye fought the battle, produced this infinite with three divisions.

verses.sanskrit_deva: घृ॒तव॑ती॒ भुव॑नानामभि॒श्रियो॒र्वी पृ॒थ्वी म॑धु॒दुघे॑ सु॒पेश॑सा द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी वरु॑णस्य॒ धर्म॑णा॒ विष्क॑भिते अ॒जरे॒ भूरि॑रेतसा
verses.transliteration: ghr̥távatī bhúvanānām abhiśríyā-  -urvī́ pr̥thvī́ madhudúghe supéśasā  dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ váruṇasya dhármaṇā  víṣkabhite ajáre bhū́riretasā

translation.text: FILLED full of fatness, compassing all things that be, wide, spacious, dropping meath, beautiful in their form, The Heaven and the Earth by Varuṇa's decree, unwasting, rich in germs, stand parted each from each.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अस॑श्चन्ती॒ भूरि॑धारे॒ पय॑स्वती घृ॒तं दु॑हाते सु॒कृते॒ शुचि॑व्रते राज॑न्ती अ॒स्य भुव॑नस्य रोदसी अ॒स्मे रेतः॑ सिञ्चतं॒ यन्मनु॑र्हितम्
verses.transliteration: ásaścantī bhū́ridhāre páyasvatī  ghr̥táṃ duhāte sukŕ̥te śúcivrate  rā́jantī asyá bhúvanasya rodasī  asmé rétaḥ siñcataṃ yán mánurhitam

translation.text: The Everlasting Pair, with full streams, rich in milk, in their pure rule pour fatness for the pious man. Ye who are Regents of this world, O Earth and Heaven, pour into us the genial flow that prospers meit.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो वा॑मृ॒जवे॒ क्रम॑णाय रोदसी॒ मर्तो॑ द॒दाश॑ धिषणे॒ स सा॑धति प्र प्र॒जाभि॑र्जायते॒ धर्म॑ण॒स्परि॑ यु॒वोः सि॒क्ता विषु॑रूपाणि॒ सव्र॑ता
verses.transliteration: yó vām r̥jáve krámaṇāya rodasī  márto dadā́śa dhiṣaṇe sá sādhati  prá prajā́bhir jāyate dhármaṇas pári  yuvóḥ siktā́ víṣurūpāṇi sávratā

translation.text: Whoso, for righteous life, pours offerings to you, O Heaven and Earth, ye Hemispheres, that man succeeds. He in his seed is born again and spreads by Law: from you flow things diverse in form, but ruled alike.

verses.sanskrit_deva: घृ॒तेन॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी अ॒भीवृ॑ते घृत॒श्रिया॑ घृत॒पृचा॑ घृता॒वृधा॑ उ॒र्वी पृ॒थ्वी हो॑तृ॒वूर्ये॑ पु॒रोहि॑ते॒ ते इद्विप्रा॑ ईळते सु॒म्नमि॒ष्टये॑
verses.transliteration: ghr̥téna dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ abhī́vr̥te  ghr̥taśríyā ghr̥tapŕ̥cā ghr̥tāvŕ̥dhā  urvī́ pr̥thvī́ hotr̥vū́rye puróhite  té íd víprā īḷate sumnám iṣṭáye

translation.text: Enclosed in fatness, Heaven and Earth are bright therewith: they mingle with the fatness which they still increase. Wide, broad, set foremost at election of the priest, to them the singers pray for bliss to further them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मधु॑ नो॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी मि॑मिक्षतां मधु॒श्चुता॑ मधु॒दुघे॒ मधु॑व्रते दधा॑ने य॒ज्ञं द्रवि॑णं च दे॒वता॒ महि॒ श्रवो॒ वाज॑म॒स्मे सु॒वीर्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: mádhu no dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ mimikṣatām  madhuścútā madhudúghe mádhuvrate  dádhāne yajñáṃ dráviṇaṃ ca devátā  máhi śrávo vā́jam asmé suvī́ryam

translation.text: May Heaven and Earth pour down the balmy rain for us, balm-dropping, yielding balm, with balm upon your path, Bestowing by your Godhead sacrifice and wealth, great fame and strength for us and good heroic might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऊर्जं॑ नो॒ द्यौश्च॑ पृथि॒वी च॑ पिन्वतां पि॒ता मा॒ता वि॑श्व॒विदा॑ सु॒दंस॑सा सं॒र॒रा॒णे रोद॑सी वि॒श्वश॑म्भुवा स॒निं वाजं॑ र॒यिम॒स्मे समि॑न्वताम्
verses.transliteration: ū́rjaṃ no dyaúś ca pr̥thivī́ ca pinvatām  pitā́ mātā́ viśvavídā sudáṃsasā  saṃrarāṇé ródasī viśváśambhuvā  saníṃ vā́jaṃ rayím asmé sám invatām

translation.text: May Heaven and Earth make food swell plenteously for us, all-knowing Father, jother, wondrous in their works. Pouring out bounties, may, in union, both the Worlds, all beneficial, send us gain, and power, and wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उदु॒ ष्य दे॒वः स॑वि॒ता हि॑र॒ण्यया॑ बा॒हू अ॑यंस्त॒ सव॑नाय सु॒क्रतुः॑ घृ॒तेन॑ पा॒णी अ॒भि प्रु॑ष्णुते म॒खो युवा॑ सु॒दक्षो॒ रज॑सो॒ विध॑र्मणि
verses.transliteration: úd u ṣyá deváḥ savitā́ hiraṇyáyā  bāhū́ ayaṃsta sávanāya sukrátuḥ  ghr̥téna pāṇī́ abhí pruṣṇute makhó  yúvā sudákṣo rájaso vídharmaṇi

translation.text: FULL of effectual wisdom Savitar the God hath stretched out golden arms that he may bring forth life. Young and most skilful, while he holds the region up, the Warrior sprinkles fatness over both his hands.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वस्य॑ व॒यं स॑वि॒तुः सवी॑मनि॒ श्रेष्ठे॑ स्याम॒ वसु॑नश्च दा॒वने॑ यो विश्व॑स्य द्वि॒पदो॒ यश्चतु॑ष्पदो नि॒वेश॑ने प्रस॒वे चासि॒ भूम॑नः
verses.transliteration: devásya vayáṃ savitúḥ sávīmani  śréṣṭhe syāma vásunaś ca dāváne  yó víśvasya dvipádo yáś cátuṣpado  nivéśane prasavé cā́si bhū́manaḥ

translation.text: May we enjoy the noblest vivifying force of Savitar the God, that he may give us wealth: For thou art mighty to produce and lull to rest the world of life that moves on two feet and on four.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अद॑ब्धेभिः सवितः पा॒युभि॒ष्ट्वं शि॒वेभि॑र॒द्य परि॑ पाहि नो॒ गय॑म् हिर॑ण्यजिह्वः सुवि॒ताय॒ नव्य॑से॒ रक्षा॒ माकि॑र्नो अ॒घशं॑स ईशत
verses.transliteration: ádabdhebhiḥ savitaḥ pāyúbhiṣ ṭváṃ  śivébhir adyá pári pāhi no gáyam  híraṇyajihvaḥ suvitā́ya návyase  rákṣā mā́kir no agháśaṃsa īśata

translation.text: Protect our habitation, Savitar, this day, with guardian aids around, auspicious, firm and true. God of the golden tongue, keep us for newest bliss: let not the evil-wisher have us in his power.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उदु॒ ष्य दे॒वः स॑वि॒ता दमू॑ना॒ हिर॑ण्यपाणिः प्रतिदो॒षम॑स्थात् अयो॑हनुर्यज॒तो म॒न्द्रजि॑ह्व॒ आ दा॒शुषे॑ सुवति॒ भूरि॑ वा॒मम्
verses.transliteration: úd u ṣyá deváḥ savitā́ dámūnāḥ-  híraṇyapāṇiḥ pratidoṣám asthāt  áyohanur yajató mandrájihvaḥ-  ā́ dāśúṣe suvati bhū́ri vāmám

translation.text: This Savitar the God, the golden-handed, Friend of the home, hath risen to meet the twilight. With cheeks of brass, with pleasant tongue, the Holy, he sends the worshipper rich gifts in plenty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उदू॑ अयाँ उपव॒क्तेव॑ बा॒हू हि॑र॒ण्यया॑ सवि॒ता सु॒प्रती॑का दि॒वो रोहां॑स्यरुहत्पृथि॒व्या अरी॑रमत्प॒तय॒त्कच्चि॒दभ्व॑म्
verses.transliteration: úd ū ayām̐ upavaktéva bāhū́  hiraṇyáyā savitā́ suprátīkā  divó róhāṃsy aruhat pr̥thivyā́ḥ-  árīramat patáyat kác cid ábhvam

translation.text: Like a Director, Savitar hath extended his golden arms, exceeding fair to look on. He hath gone up the heights of earth and heaven, and made each monster fall and cease from troubling.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वा॒मम॒द्य स॑वितर्वा॒ममु॒ श्वो दि॒वेदि॑वे वा॒मम॒स्मभ्यं॑ सावीः वा॒मस्य॒ हि क्षय॑स्य देव॒ भूरे॑र॒या धि॒या वा॑म॒भाजः॑ स्याम
verses.transliteration: vāmám adyá savitar vāmám u śvó  divé-dive vāmám asmábhyaṃ sāvīḥ  vāmásya hí kṣáyasya deva bhū́rer  ayā́ dhiyā́ vāmabhā́jaḥ syāma

translation.text: Fair wealth, O Savitar, to-day, to-morrow, fair wealth produce for us each day that passes. May we through this our song be happy gainers, God, of a fair and spacious habitation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑सोमा॒ महि॒ तद्वां॑ महि॒त्वं यु॒वं म॒हानि॑ प्रथ॒मानि॑ चक्रथुः यु॒वं सूर्यं॑ विवि॒दथु॑र्यु॒वं स्व१॒॑र्विश्वा॒ तमां॑स्यहतं नि॒दश्च॑
verses.transliteration: índrāsomā máhi tád vām mahitváṃ  yuvám mahā́ni prathamā́ni cakrathuḥ  yuváṃ sū́ryaṃ vividáthur yuváṃ svàr  víśvā támāṃsy ahataṃ nidáś ca

translation.text: GREAT is this might of yours, Indra and Soma: the first high exploits were your own achievements. Ye found the Sun ye found the light of heaven: ye killed all darkness and the Gods' blasphemers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑सोमा वा॒सय॑थ उ॒षास॒मुत्सूर्यं॑ नयथो॒ ज्योति॑षा स॒ह उप॒ द्यां स्क॒म्भथुः॒ स्कम्भ॑ने॒नाप्र॑थतं पृथि॒वीं मा॒तरं॒ वि
verses.transliteration: índrāsomā vāsáyatha uṣā́sam  út sū́ryaṃ nayatho jyótiṣā sahá  úpa dyā́ṃ skambháthu skámbhanena-  -áprathatam pr̥thivī́m mātáraṃ ví

translation.text: Ye, Indra-Soma, gave her light to Morning, and led the Sun on high with all his splendour. Ye stayed the heaven with a supporting pillar, and spread abroad apart, the Earth, the Mother.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑सोमा॒वहि॑म॒पः प॑रि॒ष्ठां ह॒थो वृ॒त्रमनु॑ वां॒ द्यौर॑मन्यत प्रार्णां॑स्यैरयतं न॒दीना॒मा स॑मु॒द्राणि॑ पप्रथुः पु॒रूणि॑
verses.transliteration: índrāsomāv áhim apáḥ pariṣṭhā́ṃ  hathó vr̥trám ánu vāṃ dyaúr amanyata  prā́rṇāṃsy airayataṃ nadī́nām  ā́ samudrā́ṇi paprathuḥ purū́ṇi

translation.text: Ye slew the flood -obstructing serpent Vr̥itra, Indra and Soma: Heaven approved your exploit. Ye urged to speed the currents of the rivers, and many seas have ye filled full with waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑सोमा प॒क्वमा॒मास्व॒न्तर्नि गवा॒मिद्द॑धथुर्व॒क्षणा॑सु ज॒गृ॒भथु॒रन॑पिनद्धमासु॒ रुश॑च्चि॒त्रासु॒ जग॑तीष्व॒न्तः
verses.transliteration: índrāsomā pakvám āmā́sv antár  ní gávām íd dadhathur vakṣáṇāsu  jagr̥bháthur ánapinaddham āsu  rúśac citrā́su jágatīṣv antáḥ

translation.text: Ye in the unripe udders of the milch-kine have set the ripe milk, Indra, thou, and Soma. Ye have held fast the unimpeded whiteness within these many-coloured moving creatures.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑सोमा यु॒वम॒ङ्ग तरु॑त्रमपत्य॒साचं॒ श्रुत्यं॑ रराथे यु॒वं शुष्मं॒ नर्यं॑ चर्ष॒णिभ्यः॒ सं वि॑व्यथुः पृतना॒षाह॑मुग्रा
verses.transliteration: índrāsomā yuvám aṅgá tárutram  apatyasā́caṃ śrútyaṃ rarāthe  yuváṃ śúṣmaṃ náryaṃ carṣaṇíbhyaḥ  sáṃ vivyathuḥ pr̥tanāṣā́ham ugrā

translation.text: Verily ye bestow, Indra and Soma, wealth, famed, victorious, passing to our children. Ye have invested men, ye Mighty Beings, with manly strength that conquers in the battle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो अ॑द्रि॒भित्प्र॑थम॒जा ऋ॒तावा॒ बृह॒स्पति॑राङ्गिर॒सो ह॒विष्मा॑न् द्वि॒बर्ह॑ज्मा प्राघर्म॒सत्पि॒ता न॒ आ रोद॑सी वृष॒भो रो॑रवीति
verses.transliteration: yó adribhít prathamajā́ r̥tā́vā  bŕ̥haspátir āṅgirasó havíṣmān  dvibárhajmā prāgharmasát pitā́ naḥ-  ā́ ródasī vr̥ṣabhó roravīti

translation.text: SERVED with oblations, first-born, mountain-render, Angiras' son, Br̥ihaspati, the Holy, With twice-firm path, dwelling in light, our Father, roars loudly, as a bull, to Earth and Heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जना॑य चि॒द्य ईव॑त उ लो॒कं बृह॒स्पति॑र्दे॒वहू॑तौ च॒कार॑ घ्नन्वृ॒त्राणि॒ वि पुरो॑ दर्दरीति॒ जय॒ञ्छत्रूँ॑र॒मित्रा॑न्पृ॒त्सु साह॑न्
verses.transliteration: jánāya cid yá ī́vata ulokám  bŕ̥haspátir deváhūtau cakā́ra  ghnán vr̥trā́ṇi ví púro dardarīti  jáyañ chátrūm̐r amítrān pr̥tsú sā́han

translation.text: Br̥ihaspati, who made for such a people wide room and verge when Gods were invocated, Slaying his enemies, breaks down their castles, quelling his foes and conquering those who hate him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बृह॒स्पतिः॒ सम॑जय॒द्वसू॑नि म॒हो व्र॒जान्गोम॑तो दे॒व ए॒षः अ॒पः सिषा॑स॒न्त्स्व१॒॑रप्र॑तीतो॒ बृह॒स्पति॒र्हन्त्य॒मित्र॑म॒र्कैः
verses.transliteration: bŕ̥haspátiḥ sám ajayad vásūni  mahó vrajā́n gómato devá eṣáḥ  apáḥ síṣāsan svàr ápratīto  bŕ̥haspátir hánty amítram arkaíḥ

translation.text: Br̥ihaspati in war hath won rich treasures, hath won, this God, the great stalls filled with cattle. Striving to win waters and light, resistless, Br̥ihaspati with lightning smites the foeman.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोमा॑रुद्रा धा॒रये॑थामसु॒र्यं१॒॑ प्र वा॑मि॒ष्टयोऽर॑मश्नुवन्तु दमे॑दमे स॒प्त रत्ना॒ दधा॑ना॒ शं नो॑ भूतं द्वि॒पदे॒ शं चतु॑ष्पदे
verses.transliteration: sómārudrā dhāráyethām asuryàm  prá vām iṣṭáyó 'ram aśnuvantu  dáme-dame saptá rátnā dádhānā  śáṃ no bhūtaṃ dvipáde śáṃ cátuṣpade

translation.text: HOLD fast your Godlike sway, O Soma-Rudra: let these our sacrifices quickly reach you. Placing in every house your seven great treasures, bring blessing to our quadrupeds and bipeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोमा॑रुद्रा॒ वि वृ॑हतं॒ विषू॑ची॒ममी॑वा॒ या नो॒ गय॑मावि॒वेश॑ आ॒रे बा॑धेथां॒ निर्ऋ॑तिं परा॒चैर॒स्मे भ॒द्रा सौ॑श्रव॒सानि॑ सन्तु
verses.transliteration: sómārudrā ví vr̥hataṃ víṣūcīm  ámīvā yā́ no gáyam āvivéśa  āré bādhethāṃ nírr̥tim parācaír  asmé bhadrā́ sauśravasā́ni santu

translation.text: Soma and Rudra, chase to every quarter the sickness that hath visited our dwelling. Drive Nirr̥iti away into the distance, and give us excellent and happy glories.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोमा॑रुद्रा यु॒वमे॒तान्य॒स्मे विश्वा॑ त॒नूषु॑ भेष॒जानि॑ धत्तम् अव॑ स्यतं मु॒ञ्चतं॒ यन्नो॒ अस्ति॑ त॒नूषु॑ ब॒द्धं कृ॒तमेनो॑ अ॒स्मत्
verses.transliteration: sómārudrā yuvám etā́ny asmé  víśvā tanū́ṣu bheṣajā́ni dhattam  áva syatam muñcátaṃ yán no ásti  tanū́ṣu baddháṃ kr̥tám éno asmát

translation.text: Provide, O Soma-Rudra, for our bodies all needful medicines to heal and cure us. Set free and draw away the sin committed which we have still inherent in our persons.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ति॒ग्मायु॑धौ ति॒ग्महे॑ती सु॒शेवौ॒ सोमा॑रुद्रावि॒ह सु मृ॑ळतं नः प्र नो॑ मुञ्चतं॒ वरु॑णस्य॒ पाशा॑द्गोपा॒यतं॑ नः सुमन॒स्यमा॑ना
verses.transliteration: tigmā́yudhau tigmáhetī suśévau  sómārudrāv ihá sú mr̥ḷataṃ naḥ  prá no muñcataṃ váruṇasya pā́śād  gopāyátaṃ naḥ sumanasyámānā

translation.text: Armed with keen shafts and weapons, kind and loving, be gracious unto us, Soma and Rudra. Release us from the noose of Varuṇa; keep us from sorrow, in your tender loving-kindness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जी॒मूत॑स्येव भवति॒ प्रती॑कं॒ यद्व॒र्मी याति॑ स॒मदा॑मु॒पस्थे॑ अना॑विद्धया त॒न्वा॑ जय॒ त्वं स त्वा॒ वर्म॑णो महि॒मा पि॑पर्तु
verses.transliteration: jīmū́tasyeva bhavati prátīkaṃ  yád varmī́ yā́ti samádām upásthe  ánāviddhayā tanvā̀ jaya tváṃ  sá tvā vármaṇo mahimā́ pipartu

translation.text: THE warrior's look is like a thunderous rain-cloud's, when, armed with mail, he seeks the lap of battle. Be thou victorious with unwounded body: so let the thickness of thy mail protect thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: धन्व॑ना॒ गा धन्व॑ना॒जिं ज॑येम॒ धन्व॑ना ती॒व्राः स॒मदो॑ जयेम धनुः॒ शत्रो॑रपका॒मं कृ॑णोति॒ धन्व॑ना॒ सर्वाः॑ प्र॒दिशो॑ जयेम
verses.transliteration: dhánvanā gā́ dhánvanājíṃ jayema  dhánvanā tīvrā́ḥ samádo jayema  dhánuḥ śátror apakāmáṃ kr̥ṇoti  dhánvanā sárvāḥ pradíśo jayema

translation.text: With Bow let us win kine, with Bow the battle, with Bow be victors in our hot encounters. The Bow brings grief and sorrow to the foeman: armed with the Bow may we subdue all regions.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒क्ष्यन्ती॒वेदा ग॑नीगन्ति॒ कर्णं॑ प्रि॒यं सखा॑यं परिषस्वजा॒ना योषे॑व शिङ्क्ते॒ वित॒ताधि॒ धन्व॒ञ्ज्या इ॒यं सम॑ने पा॒रय॑न्ती
verses.transliteration: vakṣyántīvéd ā́ ganīganti kárṇam  priyáṃ sákhāyam pariṣasvajānā́  yóṣeva śiṅkte vítatā́dhi dhánvañ  jyā́ iyáṃ sámane pāráyantī

translation.text: Close to his car, as fain to speak, She presses, holding her well-loved Friend in her embraces. Strained on the Bow, She whispers like a woman-this Bowstring that preserves us in the combat.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते आ॒चर॑न्ती॒ सम॑नेव॒ योषा॑ मा॒तेव॑ पु॒त्रं बि॑भृतामु॒पस्थे॑ अप॒ शत्रू॑न्विध्यतां संविदा॒ने आर्त्नी॑ इ॒मे वि॑ष्फु॒रन्ती॑ अ॒मित्रा॑न्
verses.transliteration: té ācárantī sámaneva yóṣā  mātéva putrám bibhr̥tām upásthe  ápa śátrūn vidhyatāṃ saṃvidāné  ā́rtnī imé viṣphurántī amítrān

translation.text: These, meeting like a woman and her lover, bear, mother-like, their child upon their bosom. May the two Bow-ends, starting swift asunder, scatter, in unison, the foes who hate us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ब॒ह्वी॒नां पि॒ता ब॒हुर॑स्य पु॒त्रश्चि॒श्चा कृ॑णोति॒ सम॑नाव॒गत्य॑ इ॒षु॒धिः सङ्काः॒ पृत॑नाश्च॒ सर्वाः॑ पृ॒ष्ठे निन॑द्धो जयति॒ प्रसू॑तः
verses.transliteration: bahvīnā́m pitā́ bahúr asya putráś  ciścā́ kr̥ṇoti sámanāvagátya  iṣudhíḥ sáṅkāḥ pŕ̥tanāś ca sárvāḥ  pr̥ṣṭhé nínaddho jayati prásūtaḥ

translation.text: With many a son, father of many daughters, He clangs and clashes as he goes to battle. Slung on the back, pouring his brood, the Quiver vanquishes all opposing bands and armies.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रथे॒ तिष्ठ॑न्नयति वा॒जिनः॑ पु॒रो यत्र॑यत्र का॒मय॑ते सुषार॒थिः अ॒भीशू॑नां महि॒मानं॑ पनायत॒ मनः॑ प॒श्चादनु॑ यच्छन्ति र॒श्मयः॑
verses.transliteration: ráthe tíṣṭhan nayati vājínaḥ puró  yátra-yatra kāmáyate suṣārathíḥ  abhī́śūnām mahimā́nam panāyata  mánaḥ paścā́d ánu yachanti raśmáyaḥ

translation.text: Upstanding in the Car the skilful Charioteer guides his strong Horses on whithersoe'er he will. See and admire the strength of those controlling Reins which from behind declare the will of him who drives.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ती॒व्रान्घोषा॑न्कृण्वते॒ वृष॑पाण॒योऽश्वा॒ रथे॑भिः स॒ह वा॒जय॑न्तः अ॒व॒क्राम॑न्तः॒ प्रप॑दैर॒मित्रा॑न्क्षि॒णन्ति॒ शत्रूँ॒रन॑पव्ययन्तः
verses.transliteration: tīvrā́n ghóṣān kr̥ṇvate vŕ̥ṣapāṇayaḥ-  -áśvā ráthebhiḥ sahá vājáyantaḥ  avakrā́mantaḥ prápadair amítrān  kṣiṇánti śátrūm̐r ánapavyayantaḥ

translation.text: Horses whose hoofs rain dust are neighing loudly, yoked to the Chariots, showing forth their vigour, With their forefeet descending on the foemen, they, never flinching, trample and destroy them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: र॒थ॒वाह॑नं ह॒विर॑स्य॒ नाम॒ यत्रायु॑धं॒ निहि॑तमस्य॒ वर्म॑ तत्रा॒ रथ॒मुप॑ श॒ग्मं स॑देम वि॒श्वाहा॑ व॒यं सु॑मन॒स्यमा॑नाः
verses.transliteration: rathavā́hanaṃ havír asya nā́ma  yátrā́yudhaṃ níhitam asya várma  tátrā rátham úpa śagmáṃ sadema  viśvā́hā vayáṃ sumanasyámānāḥ

translation.text: Car-bearer is the name of his oblation, whercon are laid his Weapons and his Armour. So let us here, each day that passes, honour the helpful Car with hearts exceeding joyful.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्वा॒दु॒षं॒सदः॑ पि॒तरो॑ वयो॒धाः कृ॑च्छ्रे॒श्रितः॒ शक्ती॑वन्तो गभी॒राः चि॒त्रसे॑ना॒ इषु॑बला॒ अमृ॑ध्राः स॒तोवी॑रा उ॒रवो॑ व्रातसा॒हाः
verses.transliteration: svāduṣaṃsádaḥ pitáro vayodhā́ḥ  kr̥chreśrítaḥ śáktīvanto gabhīrā́ḥ  citrásenā íṣubalā ámr̥dhrāḥ  satóvīrā urávo vrātasāhā́ḥ

translation.text: In sweet association lived the fathers who gave us life, profound and strong in trouble, Unwearied, armed with shafts and wondrous weapons, free, real heroes, conquerors of armies.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ब्राह्म॑णासः॒ पित॑रः॒ सोम्या॑सः शि॒वे नो॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी अ॑ने॒हसा॑ पू॒षा नः॑ पातु दुरि॒तादृ॑तावृधो॒ रक्षा॒ माकि॑र्नो अ॒घशं॑स ईशत
verses.transliteration: brā́hmaṇāsaḥ pítaraḥ sómyāsaḥ  śivé no dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ anehásā  pūṣā́ naḥ pātu duritā́d r̥tāvr̥dho  rákṣā mā́kir no agháśaṃsa īśata

translation.text: The Brahmans, and the Fathers meet for Soma-draughts, and, graciously inclined, unequalled Heaven and Earth. Guard us trom evil, Pûshan, guard us strengtheners of Law: let not the evil-wisher master us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒प॒र्णं व॑स्ते मृ॒गो अ॑स्या॒ दन्तो॒ गोभिः॒ संन॑द्धा पतति॒ प्रसू॑ता यत्रा॒ नरः॒ सं च॒ वि च॒ द्रव॑न्ति॒ तत्रा॒स्मभ्य॒मिष॑वः॒ शर्म॑ यंसन्
verses.transliteration: suparṇáṃ vaste mr̥gó asyā dánto  góbhiḥ sáṃnaddhā patati prásūtā  yátrā náraḥ sáṃ ca ví ca drávanti  tátrāsmábhyam íṣavaḥ śárma yaṃsan

translation.text: Her tooth a deer, dressed in an eagle's feathers, bound with cow-hide, launched forth, She flieth onward. There where the heroes speed hither and thither, there may the Arrows shelter and protect us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋजी॑ते॒ परि॑ वृङ्धि॒ नोऽश्मा॑ भवतु नस्त॒नूः सोमो॒ अधि॑ ब्रवीतु॒ नोऽदि॑तिः॒ शर्म॑ यच्छतु
verses.transliteration: ŕ̥jīte pári vr̥ṅdhi naḥ-  -áśmā bhavatu nas tanū́ḥ  sómo ádhi bravītu naḥ-  -áditiḥ śárma yachatu

translation.text: Avoid us thou whose flight is straight, and let our bodies be as stone. May Soma kindly speak to us, and Aditi protect us well.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ ज॑ङ्घन्ति॒ सान्वे॑षां ज॒घनाँ॒ उप॑ जिघ्नते अश्वा॑जनि॒ प्रचे॑त॒सोऽश्वा॑न्त्स॒मत्सु॑ चोदय
verses.transliteration: ā́ jaṅghanti sā́nv eṣāṃ  jaghánām̐ úpa jighnate  áśvājani prácetasaḥ-  -áśvān samátsu codaya

translation.text: He lays his blows upon their backs, he deals his blows upon their thighs. Thou, Whip, who urgest horses, drive sagacious horses in the fray.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अहि॑रिव भो॒गैः पर्ये॑ति बा॒हुं ज्याया॑ हे॒तिं प॑रि॒बाध॑मानः ह॒स्त॒घ्नो विश्वा॑ व॒युना॑नि वि॒द्वान्पुमा॒न्पुमां॑सं॒ परि॑ पातु वि॒श्वतः॑
verses.transliteration: áhir iva bhogaíḥ páry eti bāhúṃ  jyā́yā hetím paribā́dhamānaḥ  hastaghnó víśvā vayúnāni vidvā́n  púmān púmāṃsam pári pātu viśvátaḥ

translation.text: It compasses the arm with serpent windings, fending away the friction of the bowstring: So may the Brace, well-skilled in all its duties, guard manfully the man from every quarter.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आला॑क्ता॒ या रुरु॑शी॒र्ष्ण्यथो॒ यस्या॒ अयो॒ मुख॑म् इ॒दं प॒र्जन्य॑रेतस॒ इष्वै॑ दे॒व्यै बृ॒हन्नमः॑
verses.transliteration: ā́lāktā yā́ rúruśīrṣṇī-  átho yásyā áyo múkham  idám parjányaretase-  íṣvai devyaí br̥hán námaḥ

translation.text: Now to the Shaft with venom smeared, tipped with deer-horn, with iron mouth, Celestial, of Parjanya's seed, be this great adoration paid.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अव॑सृष्टा॒ परा॑ पत॒ शर॑व्ये॒ ब्रह्म॑संशिते गच्छा॒मित्रा॒न्प्र प॑द्यस्व॒ मामीषां॒ कं च॒नोच्छि॑षः
verses.transliteration: ávasr̥ṣṭā párā pata  śáravye bráhmasaṃśite  gáchāmítrān prá padyasva  mā́mī́ṣāṃ káṃ canóc chiṣaḥ

translation.text: Loosed from the Bowstring fly away, thou Arrow, sharpened by our prayer. Go to the foemen, strike them home, and let not one be left alive.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्र॑ बा॒णाः स॒म्पत॑न्ति कुमा॒रा वि॑शि॒खा इ॑व तत्रा॑ नो॒ ब्रह्म॑ण॒स्पति॒रदि॑तिः॒ शर्म॑ यच्छतु वि॒श्वाहा॒ शर्म॑ यच्छतु
verses.transliteration: yátra bāṇā́ḥ sampátanti  kumārā́ viśikhā́ iva  tátrā no bráhmaṇas pátir  -áditiḥ śárma yachatu  viśvā́hā śárma yachatu

translation.text: There where the flights of Arrows fall like boys whose locks are yet unshorn. Even there may Brahmaṇaspati, and Aditi protect us well, protect us well through all our days.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मर्मा॑णि ते॒ वर्म॑णा छादयामि॒ सोम॑स्त्वा॒ राजा॒मृते॒नानु॑ वस्ताम् उ॒रोर्वरी॑यो॒ वरु॑णस्ते कृणोतु॒ जय॑न्तं॒ त्वानु॑ दे॒वा म॑दन्तु
verses.transliteration: mármāṇi te vármaṇā chādayāmi  sómas tvā rā́jāmŕ̥tenā́nu vastām  urór várīyo váruṇas te kr̥ṇotu  jáyantaṃ tvā́nu devā́ madantu

translation.text: Thy vital parts I cover with thine Armour: with immortality King Soma clothe thee. Varuṇa give tliee what is more than ample, and in thy triumph may the Gods be joyful.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो नः॒ स्वो अर॑णो॒ यश्च॒ निष्ट्यो॒ जिघां॑सति दे॒वास्तं सर्वे॑ धूर्वन्तु॒ ब्रह्म॒ वर्म॒ ममान्त॑रम्
verses.transliteration: yó naḥ svó áraṇo  yáś ca níṣṭyo jíghāṃsati  devā́s táṃ sárve dhūrvantu  bráhma várma mámā́ntaram

translation.text: Whoso would kill us, whether he be a strange foe or one of us, May all the Gods discomfit him. My nearest, closest Mail is prayer.
